Robert is a 31-year-old married man with five children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a four-roomed semi-permanent house.
Robert wants a loan to buy more soft drinks, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for resale in his retail shop. Having started from growing sugar cane and beans, he dreams of setting up a wholesale shop for himself, building a permanent house for his family, and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah A., 41, a resident of Pulido, GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Belleza A., her business partner, and is the mother of five children, three of whom are studying in public elementary school, one in college and the other is already working. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Sarah, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.
Sarah has operated a candle-making business for nine years now. With nine employees, including her husband, Sarah is able to run the business with confidence. She has been able to establish patrons who have become wholesalers of her candles, not only in the local community but also in neighboring towns and cities. Monthly, Sarah earns an estimated net income of around 12,000 PHP.
To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She plans to use this loan to buy more raw materials needed for her candle-making business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Sarah dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work in her business. As a Christian family, by faith she claims that her business will become even more successful to also be of help to their growing local church. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed to make candles.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Yeabu. She is a widow and has four children – one girl aged 14 and three boys aged 10, 18 and 22. She has one additional dependant who is her relative.
Yeabu has been selling slippers and men and women's footwear for the past seven years. She opens her business seven days a week for eleven hours a day. Yeabu has a good loan repayment history. She needs a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to help her buy more slippers and other footwear for her business. She hopes to see all her children through their education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers and other footwear for her business.

loans.name: Kurusumu

texts.en: Kurusumu is a 37-year-old mother with five children. She comes from the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. Kurusumu wants a loan to buy two hairdryers, cosmetics and hair extensions for the beauty salon that she has run for three years. She started her salon from the profit she got from selling a cow that she inherited from her grandmother. She dreams of setting up an animal farm and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy two hairdryers, cosmetics and hair extensions for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Amonjon

texts.en:
Amonjon is married and has three children. He sells men's shirts and fabrics for sewing women's national dresses. Vladimir has been in this business for six years. He inherited the business from his parents. Amonjon is young and is full of energy to develop this business further, for it is the only income for his family. Amonjon would like to borrow $2000 US to increase the assortment of goods he sells. He plans to increase sales during the coming summer season and he needs to get ready for it. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy men's shirts, and fabrics used for women's national dresses

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 26-year-old married lady and has three children. Her husband Ayman works abroad for an electrical installation company. 

Iman was motivated by her passion for sewing and fashion to start up a small business at home, so she bought a sewing machine and started to design and sell clothes a year ago.

Now she is applying for this loan to buy a new sewing machine since the one she has now is old and slow.

"Iman is a conservative person who didn't want her photo published on the internet. So, her Sister Samira appears in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and to produce shoes for his business

loans.name: Natercia Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Natercia da Conceicao T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 05 a 18 anos, os mais velhos continuam a estudar. Fez somente 9ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Maputo para Boane com a sua familia quando concluiram a nova residencia, tem um negocio proprio ha mais de 5 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, amendoim, acucar, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 8.300.00, 10.450.00, 12.000.00 e 15.000.00mt para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para ampliar a sua banca.
texts.en:
Natercia da Conceicao T. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, ages 5 to 18. The elder children are still in school. Natercia only finished ninth grade and did not continue due to financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Maputo to move to Boane with her family when they finished building their new home. She has had her own business for more than five years. She has no employees and has a monthly income of 5,500 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She is also able to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are customers of this institution. This is Natercia's fifth loan with Hluvuku, and she is asking for 25,000 meticais. She intends to buy products (soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth and other items) to increase the amount of stock she has. The previous loans were for 8,300 meticais, 10,450 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais and were for the business.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out more loans in the future. She intends to ask for other loans to expand her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy products (soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth, etc.)

loans.name: Kiburara Tweheyo Group

texts.en:
44-year-old K. Mary has been partial to farming since 2001. Mary says, to take root in this worthwhile business, she relied on money from a small goat sales business. The happy-go-lucky mother of three practices her farming in Kiburara-Ibanda. 

To open better horizons for her business, her stocks in trade have been diligence, determination, good human relationship skills and prayer. She says she has been able to make strides in terms of better profits and the provision of better welfare for her family because of this business. 

Mary says her future plans are for the expansion of her farming gardens where she has for the most part been planting, harvesting, and selling bananas, cassava, cabbages, beans, rice and pumpkins. Weekly she says this business generates shillings 50,000 as profit. She says with this loan she is going to pay school fees for her kids.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her kids.

loans.name: Ana Inguane

texts.pt:
Ana Inguane T. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 9 filhos dos quais ja nao se recorda das idades. alguns continuam a estudar. Nao teve formacao academica porque os pais nao dipunham de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta alguns netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Matola para Boane com a sua familia ha bastante tempo procurando melhores condicoes de vida, tem um negocio proprio ha mais de 20 anos que desensevolve com ajuda de uma das filhas. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu sexto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, refrescos, amendoim, acucar, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.600.00, 6.000.00, 10.000.00, 13.000.00 e 22.000.00mt aplicados para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial no seu quintal.
texts.en:
Ana Inguane T. was born in the city of Matola, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique.  She is a married mother of 9 children whose ages she no longer remembers.  Some of them are still in school.  She did not attend school because her parents did not have the financial resources.  She lives in her own home with her family, and she also supports some of her grandchildren who live with her.  

She left Matola for Boane with her family many years ago in search of better living conditions.  She has had her own business for more than 20 years, which she runs with the help of one of her daughters.  She does not have any employees and she earns 4.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She saves part of her earnings through Xitique, a traditional system of rotating savings.  

She has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through her friends who are also clients.  This loan for 21,000.00mt is her sixth with Hluvuku, which she will use to purchase products (fish, soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth, etc.) to increase her inventory.  Her previous loans were for 6.600.00, 6.000.00, 10.000.00, 13.000.00 and 22.000.00mt, which were used for her business. 

She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to additional loans in the future.  She plans to request new loans to build a shop on her property.

loans.use: to purchase products (fish, soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth, etc. )

loans.name: Alymkul's Group

texts.en:
Alymkul K., 51, is the leader of this group. Just like many other residents of Kochkor,  Alymkul is engaged in agriculture. The entire family tries to help her out in finding better and better techniques for ploughing, watering and cultivating land. Her husband has been a member of a local farming community for a long time. He is a skilled technician and always knows how to use the right technology for the right kind of product. 

The family raises agricultural products starting from grains and berries, but also rare kinds of vegetables. Several years ago Alymkul managed to save a small amount to purchase electrical appliances for the house. The initial capital, invested nineteen years ago, was not in vain, since nowadays a monthly income from wholesaling vegetables reaches 5,000 soms.

 Alymkul says the equipment needed for field work is getting exhausted and is out of order, therefore she gathered this group and applied for a loan from Kiva. The requested loan will be spent on fuels and lubricants and food processing. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and lubricants and do food processing.

loans.name: Audencia Zaqueu

texts.pt:
Audencia Zaqueu M. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos  de 22 e 25 anos de idade todos ainda vao a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao tinham condicoes financeiras para ela continuar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e nao sustenta mais ninguem para alem da sua familia.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negocio proprio em sua casa e desenvolve ha mais de 6 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de  6.000.00mt a 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte mensalmente em sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (Guarda fatos, mesa, cadeiras, estantes, comodas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. O emprestimo anterior foi de 15.000.00 e foi aplicado para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um salao de cabeleirero e uma banca comercial.
texts.en:
Audencia Zaqueu M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of two children ages 22 and 25, who are still in school.  She only completed school through the sixth grade because her parents did not have the financial resources for her to continue.  She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.  

She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo.  She has had her own business out of her home for more than 6 years.  She does not have any employees and she earns around 6.000.00mt to 7.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some of her monthly earnings in her bank account.  

Audencia has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, for 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.) to increase her inventory.  Her prior loan was for 15.000.00 and was used for her business. 

She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to other loans in the future.  She plans to request new loans to build a hair salon and a bank.

loans.use: to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.).

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Юлдашов Шухрат проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее. Уже три года как он занимается животноводством. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Shuhrat Y. lives in Shahrituz. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education. He has been working in animal husbandry for three years.  He primarily fattens and sells cattle. He is taking out a loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls, baskets, baby bathtubs, and other plastic utensils.

loans.name: Luisa Isaias

texts.pt:
Luisa Isaias N. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casada. Fez somente 3ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao a deixaram continuar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Maputo para o Distrito de Boane quando se casou, tem um negocio proprio que desenvolve ha mais de 26 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de  3.000.00mt  e conta com ajuda do marido que tem a pensao da companhia Industrial este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte mensalmente em sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversa com suas amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo alimentar, arroz, sabao, feijao e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de  7.000.00 e 10.000.00 e ambos foram aplicados para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial para deixar de ser vendedora ambulante.
texts.en:
Luisa Isaias N. was born in the city of Maputo, in the Province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is married.  She only completed school through the 3rd grade because her parents did not allow her to continue.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports 2 nephews who live with her.  

She left Maputo for Boane when she got married.  She has had her own business for more than 26 years.  She does not have any employees and earns about 3.000.00mt per month.  She has help from her husband who receives a pension from an industrial company.  The money covers household expenses and she saves some monthly in her bank account. 

She has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a conversation with friends who are also clients of the organization.  This is her third loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt.  She will use the loan to purchase products (cooking oil, rice, soap, beans, etc.) to increase her inventory.  Her prior loans were for 7.000.00 and 10.000.00, both of which were used for her business.  

She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to other loans in the future.  She plans to request new loans to build a shop and no longer sell her products in the streets.

loans.use: to purchase products (cooking oil, rice, soap, beans, etc.)

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Berthé est homme marié de 31 ans et père de 2 enfants qui vit dans une famille monogame avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni, préfecture de Bougouni  (Région de Sikasso).
Monsieur Moussa Berthé a fréquenté l’école moderne jusqu’en classe de 10 ème année (Système éducatif Malien), qu’il abandonna au profit des activités génératrices de revenus et cela à cause des difficultés dans sa famille. Il tenta pendant des années différentes activités, mais sans succès, en raison surtout de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement.
Il finit par apprendre auprès de son oncle la vente d’articles divers de boutique. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, il maîtrise son activité. Sa boutique est située dans le quartier Torakabougou.
Pour renforcer son activité, il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso pour obtenir un prêt afin  d’acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (Capitale de République du Mali) et parfois à Bougouni auprès des grossistes. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour  agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Berthé is a 31-year-old married man and father of two children. He lives in a monogamous family with his wife and children in the Torakabougou district of the city of Bougouni, prefecture of Bougouni (region of Sikasso).

Mr. Moussa Berthé attended modern school up to the 10th grade (Malian educational system). He quit school to start earning a living due to his family experiencing difficulties. Over the years, he attempted various activities without success, mainly due to a lack of sufficient working capital.

He eventually learned the business of selling sundries from his uncle. With five years of experience, he now has a good command of his activity. His shop is located in the district of Torakabougou.

To strengthen its business, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for a loan to purchase various merchandise for his shop. He gets his stock from wholesalers in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali), and sometimes in Bougouni as well. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. His clientele consists of local people.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which he will use to expand his shop.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his sundries shop

loans.name: Casimiro Nhamuge

texts.pt:
Casimiro Nhamazane S. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique solteiro. Fez somente 2ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao dispunham de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 4 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo devido a guerra e veio com a sua familia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade que desenvolve ha mais de 20 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de  4.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversa com amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, sabao, feijao, amendoim e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de  9.000.00mt ambos e para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial de raiz como forma de melhorar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Casimiro Nhamazane S. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique, and he is single. He only finished second grade and did not continue with school because his parents could not afford it. He lives in his own house with his family and supports four relatives (nephews and/or nieces) who live with him.

He left Gaza to move to Maputo because of the war, and he came here with his family. For more than 20 years he has had his own business selling staple goods. Casimiro has no employees and has a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais, which he uses for household expenses. He is also able to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

Casimiro has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku by talking with friends who are customers of this institution. This is his third Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (rice, soap, beans, peanuts and other items) to increase his inventory. The previous loans were both for 9,000 meticais and were for the business.

He promises to make his payments on time so he can take out more loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to build a brand-new store as a way of improving his business.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, soap, beans, peanuts, etc.)

loans.name: Sop Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP MOHAMED est créé le 27 août 2009. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont monté leur groupe par voisinage et par liens d'affinité. Le groupe fait du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3

Madame KATY C. (debout à droite de la photo en tee-shirt jaune) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de vêtements et de parfums. Elle pratique cette activité avant qu'elle n'adhère au Banc Villageois

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'aller à la capitale (Dakar) pour s'approvisionner en marchandises (vêtements et parfums)

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille (nourriture, santé, scolarité des enfants etc.)
texts.en:
The SOP MOHAMED solidarity group was created August 27, 2009. It is composed of eleven women who are all from the same neighborhood. They came together as neighbors and through bonds of affinity. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of MONTAGNE NORD3.  

Mrs. Katy C. (standing on the right and wearing a yellow shirt) is the head of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two (2) children. She is also responsible for two other children who were entrusted to her by relatives. She has a small business selling clothes and perfumes, an activity she was already engaged in prior to joining the Banc Villageois.  Her new loan will allow her to go to the capital (Dakar) to stock up on merchandise (clothing and perfume). Her goal is to help her husband in supporting the family (food, health care, children's tuition, etc.)

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfume for resale

loans.name: Ana Joaquim

texts.pt:
Ana Joaquim M. nasceu no Distrito de Massinga, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique separada mae de 2 filhos de 09 e 13 anos todos ainda continuam a estudar. Fez somente 6ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao dispunham de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e nao sustenta mais ninguem.

Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo em casa do seu irmao a busca de melhores condicoes de vida. Trabalha numa empresa de producao e venda de Banana no Distrito de Boane ha mais de 9 anos, e recebe um salario de 1.690.00mt por mes e 850.00mt provenientes do seu negocio aplica nas despasas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversa com colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 9.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construcao ( chapas de zinco, cimento, arros de porta e outros) para continuar com a construcao da sua casa.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para concluir a sua casa para poder albergar familiares que se encontram na sua terra natal e ampliar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Ana Joaquim M. was born in Massinga District, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. She is separated and has two children, ages 9 and 13. Both children are still in school. Ana only finished sixth grade and did not continue with school because her parents could not afford it. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Inhambane to move to her brother's house in Maputo in search of better living conditions. For more than nine years she has worked in a banana production and sales company in Boane District. She receives a salary of 1,690 meticais per month and earns 850 meticais from her own business. Ana uses this money for household expenses and is able to save some through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

She has never had loans with other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku by talking with coworkers who are customers of this institution. This is Ana's first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 9,000 meticais to buy construction material (zinc sheets, cement, door frames and other items) to continue construction on her house.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out more loans in the future. She intends to ask for more loans to finish her house so she can house relatives from her hometown, and she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy construction material (zinc sheets, cement, door frames, etc.)

loans.name: Katty

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Katty K..  She is a widow and has one child aged 17. In 2007, Katty established her plastic slippers and sandals business. She began her business because she realised that it was necessary that she also become productive in her marital home. Her business is open 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.

Katty would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Katty requires a loan in order to purchase a large quantity of plastic slippers and sandals for her business. "Now that I have lost my husband and I do not have anyone to help me support my child, my business is the only solution to my problems," said Katty. "I wish to see my child through her education."  

Katty thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers and sandals.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Grace W. G. has been supplying building materials to her customers in Mwiki town .She is 49 years old, widowed and a mother of four children. Her monthly income is KES.45,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, who is registered member with KADET, and she is applying for her first loan of KES.30,000 to buy more building stones for sale .The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children and expand her business by starting a milk bar.

In future she desires to grow her business and buy a deep freezer for the milk business.

loans.use: To buy building stones for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is a married mother of a 15-year-old son, and she lives with her family in Mariakani, Coast province. Grace is a retail business-lady and has operated a retail shop for seven years. It has been a success.

This marks Grace’s third time borrowing from KADET LTD and with this new loan she plans to add more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks. Grace has been using her income to expand her business and in repaying back the previous loan and she hopes to do the same with the anticipated profits from her shop.

She hopes to expand her shop even further and later diversify to other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and wheat flour, sugar, tea leaves, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase various items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bed sheets for resale

loans.name: Mahudjro- Kadjacome Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MAHUDJRO- KADJACOME est formé de quatre personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier à Lokokoukoumè (dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji). La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sènoumè Antoinette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la sixième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité.
Sènoumè Antoinette est mariée à un démarcheur du nom de Hubert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant à leur charge. Sènoumè Antoinette habite à Lokokoukoumè avec ses enfants et son mari depuis sept ans. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a près de cinq ans que Sènoumè Antoinette mène comme activité la vente  de friperies de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sènoumè Antoinette  vend des beignets. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sènoumè Antoinette désire obtenir un autre financement, ensemble avec ses autres membres.
texts.en:
The MAHUDJRO-KADJACOME group consists of four people who all live in the same district in Lokokoukoumè (in the town of Sèmè-Podji). The group’s representative is Sènoumè Antoinette, seen in the photo with her hand raised. The group is seeking financial support from ALIDé for the sixth time to bolster their activities.

Sènoumè Antoinette is married to a door-to-door salesman named Hubert. The couple have three dependent children who all attend school. Sènoumè Antoinette has been living in Lokokoukoumè for seven years with her husband and children. The couple handle together the various family expenses. 
Sènoumè Antoinette has been selling used clothing door to door for nearly five years. She also sells beignets as a secondary activity. 

In order to strengthen her business and better meet customer demand, Sènoumè Antoinette is seeking a new loan along with the other group members.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Fatu K.. She is married and has three children who are all independent and are employed. She has three dependents, who are children of relatives that live in a village where educational facilities are very poor. They live with her instead so they can get a good education. 

In 1980, Fatu established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed to assist her husband to give adequate support to their children. She opens her business six days a week for nine hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL). Fatu requires a loan in order to buy poplin, lace, bail wax, cotton and khaki materials. As with her own children, Fatu wishes to see her dependants through their education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy poplin, lace, bail wax, cotton and khaki materials

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni sells tea and bread. She is 28 years old, married, and has one child who does not go to school. Poni took out a loan to stock more tea and bread to sell. She hopes to pay her child's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tea and bread to sell.

loans.name: Aniyali Amanyi Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca, 36, has been engaged in a stone quarry business venture the last four years. Such a business requires an awful lot of elbow grease and most times many people associate it with only men. Rebecca, a mother to two, has however taken it upon herself to manifest that even women can succeed in a male-dominated business. She and her laborers operate from Kikonge in Mityana. 

She says she was introduced to this business by a close friend and she says she is able to make profits to the tune of 80,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) a week. She says with this loan she is going to purchase more hammers to be used in the quarry. At the time the photo was being taken, two group members were not present and are marked as unpictured. One other lady in the photo had her face a little bit obscured and is also marked as unpictured.

loans.use: to buy more hammers to be used in the quarry

loans.name: Rwensinga Twimukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
B. Jane is the leader of Rwensinga Twimukye group, Ibanda. She is 42 years old and married with children. Jane has a grocery store in Rwensinga trading centre where she sells yellow bananas, tomatoes, and so on. She sells from the side of the road near a school and restaurants. She is able to make 50,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) as weekly profits and in addition, she has a produce selling business and a retail shop. 

She works with one of her children and she is happy that she can collect their school fees with the help of her husband. She has been using loans from Pearl Microfinance for over four years now and her life has greatly improved. Jane needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for resale.

loans.use: to buy more stock for resale.

loans.name: Gédéon Plus Group

texts.en:
“Gédéon Plus” is a Community Bank made up of 11 micro entrepreneurs whose chairwoman is Lola Y.. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Lola is 55 years old and single. She has been in business since 2002. She originally ran a restaurant. Today she sells lamp oil at her place located east of the city of Kinshasa. She likes her business because it allows her to become financially independent and has stabilized her family economically. 

Lola has been a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC, and has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by purchasing more oil in bulk.  She will resell it with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $50.  Lola has three children between 8 and 34 years old. Two of them attend school.  Her ambition is to open an oil storage facility.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying more lamp oil and reselling it at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Benard S. W. is 41 years old, married, and a father of four wonderful children.  They live in Kitale town.  Benard sells newspapers and magazines there and has been doing this business for thirteen years.   He earns a monthly income of forty-eight thousand shillings.

This will be Benard's first loan from KADET LTD., and he wants to use the entire loan to add new stock to his business.  He would like to buy new magazines, newspapers etc,.   With the income, he will repay the loan and also expand his business.

In the future, Benard wants to educate his children to the highest level, also to expand and start another business.

loans.use: To buy more stock, like magazines

loans.name: William

texts.en: William J. is currently in a business of selling sugar.  She is 42 years old and married, with 5 children, all of  whom go to school.  She has requested a loan to stock more sugar to sell.  With extra profits from her business, she hopes to build a house for renting in the future .

loans.use: to stock more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Monica Fiorella

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente tiene 2 hijos  menores de  8  y 2 años de edad,  vive en casa de su suegra desde hace 8 años, ya que su vivienda aun no esta construida,su cónyuge trabaja como operario en construcción, Monica se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora desde hace 2 años ella como toda joven tiene sueños y metas y uno de ellos es poder tener su propio puesto de ropa, Con el dinero surtira  su mercadería por cambio de estación.
texts.en:
26-year old Sra. Mónica has lived with her partner and their two children aged 8 and 2 in her mother-in-law’s house for eight years as her own house is not yet built. Her partner works in construction. 

Mónica has been selling clothing door-to-door for the last two years. Ever since she was a young girl, she has had dreams and goals. One of them is to own a clothing stall. With the loan she plans buy new stock appropriate for the time of year.

loans.use: to buy new stock appropriate for the time of year

loans.name: Gnambossou-Gbeta 01 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA 01 est composé D. 17 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier. La présidente D. ce groupement, du nom D. Marie Thérèse, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but D. rehausser le niveau D. leur activité afin D. mieux faire face à la demanD. D. leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier D. ALIDé.
Marie Thérèse est mariée à un certain Pauline et a six enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales.  Il y a une dizaine d’année que Marie Thérèse et son mari se sont  installés à Aïbatin, un quartier D. Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marie Thérèse  n’est jamais allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux D. sa famille, Marie Thérèse mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs, la vente D. produits vivriers par le système D. distribution. C'est à Zè et à Ikpinlè que Marie Thérèse s'approvisionne. Dans le but D. renforcer son activité et D. mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Marie Thérèse sollicite un crédit auprès D. ALIDé. Son ambition est d’amener son activité à un niveau plus élevé.
texts.en:
GNAMBOSSOU-GBETA group is composed of 17 members who live in the same neighborhood. The group leader, Marie Thérèse, is raising her hand in the photograph. In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, the group is seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Marie Thérèse is married to Paulin, and she has six children who all attend school. The couple takes care of the various family expenses together. About ten years ago, the couple moved in to Aïbatin, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin.

Marie Thérèse never attended school. For ten years, she's been selling food products through the distribution system, in order to proviD. for herself and her family. She gets her supplies in Zè and Ikpinlè. In order to bolster her business and better meet customer demand, she's seeking a loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to take her business to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen  Sánchez Torres, vive en la localidad de Ángel Alvino Corzo, un lugar muy bonito donde su gente es muy popular. Ella vive en unión libre con el señor Jose Trinidad Mejía  Gómez  y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad: Guadalupe, Gabriela  y el más pequeño es José Arturo.
     Solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos por catalogo  de la marca Andrea y Terra, en donde lleva  un año y cuatro meses  de lo que nos cometa que le va bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos. Para dedicarse a esta actividad la  inspiro su esposo para así desarrollarse en sus gastos económicos.
      Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo  ahorra  para comprar más zapatos  y tenga lo suficiente para que su clientela obtenga lo que desea comprar  a su gusto.
      Su más grande deseo es que con la  ayuda de dios y el préstamo logre comprar un terreno donde pueda construir una casa más grande, así podrá vivir mas cómoda con su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs Maria del Carmen Sánchez Torres lives in the Ángel Alvino Corzo town, a very beautiful place with many people. She is in a common-law marriage with Mr. Jose Trinidad Mejía  Gómez, with whom she has three children who are under their care: Guadalupe, Gabriela, and the youngest, Jose Arturo.
She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of shoes from the Andrea y Terra catalogue. She has been doing this for one year and four months, and she tells us that it is going well and she has made a good income. Her husband inspired her to do this work in order to contribute to the household costs.

She saves her income to buy more shoes in order to have enough that her customers can obtain what they most want to buy.

Her greatest wish is that, with the help of God and this loan, she will be able to buy a plot of land to build a bigger home, in order to be able to live more comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of shoes from a catalogue

loans.name: Perine

texts.en: Perine is 28 years old.  She has 2 children who are  7 and 5 years old, and they are both in school.  Perine owns a general store in which she sells rice, sugar and cooking oil. She has been running this store for 3 years with her husband.  This has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more rice and sugar.  With the profits, she hopes to save as much as possible so that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more Cosmetics.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald S. W. is a 27 year-old man and is married and a father of three children.  They live in Matisi in the outskirts of Kitale.   He makes molasses and sells to his customers in the same area. He has been in this business for eight years now, and he gets a monthly income of  KES.30,000.

This will be Ronald’s first loan from KADET LTD.   He plans to use the loan to buy three tanks of molasses for sale.   With the income, he will buy a plot of land.

In the future, he wants to provide for his family and also expand his business.

loans.use: to buy three tanks of molasses

loans.name: Winner Plus Group

texts.en:
Auguy is the chairman of a Community Bank named “Winner Plus” which is composed of 12 members.  These entrepreneurs are united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Auguy is 39 years old and single.  He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2005.  He runs a cellphone booth and has a money changer business in the southwest of Kinshasa. He works hard to gain good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a large store in his area. His business brings in $105 per week. 

Auguy is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having received and successfully repaid four previous loans. With this new loan, he will increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing phone accessories to resell at a profit. Auguy is very happy to be part of Hope’s groups because it will help him achieve his dreams.

loans.use: increase his inventory of phone accessories

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Amirabeth

texts.es:
La señora Amirabeth  Sánchez Gómez, es originaria de Ángel Albino Corzo, es casada con el señor  Ferneli  Velasco zenteno, con quien tiene dos hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad y son: Juan Carlos  y Jesús.

       Solicito el préstamo en fundación para invertirlo en la  compra y venta de carnes de res y cerdo, ya que para aliñarlo (destazarlo), tiene que pagar personas que la poyen, aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se encarga de vender en las comunidades cercanas de su localidad.

       Con esta actividad comenzó desde que se caso ya cuando sus hijos nacieron los gastos se incrementaron. Doña Amirabeth  desea que con este préstamo  pueda seguir trabajando así comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar y tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Amirabeth Sánchez Gómez, lives in Ángel Albino Corzo, and is married to Sr. Ferneli  Velasco Zenteno. They have two sons still in their care, Juan Carlos and Jesús.

She requests the loan from FRAC in order to invest it in buying and selling beef and pork, since in order to dress the meat (prepare the cuts) she has to pay the people who help her. She also has help from her husband, who is in charge of selling in the communities around where they live. 

She started this work after her marriage, but when her sons were born, their expenses increased. Doña Amirabeth hopes that with this loan she can continue working so she can purchase some things they don't have for their home and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for beef and pork, dress it (prepare the cuts), and then sell it.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino C. is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 17 and 19 years old. The elder son is a high school student and the younger one goes to school. Nino and her family live in Lechuri village in Telavi district. 

Nino has a grocery shop in the village. The shop is small but they have quite a good assortment of products. Nino’s husband is a joiner and he makes bee hives and frames for the bee hives. The family has 51 bee hives with bee families. All bee hives were constructed by Nino’s husband. The gathered honey is sold locally. The total income of the family is 900 laris per month.

With the requested loan, Nino and her husband plan to cultivate a plot of the land (1 ha) and sow maize. The harvested corn will be sold locally. The income from this activity will be used for further expansion of their grocery shop and the beekeeping business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for cultivating her land.

loans.name: Maria Nieves

texts.es:
La señora María Nieves  A. Jiménez, vive en el municipio de Copainala estado de Chiapas México, es madre soltera con un hijo su responsabilidad de nombre Erik de diecisiete años de edad. 

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de  ingredientes como son: carne, verduras, tortilla, entre otros, para la elaboración de comidas y luego venderlo en la miasma localidad, con esto lleva  diecisiete años y comenta que le va bien  ya que con ellos a sacado adelante a su  único hijo.

    Su motivo a realizar esta actividad fue por si solo ya que su esposo la abandono cuando su hijo estaba pequeño y por eso busco la manera de vender algo le dejara ingresos y pudiera salir delante.

    Lo que más  desea es que con este apoyo que le han brindado logre aumentar más y mejorar su cocina, para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María Nieves A. Jiménez lives in Copainala, in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. She is a single mother of one son, Erik, 17, who is still in her care.

She requests the loan in order to invest it in purchasing ingredients, including meat, vegetables, and tortillas. With this she will make food items that she then will sell in the same town. She has done this for 17 years and says that it's good because through this she has given her only son a good start in life.

She started this work after her husband left when their son was little. Since she was alone, she needed a way of selling something that would give her an income so she could make ends meet. 

Her greatest hope is that, with the support offered by FRAC, she can raise more and improve her kitchen, in order to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making food items for sale.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en: Etienne is 31 years old.  He has 4 children who are between one and nine years old. Two of his children are in school, while the other two are not yet school age. Etienne’s wife is a farmer. Etienne sells sorghum and makes a drink, called Ubushera, out of it (that's the drink in the photo).  He also sells Irish potatoes at wholesale. This business has helped Etienne feed his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and will stock enough to make more of the sorghum drink.

loans.use: to buy sorghum.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La Sra. Julia tiene 65 años D. edad es casada tiene 3 hijos  D.  30, 27 y  25   años  D. edad,  cuenta con casa propia D. material noble D. 2 pisos. Julia  tiene una  tienda bastantate surtida  y  una maquina mezcladora D. concreto, el cual lo alquila; ella se inicio en este negocio hace 2 años comenzó con la venta D. bebidas posteriormente puso su tienda. con el dinero incrementara y surtira su mercadería D. la tienda.
texts.en:
Julia is 65 years old and married.  She has three children; ages 30, 27, and 25.  She has her own two story house maD. from substantial material.

Julia has a well-stocked store and a concrete mixing machine, which she rents out.  She started this business two years ago by selling drinks.  Later she set up her store.

She will use the loan to increase her merchandise and stock her store.

loans.use: to stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Mirene

texts.es:
La señora  Mirene C. Hernández, vive en la localidad Ángel Albino corzo conocido también como Guadalupe. Ella es casada y tiene a su responsabilidad a dos nietos Alexis de quince años y Erik Jovani  de nueve.

    Ella solicito un préstamo en Fundación Realidad para invertirlo en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes pues  su mercancía se le termina muy rápido, pero con el préstamo podrá tener productos suficientes, con esta actividad lleva nueve años y comenta  que le va bien ya que así ha logrado sacar adelante  a sus dos nietos.

   Para  iniciar su actividad lo comento con su esposo para que juntos pudieran trabajar y así lograr ahorrar para poder comprar  algunas cosas que le hacían falta en su hogar y darle un bien estará a sus nietos.
   
     Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad así no este basa y sus clientes encuentre  lo que desean comprar y con ello mismo tener más ingresos y apoyar a sus nietos en su educación.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirene C. Hernández lives in Ángel Albino Corzo, also known as Guadalupe. She is married and has in her care two grandchildren, Alexis, 15, and Erik Jovani, 9.

She requests a loan from FRAC in order to invest in her small grocery store since she goes through her stock very quickly, but with the loan she could have enough products. She has had her store for 9 years and says that it's good because she has been able to give her two grandchildren a good start in life. 

She started her store after talking it over with her husband, saying that they could both work and manage to save enough so they could buy some things for their household and make their grandchildren more comfortable.

She will invest the money in her store so she doesn't run out and her customers can find what they want to buy. In this way, she can increase her earnings and support her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa K. is 33 years old.  She's currently in the business of hotel service.  She's married to a teacher, and they have six children, all of whom are in school.   Her future goal is to build a good house.

loans.use: Stock more Foods.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. W. is 36 years old and married to Margaret Wanjiku, who is a house wife.  They have one child, who is two years old.  David has been supplying charcoal in Mwiki town for 11 years and earns an income of KES.25,300 monthly.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to hire a bigger truck so that he can supply charcoal to distant places, e.g, Kitui.  The anticipated income will be used to improve the living standards of his family.

In the future, he plans to buy his own truck so that he can be responsible for fuel only and not for a rental.

loans.use: to hire a truck that can transport 150 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Bangu

texts.en: Bangu is currently in a business of selling food items in a hotel. She is 36 years old and married, with two children who go to school. Bangu requested a loan to stock more food items to sell.  In the future, she hopes to pay her children's school fees with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more food items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase different kinds of clothing for her business

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine was born in 1967.  She has 10 children between the ages of 22 and 2 ½  years. Her oldest three children are in school.  She owns a bar in which she sells skewered meat. She started this business before she was married, and now operates it together with her husband. She is requesting a loan to buy goats for slaughtering and making skewered meat.  With the profits she plans to pay for her children’s medical insurance and also to establish some savings.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughtering

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Raquel; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende en el hotel de yanahuara llamado Casa Andina, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank. The bank is located in the District of Urubamba, part of the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

Raquel is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts. She makes her sales at a hotel in Yanahuara called Casa Andina and works from 5am to 10pm. Raquel uses this business to get her children ahead in life. She is requesting the loan to buy handicrafts at wholesale.

Raquel is happy for the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts at wholesale.

loans.name: Cielito

texts.es:
La señora Cielito G., vive en la comunidad de San Francisco Tlachichilpa, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 estudian la escuela primaria, su esposo es comerciante, vende fruta y verdura en el mercado del pueblo.

Ella y su familia viven en casa de su suegra, y ahora está solicitando un préstamo para su negocio de cría de animales, ésta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años, ella nos comenta: "yo quiero progresar mas y tener mas animales para que tenga mejor rendimiento en el dinero", ella espera tener una buena inversión en los borregos y en los pollos para cuando los venda tenga mas ganancias que antes, ella compra los borregos para que se puedan multiplicar y así pueda brindar a su familia todo lo que necesitan y los pueda beneficiar. Ella espera ayudar a su esposo para que pronto puedan tener una casa propia. "Quiero hacer ahorros para darle dinero a mi esposo y acabar nuestra casa".
texts.en:
Ms. Cielito Garcia lives in the community of San Francisco Tlachichilpa. She is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are in primary school. Her husband is a merchant and sells fruit and vegetables in the town market.

She and her family live in the house of her mother-in-law, and is now asking for a loan for her animal care business. She has been doing this work for a few years and tells us "I want to be able to progress and have more animals in order to make more money." She hopes to make a good investment in lambs and chickens so that when they are sold they will be worth more than before. She buys lambs so that when they reproduce, she will be able to bring her family everything that they need and thus will benefit from the sale. She hopes to help her husband so that they can soon have their own house. She says, "I want to save to be able to give money to my husband and buy our own home."

loans.use: To buy sheep and chickens to raise.

loans.name: Bienfait Plus Group

texts.en:
Patrick, at left, is the leader of a community bank named “Bien Fait Plus,” which means "Well Done" in English. It is composed of 15 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Patrick is 32 years old and single. He runs a cellphone booth. He started his business in 2007 with initial capital of $100. He likes his business because it made more profit due to the high demand in telephone accessories. Patrick decided to diversify his business by purchasing telephone accessories in order to increase his profits. His business brings in US$50 per week. Patrick is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC who has already received four loans and has repaid them properly. He is planning with the next loan to purchase phone accessories and re-sell them at a profit. Patrick is working hard because he wants to achieve his ambition of someday opening a general store.

loans.use: to diversify his business by purchasing phone accessories cards and re-selling them at profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Tososang

texts.en: T. is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables. She is 19 years old and single. She has requested a loan to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a rental house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Mi nombre es Maria Guadalupe, vivo en san francisco tlalchichilpa, mi negocio es vender cokteles de fruta, ya tengo en carrito con el que camino para vender los vasos de coktel, solicite mi prestamo para poder comprar una lona nueva para que me cubra del sol y tambien a los cokteles, tambien quiero comprar un mantel nuevo y comprar la fruta que me hace falta, honestamente vendo bien en mi negocio por el lado de las ventas no me quejo, solo seria el estar caminando empejundo el carro y en la temporada donde hace frio pues las ventas si bajan, pero ahorita me va ir bien ya que estamos en tiempos donde hace mucho sol, y a la gente le gusta se le antoja las cosas frescas, el prestamome va ayudar a tener mas solvencia economica y mejorar mi calidad de vida, y mis deseos son terminar mi casa que empezamos hacer, tengo 2 niños que estudian, tengo 33 años de edad vivo en union libre desde hace 15 años, vivo con mi esposo el trabaja como taxista.
texts.en: "My name is Maria Guadalupe, and I live in San Francisco Tlalchichilpa. My business is selling fruit salads. I have a cart that I walk with to sell the cups of fruit salad. I am requesting my loan so that I can buy a new tarp that will protect me from the sun and will also protect the fruit salads. I would also like to buy a new coat and buy the fruit that I need. Honestly, I sell well in my business, and I can't complain about the sales; it is only the walking and pushing the cart in the season when it gets cold, because sales go down. But now it is going to go well for me, since we are in the times when there is a lot of sun, and the people like to snack on something cool. The loan will help me to have better economic solvency and improve my quality of life. My desire is to finish my house, which we have started to build. I have 2 children who are in school. I am 33 years old and I have been living in a common-law marriage for 15 years. I live with my husband who works as a taxi driver."

loans.use: to buy a new canvas tarp and fruit to make her fruit salads.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella tiene una tierra de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Francisca belongs to the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank, located in the district and province of Urubamba, Cusco department. 

Francisca is 36 years old, living in a stable relationship, and has 3 children. Daily, she operates a business selling corn. She has farm land where she grows the corn and then sells it in the Urubamba market.

Francisca wants to expand and improve her corn-sales business. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy more corn at wholesale. She looks forward to the loan and promises to comply with her scheduled payments.

loans.use: To buy corn at wholesale to resell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Me llamo Lucia, soy de san Francisco tlachichilpa, tengo una tienda pequeña donde vendo abarrotes, dulces, cosas en lata, refresco, aguas, sabritas, tengo un poco de todo, el prestamo lo pienso invertir en mi tiendita, le hacen falta mas cosas para que cuando la gente venga a comprar encuentre lo que esta buscando, y asi poco a poco poder avanzar mas, lo dificil habeces son las ventas, tambien le atribuyo esto a que no hay la suficiente mercancia para vender, por eso quiero el credito para negocio, el credito si va beneficiar a mi familia porque creo que voy a tener mas ventas y mejores ganancias, va haber mas dinero para que mi familia este mejor y tengamos otro tipo de vida, mis deseos es ver a mi negocio mas grande, mas lleno y tambien tener una papeleria ya que por estos rumbos no hay. Soy casada tengo tres hijos que estudian, mi esposo trabaja como albañil, la casa es propia y de casada tengo 14 años, de edad tengo 36 años.
texts.en:
My name is Lucia, and I am from San Francisco Tlachichilpa.  I have a small store where I sell groceries, sweets, canned goods, soft drinks, water, and chips.  I have a little bit of everything.

I plan to use the loan to invest in my little store.  I need more things so that when people come to shop they find what they are looking for.  That way I can get ahead little by little.  Sometimes it is difficult making sales.  I attribute this to not having sufficient merchandise to sell.

That is why I want the loan for my business.  The loan will benefit my family because I believe that I will have more sales and greater earnings.  There will be more money so that our family has a better standard of living.

My wish is to see my business expand.  I also want to have a stationery store because there is not one around here.

I am married and have three children who attend school.  My husband works as a bricklayer.  The house is my own.  I have been married for 14 years, and I am 36 years old.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like canned chilies, beans, bread, soft drinks and sweets

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Me llamo Soledad y me conocen como Sol todas las personas de aqui de la comunidad de San Francisco tlachichilpa, mi negocio es la cria y engorda de borregos tengo ahorita unos borregos pero son pocos los que tengo ya estan gorditos y ya los voy a vender, por eso quiero comprar ahora mas borregos para tenerlos en cria y se reproduscan y con los que tengo engorda irlos vendiendo para sacar el dinero y no quedar con los pagos en Fundación, no se me hace dificil cuidar a mis borregos, si es caro el alimento pero yo aprovecho que vivimos entre tanto monte y llano de esa manera saco a comer a mis borregos y regresan bien pansones de tanto comer, el prestamo me va ayudar para tener mas grande mi negocio y lleno de borregos, mis metas son echarle ganas y siempre ver para enfrente para salir adelante, tengo 6 hijos pero ya todos se casaron solo quedo yo y mi esposo viviendo en la casa que es propia, tengo 61 años de edad y de casada tengo 40 años.
texts.en:
My name is Soledad.  Everyone from here, the San Francisco Tlachichilpa community, knows me as Sol.

My business is raising and fattening sheep.  I now have some sheep, but not very many.  They are fat, and I am now going to sell them.  That is why I want to buy more sheep to raise and have them reproduce.  I am going to sell the fat ones that I have, and I will take out the money so that I do not have payments with the Fundación.  

It is not difficult for me to take care of my sheep.  Yes, the food is expensive, but I take advantage of the fact that we live between mountains and plains.  This way I take my sheep to feed, and they return with big bellies from eating so much.

The loan will help me have a bigger business, which is full of sheep.  My goals are to always put forth great effort and to always look forward in order to get ahead.

I have six children, but they are all married.  My husband and I are the only ones left in the house, which is our own.  I am 61 years old, and I have been married for 40 years.

loans.use: to buy lambs to raise and fatten and to buy fodder for them to eat

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Me llamo Ines, soy de la comunidad de San Francisco Talachichilpa, yo me dedico a bordar, hacer servilletas y de ves en cuando hago chamarritas para los bebes o faldas para las señoras, siempre he tejido y bordado me enseño mi madre y ha sido como ya una costumbre de estar tejiendo, vendo las cosas que hago, por ejemplo vendo mas los manteles para la mesa, cubren toda la mesa y se ven bonitos como adornos, pido el prestamo para hacer manteles y bordados, hacer servilletas y venderlas para ganar dinero, mis deseos es que asi como haga un bordado se venda, es un poco dificil vender lo que hago porque hay mucha gente que sabe bordar y se les hace normal, pero ya saliendo hay mucha gente que les gusta y les atrae el tejido, tengo 11 hijos ya son casados, vivo sola porque enviude, la casa en la que vivo es propia.
texts.en:
My name is Ines, and I am from the San Francisco Tlachichilpa community.

I embroider napkins and sometimes I make jackets for babies or skirts for women.  I have always weaved and embroidered.  My mother taught me, and it is now like a habit to be weaving.  I sell the things that I make.

For example, I sell tablecloths the most.  They cover the entire table, and they look pretty as decorations.

I am requesting a loan to make tablecloths and embroideries, to make napkins, and to sell them to earn money.

My wish is that as I make embroidery it sells.  It is a little difficult to sell what I make because a lot of people know how to embroider, and they do so regularly.  But, it now appears that a lot of people like it and are drawn to woven goods.

I have 11 children who are now married.  I live alone because I am a widow.  The house in which I live is my own.

loans.use: to buy fabric to embroider and weave

loans.name: Maria Sara

texts.es:
María, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, es comerciante D. ropa, es casada vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 7 y 9 años D. edad, el negocio fue iniciativa propia desD. hace 3 años, trabaja todos los días D. 7:00am a 4:30pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ropa y lociones, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar con la disponibilidad a los clientes, tener variedad D. mercadería y atraer a nuevos clientes.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio competente para poder financiar todos los gastos D. su familia y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria, who lives in the city of San Miguel, sells clothing. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, who are 7 and 9 years old. She set up the store on her own three years ago. She works every day from 7 am until 4:30 pm.

She is applying for a loan to purchase clothing and lotions. This investment will help her improve the selection available to her customers, have a variety or merchandise, and attract new customers.

Her objective is to manage her business competently so that she can pay for all her family's expenses and continue to advance.

loans.use: to buy clothing and lotions.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juliana; ella tiene 65 años D. edad y es viuda y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. verduras, ella venD. verduras como zanahorias, cebollas, tomates, pepinos y entre otras verduras, y por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio D. venta D. verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicinas para su hijo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the communal bank “SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHUARA.” This bank is located in the district of Urubamba which is part of the Urubamba province, belonging to the department of Cusco.

Juliana is 65 years old, widowed, and has seven children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her vegetable business; she sells items such as carrots, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other vegetables. With the income from this businss, Juliana raises her children. She would like to improve her vegetable business.

Juliana is seeking a loan to purchase medicines for her son. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for her son

loans.name: Ronald Francisco

texts.es: Ronald tiene 22 años de edad es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, Ronald tiene una mototaxi el mismo lo trabaja desde hace 1 año poniendole mucho empeño en su trabajo ya que hace movilidad escolar, Ronal como todo joven tiene sueños y metas y uno de ellos es poder adquirir otra Mototaxi asi poder crecer sus ingresos economicos, con  el dinero comprara un toldo y puerta para la mototaxi
texts.en: Ronald is 22 years old and single. He lives in his parents' house, together with his older siblings. Ronald has a moto-taxi, with which he has been working for 1 year. He puts great effort into his work, since he drives schoolchildren starting very early in the morning. Like all young people, Ronald has dreams and goals, and one of these is to acquire another moto-taxi so that he can increase his income. With the money he will buy a canvas cover and door for his moto-taxi.

loans.use: to purchase a canvas cover and a door for his mototaxi

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña guapa” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades diferentes como son las ventas de comestibles, de ropas, zapatos, etc.
Las integrantes son personas humildes que formaron un grupo para salir adelante como mujeres luchadoras y madres de familia que son capaces de lograr los objetivos propuestos, de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La sra. Venita G. es la presidenta del comité, ella es una microempresaria, comerciante, vende ropas, ella se dedica a este rubro desde hace muchos años y lo sigue realizando pues obtiene buenas ganancias. Puede sacar a su familia adelante y lograr mantener una calidad de vida estable y digna.
Ella se da cuenta que posee mucha competencia en su ramo, y más aún porque empieza la oleada de frío y hay mucha demanda de abrigos, por eso solicita el crédito para poder ponerse al día con las mercaderías, comprar en grandes cantidades los abrigos y ropas de invierno, de modo que sus clientes queden satisfechos con ella.
texts.en:
The “Kuña guapa” group is a group of neighbors in the town of  Mariano Roque Alonso. Members of the group earn their living in a variety of ways such as sales of clothing, food, shoes, and so on.

The women of this group are humble individuals who joined to form a group so that they could keep moving forward as hard-working women who are mothers to their families and who are capable of achieving the goals they have set for themselves; working together allows the group members to carry out their activities while also strengthening their friendship.

Venita G. is the president of the group -- she is a micro-entrepreneur who works in clothing sales. Vanita has been in this line of work for many years because it generates a good income and allows her to provide for her family and maintain a stable and decent quality of life.

Venita realizes that clothing sales is a very competitive field, especially now that a recent cold wave has created a lot of demand for coats. This why she is seeking a loan that would allow her to bring her inventories up to date, purchasing large quantities of coats and other winter clothing to ensure that her clients continue to be satisfied with the service that she provides.

loans.use: to purchase coats and other winter clothing

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Me llamo Gloria, vivo en la localidad de San Francisco Tlachichilpa, me dedico a engordar reces y tambien al hogar, no tengo problemas con mis actividades ya que en mi casa tengo el tiempo suficiente para hacer la comida la limpieza y para cuidar mis reces, mi esposo trabaja en una carniceria, y ahi mismo vendemos las reces, despues de que la carne se vende yo voy a cobrar como a los 8 dias es cuando me pagan la res que les vendi, ya tengo siempre cliente para mis reces, este prestamo me va ayudar mucho para poder comprar mas reces y su alimento para que engorden, pienso que voy a tener mas ganancias para mi familia y para comprar mas cosas a la casa, mis metas son que tenga mas rendimiento mi dinero y una mejor calidad de vida para toda mi familia, soy casada y tengo 4 hijos que estudian y yo quiero darles una mejor educación para que les vaya mejor en un futuro, tengo 34 años y 12 años de casada, la casa donde vivimos es casa propia pero aun le faltan varias cosas para que se vea bonita.
texts.en: My name is Gloria and I live in the town of San Francisco Tlachichilpa.  I devote myself to raising cattle and taking care of my home.  I have no problems with my work because I have enough time to do the cleaning and cooking in my house as well as take care of my cattle.  My husband works in a butcher shop and this is where we sell the cattle. Eight days later, after the meat is sold, I collect payment for the cattle that I sold them.  I always have customers for my cattle.  This loan will enable me to buy more cattle and feed to fatten them.  I think that I will have more income for my family and be able to buy more household items.  My goals are to earn more return on my money and to provide a better quality of life for my entire family.  I am married and have 4 children who are students.  I want to give them a better education so they will have a better future.  I am 34 years old and have been married for 12 years.  The house where I live is my own but it still lacks several things to make it look pretty..

loans.use: buy cattle and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes
