Amalia sells her products mainly to people with a secure wage such as teachers, secretaries and government workers in the town.  She sells her products on credit to suit her customers.  She stocks up with products in the town of Tuxpan, Michoacán, from an authorized distributor.

Amalia is married to José Luís, who is retired, and they live alone because their children are already married.  Amalia's goal is to set up a sales location in the front part of her home.  She would like to set up a grocery business.  This is her biggest dream and she is confident that she will gradually save up enough money to fulfil her dream.

loans.use: to sell beauty products through catalogs

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia tiene 46 años de edad, está casada con el señor Patricio quien es profesor de una escuela primaria, ellos tienen 4 hijos, pero vive nada mas con ellos su hija que es madre soltera y su nieto llamado Santiago de 4 años de edad el cual doña Lety se hizo cargo de él desde que nació ya que su hija estaba estudiando y en estos momentos trabaja como contadora. Doña Lety está pidiendo su préstamo para invertir en su negocio de joyería fina (oro) ella se surte en la cuidad de Moroleón Guanajuato ya que en esa ciudad le dan buenos precios ya que es clienta desde hace 12 años y a los cuales ella les puede subir un poco y no dar tan cara su joyería . Ella comenta que le está echando muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que quiere que su hijo que estudiando leyes pueda terminar su carrera y pueda comprarle los libros que el ocupa. Ahorita uno de sus propósitos es aclientarse y vender  agente que no le quede mal en sus pagos, más que nada personas que tengan un trabajo estable, y uno de sus sueños es rentar un local y establecerse ya que es muy peligroso traer joyas finas en la calle, también uno de sus sueños es poder remodelar su casa ya que en tiempo de lluvia se le trasmina el agua.
texts.en:
Leticia is 46 years old and is married to Patricio who is an elementary school teacher.  They have four children but only their daughter (a single mother) and their grandson Santiago, who is 4 years old, live with them.  Lety has taken care of Santiago since he was born since her daughter was studying and now she works as an accountant.

Lety is requesting this loan to invest in her business selling fine (gold) jewelry.  She buys her stock in the city of Moroleón Guanajuato since they offer her good prices in that city because she has been a customer for 12 years.  She can then raise the price just a little and not have to sell her jewelry for too high a price.  She tells us that she is putting a lot of effort into her work since she wants her son, who is studying Law, to be able to finish his degree and she wants to be able to buy him the textbooks he needs.

Right now, one of Leticia's goals is to attract customers and sell to people who will be able to meet all their payments, above all people who have stable jobs.  One of her dreams is to hire premises and set her business up there since it is very dangerous to carry fine jewelry in the street.  Another one of her dreams is to repair her home since it leaks during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy fine (gold) jewelry

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es originaria de la población de Zitacuaro, un lugar lleno de historia y hermoso en sus paisajes y que se considera como una de las ciudades con mejor clima a nivel mundial. Ella esta casada con el señor Raúl el cual es oficinista en una empresa en Texas E.U.A. desde hace 7 años y en las vacaciones de diciembre y abril viene a ver a su familia, ellos tienen 5 hijos pero nada mas dos dependen de ellos los cuales estudian en la cuidad de Morelia Michoacán en la universidad. Doña Lupita como es conocida en su localidad, tiene un negocio de renta de computadoras, ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 6 años y comenta que puso ese negocio por que una de sus hijas ya no quiso estudiar y le puso el negocio para que se pusiera hacer algo. Doña Lupita pidió un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de papel para imprimir, cartuchos de tinta, discos y guarda dinero por si alguna de las computadoras se le descompone para darles mantenimiento, doña Lupita tiene su local en su casa y la meta que tiene ella es comprar otras dos computadoras y poner una zapatería en su casa ya que a ella le gustan mucho los zapatos.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is from the town of Zitacuaro.  This is a place which is full of history and has beautiful landscapes.  It is considered to be one of the cities with the best climate in the world.

Guadalupe is married to Raúl who has been an office worker with a company in Texas, USA, for 7 years.  During the December and April vacations he comes to see his family.  The couple have five children but only two still depend on them.  They are studying at university in the city of Morelia, Michoacán.  Lupita, as she is known in her town, has a business renting out computers.  She has had this business for approximately 6 years and she tells us that she set up the business because one of her daughters didn't want to study any more.  She set up the business so that she would have something to do.

Lupita requested this loan to buy printing paper, ink cartridges and disks and also so that she could put some money aside in case one of her computers breaks down and she needs to do repair work.  Lupita's premises are in her home and her goal is to buy another two computers and to set up a shoe store in her home since she really likes shoes.

loans.use: to maintain her Internet café

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Hace aproximadamente 1 año Alejandra comenzó con su propio negocio fabricando y comercializando productos de joyería, labor que aprendió gracias al apoyo de su hermano quien le financió un curso de capacitación. Trabaja desde su casa fabricando y vendiendo estos productos y aunque no tiene un horario fijo es consiente que trabajando constantemente no sólo las ventas se van a aumentar si no que la producción va a crecer proporcionalmente.
 
Alejandra necesita capital para comprar insumos y materias primas y así tener un mayor inventario que le permita optimizar sus porcentajes de venta. A futuro desea tener un taller donde cree sus propios accesorios y pueda sacar nuevas colecciones; al mismo tiempo desea convertirse en proveedora de insumos de otras personas que realizan el mismo oficio.
texts.en:
About a year ago Alejandra started her own business making and commercializing jewelry. She learned this craft thanks to the support of her brother who paid for a training course. Alejandra works from home, making and selling these products, and, though she does not have a fixed schedule, she knows that if she works continuously, not only will the sales go up, but also the production will increase proportionally.

Alejandra needs capital in order to purchase supplies and raw materials which would allow her to have a larger inventory and optimize her sales margins. In the future, she would like to have a workshop where she could create her own accessories and new collections. At the same time, Alejandra is also hoping to become a supplier of raw materials to others in the jewelry business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and supplies

loans.name: Vaginak

texts.en:
Vaginak is 39 years old and lives in the village of Khospio, Akhalkalaki District. He is married and has three children (14, 12 and 9 years old). All of them go to school. Vaginak’s wife Shoghik works as a teacher in a local school. 

Vaginak earns a living growing potatoes. The family owns agricultural land with an area of 1.3 ha, which is used for potato growing. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to wholesalers. As this region is well-known throughout the country for its good-quality potatoes, Vaginak never has problem selling the harvest. 

Vaginak requested from Credo an agricultural loan in the amount of 1,500 Laris. With this money he will purchase potato seeds. He hopes that he will have a good season and get the planned amount of harvest. The profit earned will be used for covering the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer emprendedora que ha dedicado toda su vida a confeccionar prendas de vestir; aprendió el oficio hace 40 años gracias a una prima quien se encargó de enseñarle y desde entonces se ha dedicado a saber más acerca de la confección.
 
Trabaja día a día de 7a.m. a 6p.m debido a que tiene gran cantidad de pedidos por entregar, sin embargo el tiempo a veces no le es suficiente puesto que Yolanda necesita una máquina  plana para agilizar la producción. Con la compra de esta herramienta ella podrá darle mejor calidad al acabado de sus productos y generará un empleo adicional.
texts.en:
Yolanda is an entrepreneurial woman; she has worked all her life in the business of making clothing -- a skill that she has learned 40 years ago thanks to a cousin who took the time to teach her. Since then, she has always tried to learn more about the manufacturing process.

Yolanda works every day from 7am until 6pm, due to a large amount of orders. Even so, sometimes she does not have enough time because she does not have a flat sewing machine -- something that she needs to speed up the manufacture. Once she can purchase this tool, she will be able to give a better quality finish to her products and to obtain additional work.

loans.use: to purchase a flat sewing machine for manufacturing clothing

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La señora Irma es originaria de la población llama Zitacuaro, ella esta casada con el señor Ulises el cual es chofer de transporte publico, doña Irma se dedica a vender zapatos por catalogo de niños, damas y caballeros de diferentes marcas. Y esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de zapatos de diferentes tamaños, modelos para tener en existencia, ella tiene con este tipo de negocio hace 6 años y comenta que empezó con este negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos que en ese entonces todavía vivían con ellos. Dice que ella surte sus zapatos en diferentes tiendas en México, Toluca y dice que se los vende a sus vecinas y conocidas. La meta que tiene con el negocio de venta de zapato por catalogo es rentar un local y ser un distribuidor autorizado para así vender un  poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Irma is a native of the population center called Zitacuaro. She is married to Señor Ulises who is a public transportation driver. Doña Irma sells various brands of children's, ladies' and men's shoes by catalog. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase shoes in various sizes and models with which to stock her business. She has had this business for six years and mentions that she started it in order to help her husband with expenses for the children who still lived with them at that time. She says she supplies shoes to various shops in Toluca, Mexico as well as selling them to her neighbors and acquaintances. Her goal is to rent a commercial site and be an authorized distributor in order to sell a little more and bring in more earnings.

loans.use: sell footwear by catalog.

loans.name: Shirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Shirley Del Rosario se dedica a la venta de comida para animales, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy humilde pues tener este medio de vida, ha sido muy importante para mantener a su familia. Uno de los mayores desafíos que enfrenta es la compra de de los alimentos pues tiene que salir a los departamentos a buscar estos productos de manera más favorable. Este crédito es para la compra de maíz, concentrado para aves, concentrado para cerdos y vitaminas.
texts.en: Shirley Del Rosario makes her living selling animal feed; she runs her business from her home. Shirley is a very humble person and this business has been very important in allowing her to provide for her family. One of Shirley's main challenges is the purchase of inventories since she has to travel to various localities to find the supplies at most favorable prices. With this loan, Shirley plans to purchase corn, animal feed for birds and pigs, as well as vitamins.

loans.use: to purchase corn, animal feed for birds and pigs, and vitamins

loans.name: Mileydi Nohemy

texts.es:
Mileydi, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, tiene 19 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo de cinco meses de edad, ella se dedica a la Jarcia, que es la elaboración de hamacas, este negocio tiene un año de existir y lo aprendió de su suegra.
Ella necesita comprar materiales para la confección de las hamacas, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de Hilo de seda de diferentes colores, este es el material principal y único más necesario para la elaboración.
Tiene como sueño, alcanzar a compra una casa donde pueda vivir con su esposo y su hijo, también sostener el negocio y velar por el futuro de su familia.
texts.en: Mileydi lives in Delicias de Concepción, a region of Morazán.  She is 19 years old and lives with her husband and their 5 month old son.  She works making hammocks.  She has had this business for one year and she learned it from her mother-in-law.  She needs to buy materials to make hammocks, and is asking for a loan to buy silk thread in different colors.  This is the main supply she needs and it is necessary for making hammocks.  Her dream is to be able to buy a house where she can live with her husband and their son, also to sustain her businesss and prepare for her family's future.

loans.use: buy silk thread in different colors

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia tiene 43 años y estudio hasta el segundo año de secundaria comenta que no termino sus estudios ya que sus papas no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para seguirla apoyando con los gastos de la escuela. Doña Elvia está casada con el señor Lemuel él se dedica a vender animales como borregos y vacas, ellos tienen 6 hijos pero nada más uno vive con ellos llamado Ricardo el cual trabaja con su papa y ayuda a vender los animales. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo como cremas, cosméticos etc. También vende lencería para dama por catalogo y vende artículos de plástico para la cocina. Lleva con esta actividad aproximadamente 6 años, decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar con su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos ya que hubo un tiempo que todos estaban estudiando y tenían que pagar colegiaturas y rentas en otras ciudades donde estudiaban ellos. Doña Elvia está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en artículos de plástico para cocina, lencería y cosméticos para tener en existencia y no pedirlos por que es algo tardado los pedidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Elvia is 43 years of age and studied up to the second year of middle school. She mentions that she didn't finish her schooling because her mom and dad did not have enough money to continue supporting her with money for school expenses. Doña Elvia is married to Señor Lemuel who raises animals such as sheep and cattle. They have six children but only one of them lives with them, Richard, who works with his dad and helps sell the animals. She sells beauty products by catalog such as creams, cosmetics and so forth. She also sells lingerie for women by catalog and plastic kitchen items. She went into business approximately six years ago in order to help her husband pay the children's expenses because there was a time in which they were all in school and they had to pay school fees and housing costs in other cities where they were attending school. 

Doña Elvia is requesting her loan to invest in plastic kitchen items, lingerie and cosmetics in order to have them in stock and not have to put in orders, since the orders she places are somewhat delayed.

loans.use: to sell cosmetics and lingerie by catalog and also plastic kitchen items.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo "La esperanza", se inició originalmente en la ciudad de Guarambaré, luego se transfirió a la ciudad de san Lorenzo, está integrado por 16 mujeres humildes pero trabajadoras, muy laboriosas.
La sra. Teresa se dedica a la confitería, cada día prepara muy buena cantidad de dulces, lo cual implica que tenga una muy buena cantidad de clientes, quienes son fieles como clientela, ya que constantemente acuden a su negocio.
Ella se preocupa mucho por el bienestar de su familia, desea que prosperen y que surjan de la pobreza en donde se encuentran, por ello se sacrifica mucho y trata de vender la mayor cantidad de masas dulces y saladas, de modo que obtenga excelentes ingresos económicos.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios, como por ejemplo harina, sal, leche, condimentos en general.
Las mujeres de este grupo necesitan del préstamo y confían plenamente en que los inversionistas de Kiva las ayudarán.
texts.en:
The "La Esperanza" (Hope) group was originally founded in the city of Guarambaré but was then transferred to the city of San Lorenzo.  It has 16 members, all women, who are humble but hard working and industrious.

Teresa makes sweet treats.  Every day she makes a good quantity of sweet treats so that she has plenty available for her customers who are very loyal as they constantly visit her business to buy from her.  Teresa takes very good care of her family's well-being.  She would like them to prosper and escape the poverty in which they currently find themselves living.  For this reason, she makes a lot of sacrifices and tries to sell as many sweet and savory treats as she can so that she can make really good income.

Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as, for example, flour, salt, milk and flavorings.  

The women in this group need this loan and they have every faith that Kiva lenders will help them.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, milk, condiments and supplies for making sweet treats

loans.name: Libia Ester

texts.es:
Hace 7 años Libia A. decidió montar su propia sala de belleza como una solución para salir de la difícil situación económica que enfrentaba su familia para aquella época; por eso se capacitó y poco a poco fue perfeccionando sus técnicas hasta alcanzar un reconocimiento en su barrio como la mejor del sector en su oficio.
 
La sala de belleza está ubicada en su casa donde fue reformando el espacio para tener un lugar acogedor y cómodo donde atender a sus clientes, sin embargo aún hay arreglos que cree necesarios pero que, por falta de presupuesto, no ha podido realizar. Dentro de las adecuaciones quiere poner una ventana que le proporcione luz al espacio y además pintar tanto el exterior como el interior de la sala de belleza para darle un poco de vida y estatus al lugar. Es por esto que hoy Libia Ester busca un crédito que le ayude a cumplir sus propósitos, y así darle más posicionamiento a su negocio y tener más insumos para poder atender a sus clientes con mayor calidad.
texts.en:
Seven years ago, Libia Ester A. decided to start her own beauty salon as a solution to a difficult economic situation that her family was faced with back then. This is why she took upon herself to learn this craft and, little by little, was able to perfect her technique to the point that she is now recognized in her neighborhood as the best in her line of work.

The beauty salon is located in her home where she has been developing a welcoming and comfortable space for attending her clients. However, there are still some necessary renovations that she has not yet been able to do due to budgetary constraints. One of the planned improvements is to install a window that would provide more light and also to paint both the inside and the outside of the salon to give it a more attractive and lively appearance. 

It is for this reason that Libia Ester decided to seek a loan that would allow her to accomplish her goals in giving a better positioning for her business and a better quality of service to her clients.

loans.use: to renovate a beauty salon and to purchase supplies

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Auntie Yaa A. is married and has six dependents. Yaa makes doughnuts at Mfuom near Abura, which she has been doing for three years. Her husband is a farmer. Yaa uses her income to support her husband and help pay for their dependent's school fees and utility bills. She plans to use the procees of this loan to add to her initial capital to expand her business. Yaa is saving money with the hope of being able to build a better structure for her business.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital to expand her doughnut business.

loans.name: Marie Thérèse

texts.fr: Née le 02 Octobre 1976 à Bopa au Mono (Bénin), Marie Thérèse vit depuis quinze ans à Sodjéatinmé, un quartier de Cotonou. Marie Thérèse est mariée à Richard, un menuisier, et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Marie Thérèse a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, une activité qu'elle mène passionnément depuis dix ans environ et qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Marie Thérèse vend des tissus dans son atelier. Marie Thérèse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Marie Thérèse sollicite pour la sixième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l'avenir, Marie Thérèse désire élargir davantage le niveau de son activité.
texts.en: Marie Therese was born on October 2, 1976 in Bopa au Mono, Benin. She has lived for 15 years now in Sodjéatinmé, in the Cotonou neighborhood. Marie Therese is married to Richard, a carpenter and they have three children who are in school. The couple is responsible for all the various household expenses.  Marie Therese has very little formal education, but learned to sew, a skill she has been passionate about for 10 years and enables her to help with the family expenses.  On the side, Marie Therese also sells fabric from her workshop. She purchases her products in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. With the goal to satisfy her clients' demands, she is requesting a loan from Alidé for the sixth time. All of her previous loans were properly reimbursed. In the future, Marie Therese hopes to expands her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pork, chicken, beef, oil, rice, coal, juices and soft drinks.

loans.name: Concepcion Yamileth

texts.es:
Concepción, reside en Delicias de Concepción departamento de Morazán, tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad, el ultimo de 4 meses, ella se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de hamacas, cuenta con 8 años de experiencia, se dedica a tiempo completo.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de hilo de seda de diferentes colores, con esta compra tendrá lo necesario para elaborar y ofrecer a los clientes más producto.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos con lo necesario pero sobre todo que estudien y se preparen para que se defiendan en el futuro, también es su objetivo tener una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Concepción lives in Delicias de Concepción in the department of Morazán. She is 25 years old, lives with her husband, and has three children, 10 years old, 4 years old, and the youngest of 4 months. She works making and selling hammocks. With eight years of experience, she works full time.

She needs a loan for the purchase of silk thread of various colors. With this purchase she will have the necessary materials to create and offer more products to her clients.

Her goal is to help her children with their needs, above all that they can study and prepare themselves to thrive in the future. She also has a goal of having her own home.

loans.use: purchase silk thread of various colors.

loans.name: Fernando Leon

texts.es:
Durante 17 años Fernando A. ha trabajado vendiendo legumbres en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Fredonia, en el departamento de Antioquia. Es padre de 2 hijos y trabaja diariamente para velar por el bienestar de ellos. Comenzó con esta labor por iniciativa propia y con los años ha aprendido estrategias para mejorar tanto las ventas como las ganancias de su negocio.
 
Su mayor sueño es poder llegar a tener un local que le permita ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes, y así darles a sus hijos educación y bienestar económico. Fernando trabaja todos los días de 8a.m a 8p.m debido a que sus productos son bastante apetecidos en el municipio, sin embargo hoy Fernando solicita un crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor y surtir su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
For 17 years, Fernando A. has been selling vegetables in the market square, in the town of Fredonia, in Antioquia department.  He has two children and works every day to provide for them.  He started this work on his own initiative and, over the years, he has learned strategies for improving both his sales and his profits.

Fernando's biggest dream is to own sales premises which would allow him to offer a larger quantity of products to his customers and thereby provide his children with an education and provide for their financial well-being.  Fernando works every day, from 8.00am to 8.00pm.  His products are quite popular in the town.

Fernando is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise wholesale so that he can stock his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo De 1Ro De Enero Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 50 años, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos, los dos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, pero el menor aún vive con ellos. Francisca es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “San Judas Tadeo de 1ro de Enero” elegida por su carisma y don de liderazgo, en la formación del grupo ella colaboró presentado a señoras activas y propuso el nombre del grupo “San Judas Tadeo” es el patrón del trabajo y “1ro de enero” porque así se llama la zona donde viven.
Francisca se dedica a la Venta de carne Pollos en el Mercado Modelo de su zona, lleva en este negocio cerca de siete años, antes de esto solo se dedicaba al hogar puesto que sus hijos aún eran estudiantes y necesitaban de todo su apoyo; era su esposo quien en ese entonces se dedicaba al negocio  en otro mercado, al ver ella que era rentable decidieron comprar un terreno donde empezó a vender, ahora su casa tiene dos pisos y adquirió un auto que lo puso a trabajar como servicio de Taxi. Francisca no quiere quedarse ahí y pretende comprar otro terreno más céntrico donde pueda abrir otro negocio similar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca is 50 years old and lives with her partner and two son who are both adults and independent; although the youngest still lives at home.  Francisca is the president of the "San Judas Tadeo de 1ro de Enero" communal group and she was elected because of her charisma and leadership.  She collaborated in the training of the group and introduced active women to it.  She also proposed the group name "San Judas Tadeo" for the patron saint of work and "1ro de enero" because that's the name of the area where they live.

Francisca sells chicken in the Modelo Market in her area.  She has been in the business for seven years.  BefO. she was a homemaker because her children were still in school and they needed her support.  Her husband was the one who ran the business at the market.  Seeing that business was profitable they decided to buy land where they began selling.  Now they have a two storey house and a car that he uses to provide taxi service.  Francisca prefers not to stay in their current location and wants to buy property closer to downtown to open a similar business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. sells a variety of items such as water and palm oil at Mfuom near Abura. Adjoa is married and has children. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Adjoa wants to expand her business and so is asking for a loan to enable her buy extra bags of water to resell.  In the photo that accompanies this profile, Adjoa is pictured holding a bag of water; behind her is the fridge she uses to cool the water.

loans.use: to buy extra bags of water for resale

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica a la venta de artesanía, tiene tres hijos y trabaja vendiendo en las escuelas y colegios de San Miguel, pues el reside en esta ciudad por lo que se le hace accesible comercializar en la zona.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, poster, calcomanías, artículos para celulares, collares y pulseras, esta inversión le ayudara a diversificar la mercadería y agradar a los jóvenes estudiantes quiénes son sus clientes.
Sueña con algún día tener su propia vivienda, donde vivir con sus hijos y su esposa.
texts.en:
Oscar's business is selling handicrafts.  He has three children and works selling his products in elementary schools and high schools in San Miguel.  He lives in this city and so it is easy for him to sell in the area.

Oscar is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise: posters, decals, cell phone accessories, necklaces and bracelets.  This investment will help him to diversify his stock and please the young students who are his customers.

Oscar dreams of some day owning his own home where he can live with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: posters, decals and cell phone accessories

loans.name: Santos Alejandro

texts.es: Santos de 30 años, vive en el departamento de Nagarote desde hace 10 años con su esposa y su hijo. Se dedica al negocio de servicio de fotografía, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es el apoyo que recibe de parte de su familia, ya que anteriormente su tío se dedicaba a esta actividad y por medio del él aprendió. Por ello todos los días tiene que salir a ofrecer sus servicios en los parques, restaurantes, cine entre otros lugares, pues cuando no tiene eventos sociales como quince años, boda, piñatas, comuniones, bautizos tiene que salir y es algo agotador. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de rollos de película, reparación, mantenimiento y compra de cámaras.
texts.en:
Santos is 30 years old and has lived in the department of Nagarote with his wife and son for ten years.  He is in the photography business.  What he enjoys most about his work is the support he receives from his family, since his uncle used to be a photographer and taught him the profession.

Everyday he goes out to parks, restaurants, cinemas and other places to offer his services.  When he does not have social events lined up, such as coming-out parties, wedding, birthdays, first communions, and baptisms he has to go out and look for business, and it can be tiring.

He plans to use the loan to buy rolls of film and to repair, maintain and purchase camaras.

loans.use: To buy rolls of film and repair, maintain and purchase camaras

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, lard, sugar, yeast, raisins and piñatas

loans.name: Toussaint K.

texts.fr: Monsieur Toussaint D. habite à Dalifort. C’est un célibataire qui a en charge un enfant. C’est un opérateur conseiller pour le plateau de Tigo. Il exerce ce métier qu’il a choisi par amour mais aussi dans le souci de se procurer des revenus. Monsieur D. est sociétaire du guichet de Yoff depuis mai 2010. Il n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour financer un besoin social (baptême). Ce financement lui permettra de régler  un problème ponctuel.
texts.en: Mr. Toussaint D. lives in Dalifort. He is not married, but takes care of a child. He is an operator consultant for the cellular service provider, Tigo. He chose this profession because he loves the work, but also with the goal to make good money.  He has been an associate of the Yoff office since May 2010.  He has never received a loan before.  He is requesting a loan of 150,000 cfa francs to pay for the child's baptism. The loan will enable him to take care of a this one-time problem.

loans.use: to pay for the baptism of his child

loans.name: Sabor A Mi Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama SABOR A MI esta ubicado en PuebL., México. El grupo esta conformado por once personas y es L. decima ocasión que solicitan un prestamo. L. foto fue tomada en L. casa D. L. señora MatilD. del Rosario F. quien es tesorera del grupo tiene 31 años D. edad, estudio solamente L. primaria, se dedica a L. venta D. pollo, frutas y verduras; y tiene en total 1 hijo varon. Tiene 4 años D. dedicarse a este comercio. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar mas pollo ya que sus ventas están creciendo así como en L. fruta D. temporada, sus clientes L. prefieren ya que su trato es muy amable y sus productos siempre estan frescos. Al momento D. solicitar este crédito se siente muy contenta ya que tiene L. oportunidad D. generar más ganancias, y las utilizará para hacer crecer su negocio y posteriormente arreglar su casa y apoyar a su familia en los gastos economicos.
texts.en:
This group is called "SABOR A MI" and is located in PuebL., México.  It is comprised of eleven people who are requesting their tenth loan.  The photo was taken at the home of Mrs. MatilD. del Rosario F. who is the treasurer of the group.  She is 31 years old, has a son, and only received a primary school education.  She sells chicken, fruit and vegetables for a living.  

She has been in business for four years and is requesting a loan to buy more chicken, because of increased sales, and seasonal fruit.  Her customers are loyal because of her kindness and the fact that her products are always fresh.  

Requesting the loan has maD. her happy because she will have the opportunity to generate more profit which she will use to expand her business.  She also plans to renovate her home and support her family as far as household expenses are concerned.

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Ma Dolores

texts.es: La señora Dolores es originaria de la población de Zitacuaro ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para surtir su tienda, con el préstamo ella comprara leche, suavizantes de tela, jabón, chiles enlatados, maicena, pan, sabritas, crema, sopas etc. Ella tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 15 años y dice que puso eses negocio porque antes cerca de su casa no habían tiendas cercanas y a todos les agarraba lejos las tiendas por eso ella decidió poner una. Doña Dolores surte sus productos en diferentes tiendas de su población donde le den buenos precios para así poder ganarles algo, ella esta casada con el señor Ignacio el cual es comerciante y tubo 4 hijos ya todos casados. La meta que tiene doña Dolores con su negocio es meter unas maquinitas para que los niños de su colonia se diviertan y comprar dulces y algo de juguetería para tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dolores is from the town of Zitacuaro.  She has a grocery store in her home and is requesting a loan to buy milk, fabric softener, soap, canned peppers, cornstarch, bread, snacks, cream, soups, etc.  She has been in business for about 15 years and claims she started it because there were no stores in her neighborhood.

Doña Dolores buys her products at other stores in town where she can get good prices.  She is married to Mr. Ignacio, who is a merchant, and they have four children who are all married.

Her goal is to install little candy and toy dispensers so the children in her neighborhood can buy sweets and toys, which will help her business.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery store

loans.name: Eunice

texts.es: Eunice tiene 21 años de edad, comenta que ella nada mas estudio hasta tercero de secundaria porque se caso muy jovencita y por eso ya no continuo con sus estudios. Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo y ropa interior para dama también por catalogo, ella dice “ya empecé con este negocio como un juego porque cuando iba en la primaria me llevaba a escondidas de mi mama sus catálogos y se los ofrecía a las maestras para que me encargaran y si me encargaban productos de belleza y así empecé mi negocio y cuando iba en la secundaria les ofrecía los productos a mis compañeras de clase, después ya cuando me case me independice y me propuse emprender mi propio negocio y ahora también vendo ropa interior para dama”. Ella esta casada con el señor Manases y tienen un niño de 3 años de edad de nombre Moisés. También nos comenta que los días sábados y domingos vende atole y tamales oaxaqueños a sus vecinos y conocidos y aveces hace mole de guajolote pero que es negocio esta asociada con su mama ya que a ella le sale muy sabroso el mole. La meta que tiene Eunice es vender zapato por catalogo de diferentes marcas para vender un poco de todo.
texts.en:
Eunice is 21 years old.  She tells us that she only studied up to the third year of high school because she got married at a very young age and, for that reason, didn't continue with her studies.

Eunice sells beauty products and ladies' underwear through catalogs.  She says "I started this business as a game because when I was in elementary school I used to sneak my mom's catalogs into school and show them to the teachers so that they would order things from me and they would order beauty products from me.  This is how I started my business.  When I was in high school I used to sell the products to my classmates.  Later, when I got married, I became independent and decided to set up my own business.  Now I also sell ladies' underwear".

Eunice is married to Manases and they have a 3 year-old son called Moisés.  Eunice also tells us that on Saturdays and Sundays she sells atole (a corn-based hot drink) and Oaxacan tamales to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Sometimes she also makes 'mole de guajolote' (turkey in a spicy chili / chocolate sauce).  However, that business is in partnership with her mom since her mom's 'mole' sauce is very tasty.

Eunice's goal is to sell different brands of shoes through catalogs so that she sells a little bit of everything.

loans.use: to sell underwear and cosmetics through catalogs

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es:
Eulalio, reside en Joateca departamento  de Morazán, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tienen dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, él tiene muchos años de estar trabajando en la agricultura, mayormente cultiva en época de invierno.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y semilla mejorada, esta compra le ayudara a tener lo necesario y poder realizar el cultivo.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos sean independientes y trabajen por su propia cuenta.
texts.en:
Eulalio lives in Joateca, Morazan department and raises corn and beans.  He is 59 years old and lives with his wife and two children, who are 19 and 17 years old. He has many years of experience working in agriculture, planting mostly during  winter season.  

He needs a loan for the purchase of fertilizers and improved seed so that he can plant his crop. His hope is that his children are independent and work on their own.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and improved seed.

loans.name: Genara

texts.es:
La señorita Genara M. vive con sus padres en la compañía Isla Ka’a de Ybycui, es soltera sin hijos.
Ella nos cuenta que realizó estudios de peluquería, manicura y pedicuro, una vez terminado estos estudios y ante la adversidad de no encontrar un lugar de trabajo, ella mismo se propuso a salir en busca de clientes, gracias a su buen trabajo y responsabilidad, rápidamente ha formado una gran clientela, en la actualidad realiza trabajos a domicilio por toda la ciudad de Ybycuí, dejándole muy buenas ganancias.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de solicitar el crédito a Kiva, ya que si cuennta con eso podrá comprar insumos necesarios para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ms. M. lives with her ​​parents in Ybycui Ka'a Island and is single with no children.

She tells us that she studied hairdressing, manicure and pedicure.  After completing these studies, she suffered the adversity of not finding a workplace and decided to go in search of customers.   Thanks to her good work and responsibility, a large customer base formed quickly.  She now offers at-home beauty services to clientele throughout the city of Ybycuí, earning a good profit.

She thanks Foundation Paraguaya for the opportunity to apply for credit through Kiva to buy supplies needed for her work.

loans.use: Purchase materials and supplies (nail polish, paints, hair creams, etc.).

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro forma parte del banco comunal “Creciendo con Fe” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. 
El se dedica a la producción y venta de confites, específicamente; barquillos de galleta, palmeras (galleta azucarada), cuchuflí, maní y paraguas (caramelos). Desde hace 14 años, éste oficio lo práctica desde niño, ya que fue heredado de la familia, transmitido de generación en generación. 
Alejandro trabaja de lunes a sábado en horario continuado. Su hijo mayor es quien lo ayuda en la venta de confites, en un carro el cual trasladan y venden sus productos. Las temporadas de más alta demanda son durante los meses de verano e invierno, ya que ahí también vende sus productos al por mayor, fuera de lo que vende a clientes particulares. Por lo que sus ganancias son mejores. 
Sus ingredientes los compra en una bodega.
Con el préstamo comprará harina, azúcar, bolsas, gas y pagará la mantención de sus maquinarias, ya que éstas deben ser revisadas y reparadas cada 6 meses, con un tornero (mecánico que repara maquinarias). Con ésta inversión Alejandro podrá trabajar más tranquilo, sin el temor que se le descomponga la maquinaria. 
Sus sueños son surgir y brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida más confortable.
Alejandro vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 18, 9 y 7 años de edad.
Para Alejandro Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo que le permitirá crecer, ya que gracias al préstamo podrá invertir en su negocio.
Además le han servido mucho los talleres de ventas, especialmente uno referente a cómo registrar sus gastos y ganancias. Respecto a las reuniones con los demás socios, se siente muy contento por la comunicación que han generado en el grupo.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Alejandro is part of the community bank "Growing Faith" in the city of Viña del Mar.

He works in the production and sale of candy, specifically, wafer cookie, palms (sugar cookie), "cuchuflí", peanuts and umbrellas (candy). He has done this work over the past 14 years, since he was a child, in a business inherited from the family, passed down from generation to generation.

Alejandro works Monday through Saturday.  His eldest son helps in the sale of candy with a cart in which he transports and sells their products. The high demand seasons are during the months of summer and winter, during which he also sells products wholesale, in addition to direct sales to individual customers, and profits are better.  He buys the ingredients in a local store.

With the loan he will buy flour, sugar, bags, gas and pay for up-keep of his machinery, which should be serviced every 6 months by a "tornero" (mechanic who makes machinery repairs). With this investment Alejandro is more assured, without fear that the machinery will break down.

His dreams are to succeed and give his family a more comfortable quality of life. Alejando lives with his wife and three children 18, 9 and 7 years old.

For Alejandro, Fondo Esperanza, has been a great support that allows him to grow, and thanks to the loan, he will be able to invest in his business.  In addition, their sales workshops have been very helpful, especially one dealing with how to record your expenses and profits. With regard to meetings with other partners, he is very happy with the communication generated by the group.

Viña del Mar is a municipality located in the central coast of Chile, known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios that some older homes have in the city. It is also considered the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: purchase flour, sugar, bags, gas and pay for up-keep on his machinery

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Señora Maria Auxiliadora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, tiene 2 hijos que asisten a escuela primaria y para poder sustentar su hogar es que ella tiene este negocio.  Ella sale a vender todos los días a distribuir sus productos, ella sale muy temprano por lo que sus diferentes clientes viven en lugares muy lejanos, además de estar atendiendo su negocio en casa aprovecha para atender las necesidades de su familia. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio, ahora necesita el crédito para comprar zapatos, cosméticos, ropa y sabanas, tratamientos y trajes de baño pues se acerca la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora sells general merchandise and has 2 children attending primary school.  She has her business in order to support her household. 

She goes out to sell her goods every day, leaving very early since her various customers live in faraway places.  In addition to taking care of her business, she also takes care of the needs of her family. Her dream is to expand her business and now needs a loan to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, bedding treatments and bathing suits, because the summer season approaches.

loans.use: buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, bedding treatments and bathing suits

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIREN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Oropesa y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma: es soltera y la socia tiene una pequeña tiene de abarrotes junto a sus familia y se alternan el trabajo, la socia es policía de profesión y ella se dedica a su institución y cuando está en sus horas libres la socia administra su tienda, la socia es una mujer muy optimista y emprendedora, ella en esta oportunidad manifiesta que desea el crédito para invertir en la tienda de abarrotes y amoblar y comprar mercadería al por mayor. La socia solicita el crédito para invertir en su tienda abarrotes.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The borrower, Ms Vilma, belongs to the community bank "VIREN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA ", located in the province of Oropesa and department of Cusco.

Ms. Vilma, is single and has a small grocery store with her family where they alternate work.  She is a policeman by profession, is dedicated to the institution, and in her free time she runs her store.  She is an optimistic and enterprising woman and says she wants the loan to invest in the grocery store to furnish it and buy merchandise wholesale. She is requesting a loan to invest in her grocery store.

She is very grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments on the loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: For some time now Ama N., who attained a junior high level of education, has been selling yams in both small and large quantities at Mfuom near Abura. Currently taking care of six dependents she assists her husband in taking care of her children. Ama would want to expand her business and so is asking for the the loan to purhcase more yams for resale. The new profit will be added to her capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purhcase more yams for resale.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es: Emelina se dedica a una pulpería. Ella dio inicio hace más de 12 años comenzó con esfuerzo propio vendiendo muy pocos productos, a ella siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy trabajadora y disfruta de interactuar con sus diferentes clientes que llegan a su vivienda. No es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para lograr sacar adelante su vivienda.  Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, sopas, gaseosas, galletas, pan, productos del hogar y agua embotellada.
texts.en: Emelina owns a small grocery store.  She started her business, through her own efforts, more than 12 years ago.  She has always enjoyed being a very hard-working person and she enjoys interacting with the customers who come to her home.  This is not the first time that Emelina has taken out a loan to get ahead in her business.  She will use this loan to buy merchandise such as basic grains, detergents, candies, soups, soda, cookies, bread, household products and bottled water.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, detergents, candies, soups, soda, cookies, bread, household products and bottled water

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda vende perfumes, cremas, maquillajes por catalogo desde hace 8 años, ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar varios productos que vende en el catalogo para tener en existencia, Yolanda esta casada con el señor Juan el cual es chofer, ellos viven solos ya que sus hijos son casados y viven aparte. Comenta Yolanda que emprendió este tipo de negocio porque es una persona muy activa y le gusta el comercio y emprendió este negocio, también comenta que vende colchas, sabanas por catalogo y surte sus productos en una distribuidor autorizado en la población de Zitacuaro, la meta que tiene doña Yolanda es ser distribuidor autorizado y tener mas clientas ya que nada mas les vende a personas que conoce que sabe que le van a pagar por que muchas clientas le han quedado mal.
texts.en:
Yolanda has been selling perfume, creams and makeup through catalogs for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy several products that she sells through her catalogs so that she has some in stock.  Yolanda is married to Juan who is a driver.  They live alone as their children are married and live in their own homes.  Yolanda tells us that she started this type of business because she is a very active person and she likes selling things.  She also tells us that she sells bedspreads and sheets through catalogs.  She stocks up with products from an authorized distributor in the town of Zitacuaro.

Yolanda's goal is to become an authorized distributor and to gain more customers since she only sells to people that she knows, who she knows will pay, because many customers have let her down.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, creams and perfumes through catalogs

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, vive en casa propia, con su esposo, una hija de 16 años y una sobrina de 6 años. Es comerciante de productos de primera de necesidad, tiene como 15 años de dedicarse al negocio y fue heredado por su madre.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería como: aceite, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, pastas y condimentos, esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio.
Las aspiraciones de ella es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y darle a su hija todo lo necesario para que crezca sanamente.
texts.en:
María lives in Concepción Batres in the department of Usulután. She lives in her own house with her husband, her 16 year-old daughter, and a 6 year-old niece. She is a shopkeeper of daily use products, and she has been making a living in this business for around 15 years, which she took over from her mother. 

She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as: oil, sugar, beans, rice, pastas and condiments. This investment will help her to strengthen her business. 

Her aspirations are to better the life conditions of her family and to give her daughter all that is necessary to grow up healthy.

loans.use: To buy oil, sugar, beans, rice, pasta and condiments.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia A., who is married to a driver and has five dependents, attended school through junior high. For the past 10 years, Afia has been a baker who also sells provisions at Mfuom, which is near Abura.  Her income assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home, and she will use this loan as additional capital with which to fill her shop with more goods for sale. Afia would like to use the new profits to eventually establish another shop at a different location.

loans.use: as additional capital to enable her to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Mathieu

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mathieu D. est un père  de  famille qui habite dans une des cités environnantes de la localité de Dalifort. Il est mécanicien  en automobile. Il répare les voitures, achète et vend des pièces détachées. A travers son activité il a l’intention de gagner sa vie. 
Monsieur Diatta est membre du guichet de Dalifort depuis janvier 2007. Il a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées. Il souhaite renforcer son fond de roulement et élargir son  activité de commerce de pièces  détachées. Son financement lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus, de mieux entretenir sa famille et améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Mathieu D. is a family man who lives in one of the districts surrounding the city of Dalifort. He is a car mechanic who repairs automobiles and also buys and sells spare parts. He tries to earn a living through this activity.

Mr. D. became a member of the Dalifort branch in January 2007. He has successfully repaid to previous loans, and is now seeking a loan of 500,000 francs to purchase spare parts. He wants to strengthen his working capital and expand his spare part business. 

This funding will help him to increase his revenues, better support his family, and improve their social standing.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIREN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Oropesa y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas: es soltera y la socia tiene 51 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos de 29, 24, 17 años de edad; la socia elabora panes, esta zona es conocida como el pueblo del pan artesanal, la mayoría de las socias se dedican a la elaboración de panes y actualmente ellas tiene el premio a la calidad y sus panes son muy conocidos en la región del Cusco, ellas llevan sus panes a vender de preferencia a la carretera esperando a que los carros que van de Cusco  Arequipa se detengan para comprar panes y viceversa, pero también en la ruta hay muchos pueblos que hacen lo mismo, la socia requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como manteca, levadura y formar la maza, también deberá comprar combustible para el horno. La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panes.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA” communal bank. This bank is located in the province of Oropesa, in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Felicitas: she is single and 51 years old, with 3 children, aged 29, 24, and 17. She works making breads. This area is known for its people who make traditional bread, and most of the members work baking bread. Currently, they hold the prize for quality, and their breads are very well known in the Cusco region. They usually take their breads to the highway to sell, waiting for the cars going from Cusco to Arequipa or vice versa to stop and buy bread. However, there are many other villages along the route that do the same thing. The borrower needs this loan to buy ingredients such as shortening and yeast to prepare her dough. She will also need to buy fuel for the oven. The borrower is requesting the loan to buy supplies for preparing bread. 

The borrower is very grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments for this loan in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua H. is widow and has six children. As the sole breadwinner of her family, she makes a living selling banku, a Ghanaian staple made from fried fish and a mix of corn and cassava dough. She runs her business from Mfuom, which is near Abura (a town in the Central Region).  

With her loan from Kiva, she plans to purchase more ingredients to increase the volume of food she sells. The increase in her earnings will allow her to set aside money to save up for her children’s education, which is her highest priority.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to increase the volume of food she sells.

loans.name: Narcisa Dalila

texts.es: La Señora Narcisa Dalila se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general.  Ella sale a vender todos los días a distribuir sus productos, ella sale muy temprano por lo que sus diferentes clientes viven en lugares muy lejanos, inicio comercializando productos lácteos, pero con el tiempo fue creciendo su inventario y así obtener su negocio. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio, ahora necesita el crédito para comprar zapatos, cosméticos, ropa y sabanas. Ella es  una persona responsable que siempre está dispuesta a trabajar para cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en: Ms. Narcisa Dalila sells general merchandise. She goes out every day in order to distribute her products. She leaves very early because her different customers live far away. She started off selling dairy products, but over time her inventory grew and that is how her business started. Her dream is to be able to expand her business. Currently, she needs this loan to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and bedsheets. She is a responsible person who is always ready work in order to fill all of her orders.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and bedsheets

loans.name: Dagbegnikin1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement DAGBEGNIKIN1 est composé de 13 membres qui habitent tous le même quartier et qui pratiquent tous la même religion. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Sylvie Estelle, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Sylvie Estelle est née en 1973 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé. Sylvie Estelle est mariée à un agent commercial nommé Ibrahim et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Il y a près de neuf ans que Sylvie Estelle et sa famille se sont installées à Logbozounkpa dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Sylvie Estelle mène comme activité la vente de tissus, des mêches et de chaussures par le système de distribution, ce qui l'aide à subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sylvie Estelle achète ses produits au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Sylvie Estelle sollicite ensemble avec ses autres membres, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de renforcer davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
The group DAGBEGNIKIN1 is composed of thirteen members who all live in the same district and who practice the same religion. The group's president, named Sylvie Estelle, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of elevating their business in order to cope better with customer demand, this group is requesting for a second time financial support from ALIDé.

Sylvie Estelle was born in 1973 in Adjohoun, in Ouémé county. She is married to a business representative named Ibrahim and is the mother of four children, who are all in school. Together, the couple meet the various household expenses. 

Almost nine years ago, Sylvie and her family settled in Logbozounkpa, in the community of Abomey Calavi. Her work involves selling cloth, hair extensions, and shoes via the distribution system. This helps her to support herself and her children. She buys her products in Nigeria, a state neighboring Benin.

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying her customer base, Sylvie, along with the other group members, is requesting a loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to strengthen her business further, so as to grow her revenues.

loans.use: to buy cloth, hair extensions, and shoes

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. is from Mfuom, which is near Abura town in Ghana’s Central Region. She is married to a farmer and they have seven children. To help her husband pay for the utilities and their children’s school fees, she makes a living selling palm oil. 

The palm oil is extracted from the palm fruit (as shown in the photograph). Adjoa has been in this business for six years and she is now keen to grow it further. She plans to use the loan from Kiva to purchase more palm fruit to extract more oil for sale. Adjoa intends to save up the anticipated extra earnings for her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract more oil for sale

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con sus hijos de 18 y 24 años de edad; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las cuales elabora en su casa desde hace 9 años, su horario de venta es de 10:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y gas, estos materiales son los insumos necesarios para hacer las tortillas, el préstamo será una gran ayuda para fortalecer el negocio, aumentar su producción y mejorar su vida cotidiana.
El sueño y aspiración de ella es tener un negocio más amplio, con mayor capacidad para atender a los clientes,  recibir mayores ingresos que contribuyan  al mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her children aged 18 and 24.  Rosa sells tortillas which she makes in her home.  She has been in this business for nine years.  She sells her products from 10.00am to 6.00pm.

Rosa currently needs a loan to buy corn, firewood and gas.  These are the supplies she needs to make her tortillas.  The loan will be a great help in strengthening her business, increasing her production and improving her everyday life.

Rosa's dream and aspiration is to have a bigger business where she can serve more customers and make more income which she will use to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas

loans.name: José Jair

texts.es:
Jair B. R., de 30 años tiene un almacén automotriz llamado “Almacén y taller de repuestos A.J.”  él vive con su cónyuge y su hija en la edad de 4 años en el barrio 7 de abril, al sur occidente de la ciudad de Barranquilla  y allí  desde el año 2009 funciona su microempresa, la cual ofrece servicios automotriz y se dedica a la venta de tornillos, tuercas, tensores, estriberas, cerraduras, neumáticos, manetas, caballetes, amortiguadores etc.
Jaír nació en el municipio de Soledad y cuando cumplió sus 15 años inició su vida laboral, sin haber terminado el nivel educativo de bachiller; primero fue ayudante en periferia tienda a  tienda, luego a los 18 años condujo un taxi y allí se conoció con su hoy cónyuge trabajando por 10 años,  y posteriormente inició su actual   actividad   en el año 2009, cuando  se independizó para emprender la microempresa. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará repuestos para motos, incersión  planea sea exitosa, porque comprará repuestos de mayor rotación entre sus clientes y porque el sitio donde se encuentra ubicado es un punto estratégico, en el cual no tiene competencia.   Su sueño es tener un local propio,  a nivel familiar darle a su hija todo el apoyo en su educación para que sea exitosa. Mientras tanto, Jair continua trabajando con su negocio,  aplicando financiaciones cortas y vendiendo de contado principalmente, para alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Jair B. R. is 30 years old and has an auto parts store called "Almacén y Taller de Repuestos A.J."  He lives with his partner and his 4 year-old daughter in 7 de Abril neighborhood, in the south-west of the city of Barranquilla.  He has been running his small business there since 2009.  He offers automotive services and sells screws, nuts, tension belts, footplates, locks, tires, levers, kickstands, shock absorbers, etc.

Jaír was born in the town of Soledad and he started his working life when he turned 15, without finishing his high school education.  First he worked as an assistant on the outskirts of town then, when he turned 18, he started driving a taxi which is how he met his current partner.  He worked in that business for 10 years and then started his current business in 2009.  He set up his small business and started working for himself.

This is Jaír's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use it to buy motorcycle parts.  He intends his investment to be successful as he will buy the spare parts that his customers buy most often.  His business is in a strategic location where there is no competition.

Jaír's dream is to own his own premises.  As far as his family is concerned, he would like to provide his daughter with all the support she needs in her education so that she can be successful.  In the meantime, Jaír continues working in his business, using short-term loans and mainly selling his products for cash, in order to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la comunidad del Barrio 3 Tapiracuai de la ciudad de San Estanislao (Santaní).
El comité está en el segundo Ciclo con 12 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser las miembros muy unidas, solidarias y responsables, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con sus actividades y pretenden aumentar su calidad de vida.
Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría de animales, la sra. Zulmira es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica al cuidado de animales, al engorde y su posterior venta, mediante este negocio Zulmira logra obtener las ganancias necesarias para mantener a sus hijos, pero debido a la buena demanda que hay en su zona desea poder cumplir de mejor manera con sus pedidos, por eso solicita el crédito a Kiva y Fundacion Paraguaya, para poder comprar balanceados, vacunas y medicamentos, de modo que pueda mantener una mayor cantidad de animales.
Todas las mujeres de este comité se hallan muy entusiasmadas por incrementar la productividad de sus actividades laborales.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora Committee was formed by several neighbors from the community of Barrio 3 Tapiracuai in the city of San Estanislao (Santaní). It is starting its second loan cycle with 12 members. The group is known in their neighborhood for having members who are united, supportive, and responsible. All of them possess a great entrepreneurial spirit as they go about their daily activities in hopes of improving their quality of life.

All of the members raise animals. Sra. Zulmira serves as president of the group. She raises animals and fattens them for eventual resale. Zulmira earns her living in this manner so that she can obtain the necessary income to support her children. Since there is a good level of demand in her area, Zulmira wants to do a better job of completing her orders. For this reason, she is requesting a loan through Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to buy balanced feed, vaccines, and medicines so that she can maintain animals that are of high quality.

All of the women in the committee are very excited to increase productivity in their business activities.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed, vaccines, and medicines.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. runs a food stand in the town of Mfuom, which is located near the larger city of Abura. She has been running this business for the last three years and in this photograph we see her preparing fufu, which is a Ghanaian staple made from cassava. She is married, has three children, and works hard to help her husband support her household and pay their children's school fees. She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more of the ingredients she needs to make fufu.

loans.use: to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make fufu.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace D. has ten children. Married to a farmer, she helps support their large family by running a provision store in her village Mfuom, which is near Abura town in Ghana’s Central Region. Grace’s income from her provision store helps pay for school fees and some other household expenses. Currently, she sells goods such as tinned tomatoes and fish, oil and water. In order to grow her business, she needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more of these goods and a greater variety of items. This will help her attract a larger customer base and cater to the needs of her existing clients. The anticipated additional earnings will be reinvested into her business and also saved up for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more and a greater variety of items.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica  tiene 23 años ella es originaria de una localidad llamada la Mesa donde su principal actividad económica es el cultivo de la flor de Noche Buena para la temporada de diciembre. Doña Verónica se dedica al cultivo de flores de ornato y cultivo de plantas medicinales como ruda, hierbabuena, tomillo, manzanilla, maistra y muchas otras más. Ella tiene con ese negocio aproximadamente 2 años, doña Verónica comprara con el préstamo que le esta otorgando la financiera fertilizantes, insecticidas, tierra y macetas. Comenta que las macetas las compra en la cuidad de Morelia Michoacán y los fertilizantes los compra en Zitacuaro. Ella vende sus plantas en su vivero ya que es muy conocido en su comunidad y aveces sale a vender a la central de abastos de Zitacuaro. Ella dice que uno de sus hermanos fue que le enseño a cultivar ese tipo de flores y plantas medicinales ya que son muy bien vendidas en la comunidad, doña Verónica esta casada con el señor Lucio el cual es jornalero y tienen una niña de 6 años de edad la cual estudia la primaria. La meta que tiene con su negocio  es cultivar otro tipo de flores y venderlas en otros estados del país.
texts.en:
Verónica is 23 years old and originally from a town called La Mesa where the main business activity is cultivating poinsettias for the holiday season in December. Doña Verónica cultivates ornamental flowers and medicinal plants such as rue (an evergreen shrub), mint, thyme, chamomile, wormwood, and many others. She has been in this business for approximately two years.

Verónica will use this loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, soil, and pots. She says that she acquires her pots in the city of Morelia Michoacán and the fertilizers in Zitacuaro. Verónica sells her plants from her nursery which has become well-known in her community. Sometimes she sells at the central supply depot in Zitacuaro. She says that one of her siblings taught her how to grow flowers and medicinal plants that sell well in the community.

Doña Verónica is married to Sr. Lucio, who is a day laborer, and they have a six year old daughter who is in elementary school. Her goals for her business are to cultivate other types of flowers and sell them in other states within Mexico.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, soil, and pots.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene la edad D. 31 años, ella estudio hasta el segundo D. primaria porque le daba miedo ir a la escuela por que una vez que su mama la llevo a la escuela la atropellaron y a ella le dio miedo y decidió no regresar por temor que a ella también le pasara lo mismo. Doña Eusebia se dedica a cultivar diferentes flores comenta que en temporada naviD.ña ella cultiva la flor D. noche buena, y en los demás meses cultiva flores como geranio, aretillos, magones, velos D. novia y diferentes flores D. ornato mas. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para a compra D. tierra, abonos, macetas para vender sus flores, ella tiene con este negocio aproximadamente 3 años y dice que empezó con este tipo D. negocio porque su hermano y su concuño fue que le enseñaron a como cultivar las flores. Ella compre sus macetas y abonos en la cuidad D. Morelia Michoacán y dice que sale a venderlas en una carretilla por toda la carretera D. su localidad y poblaciones aledañas a su pueblito. Comenta “me gusta mucho cultivar las flores platicarles, cuidarlas ya que desD. que era pequeña mis padres me inculcaron el amor por la naturaleza. Doña Eusebia esta casada con el señor Crescencio el cual es jornalero ellos tienen 4 niños estudiantes D. primaria. La meta que tiene doña Eusebia es ahorrar un poco D. dinero para hacer mas granD. el vivero que tienen para cultivar un poco mas D. flor.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 31 years old. She only completed the second graD. because she got run over after her mother took her took to school, so she became afraid and decided not to return. Doña Eusebia cultivates different types of flowers. She says that during the Christmas season she grows poinsettias. In other months she grows geraniums, fuchsia shrubs, poppies, baby’s breath, and other ornamental flowers.

Eusebia is requesting a loan to purchase soil, compost, and pots for selling flowers. She has been in business for approximately three years and says she started it because her brother and brother-in-law taught her how to cultivate flowers. Eusebia buys her pots and compost in the city of Morelia Michoacán and says that she sells the flowers from a cart situated across from the highway in her town as well as in the surrounding neighborhoods. She says, “I enjoy talking about flowers and how to take care of them. At a young age, my parents instilled in me a love of nature.”

Doña Eusebia is married to Sr. Crescencio, who is a day laborer. They have four children who are elementary school students. Her goal is to save a little bit of money so that she can have a larger nursery for cultivating more flowers.

loans.use: to purchase soil, compost, and pots for cultivating ornamental flowers.

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 3 Group

texts.en:
This is Carmencita´s 4th loan with Esperanza International after she successfully repaid her previous loans, which each gave her one step toward improving her business. She will invest this loan to increase her sales. She has had her business for over two years, starting when Esperanza gave her the first loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to build her house.

Carmencita lives in Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture. Carmencita and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. Most of them sell clothing and miscellaneous products. This group is named Fe y Accion 3 (Faith and Action).

She requires a loan to buy more underwear and clothing to sell. She runs a small store in her house where she sells those products to her neighbors. By walking door to door she could assist new clients in other places and companies. 

She says that her favorite dream is to study to be a beautician, and she wants to have a Beauty Salon in the future. Carmencita and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sabino Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Sabino es soltero y una persona muy jovial, tiene 39 años de edad, y vive con un hijo pequeño aún. 
Se dedica a la compra y venta de especias en general desde el año 1995, hoy día cuenta con mucha clientela ya que recorre por toda la zona de Ñemby, San Lorenzo y Gran Asunción, más aún en su ciudad natal Carapegua.
El solicita el préstamo para comprar mercaderías a mayor escala (boldo, anís, albahaca, clavo de olor y otros), ya que tiene muchos pedidos, pues con el frío se comercializa por doquier las distintas especias y condimentos en toda la zona, pues son muy utilizados para infusiones de té, tereré o mate, además de servir muchos de ellos como medicina natural.
Su máximo sueño es incrementar su ingreso para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Sabino is single and a very jovial person. He is 39 years old and lives with a young son. Sabino has been buying and selling spices since 1995. Today he has many customers and travels throughout the districts of Ñemby, San Lorenzo, and Gran Asunción. He sells the most in his hometown of Carapegua.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy merchandise on a large scale such as boldo, anise, basil, cloves, and other spices since he has many orders. Due to the cold weather, these various spices and condiments are sold everywhere and used to infuse tea, tereré, or mate. In addition, many people use them as natural medicine.

His ultimate dream is to increase his income so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase boldo, anise, basil, cloves, and other spices.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La señora Eva es originaria de la localidad de San Felipe de los Alzati cuenta con 26 años de edad, madre soltera de un niño de nombre Luís Ángel de 4 años de edad el cual este año entrara al preescolar. Doña Eva es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora ya que ella quiere lo mejor para su pequeño hijo, ella se dedica al cultivo de flores como son los alcatraces amarillos y blancos, y hiervas de olor como son la mejorana, tomillo, hierbabuena entre otras. Eva esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de tierra, macetas, diferentes tipos de abonos e insecticidas, nos comenta que ella rento un vivero para poder cultivar sus flores ya que sale muy caro comprar un vivero, ella tiene con este negocio hace 5 años y comenta que sus hermanos fueron que le enseñaron a cultivar las flores, también nos comenta que hace y vende servilletas tejidas y almohadones. Doña Eva vende sus flores en la cuidad de Zitacuaro que se pone sobre la carretera en una carretilla y las ofrece a las personas que pasan por la carretera y otras las vende en su casa. La meta que tiene para su negocio la señora Eva es tener su propio vivero y darle una buena educación a su pequeño hijo que es su prioridad.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva is originally from the town of San Felipe de Los Alzati. She is a single mother with a four-year-old son named Luís Ángel who entered preschool this year. Doña Eva is an enterprising and hardworking woman who wants the best for her young son. She cultivates flowers, such as yellow calla lilies, and fragrant herbs such as marjoram, thyme, peppermint, and others.

Eva is requesting a loan so that she can buy soil, pots, different types of compost, and insecticides. She says that she rents a nursery for cultivating her flowers since it is very expensive to buy one. In addition, Eva indicates that makes and sells napkins and pillows. Doña Eva sells her flowers in the city of Zitacuaro. She has a cart along the highway and offers her goods to people who travel on the road and then sells other flowers from her home. Eva’s goal for her business is to have her own nursery so that she can provide her young son a good education, which is a priority.

loans.use: to purchase soil, pots, different types of compost, and insecticides for cultivating ornamental flowers.

loans.name: Maria Juaquina

texts.es: La señora Joaquina cuenta con 39 años de edad, es originaria de la localidad de la Mesa en el estado de Michoacán, muy cerca de la población se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca, muy visitada por turistas de todo el mundo ya que es un espectáculo único que nada mas en los meses de diciembre y enero se encuentran.
