Doña Joaquina se dedica al cultivo de flores como flor de noche buena, geranio y rosales. Ella vende sus flores en la central de abastos de la población de Zitacuaro, tiene con este negocio 6 años y comenta que sus papas fueron que les enseñaron a cuidar a la naturaleza. Ella dice “mis papas me decían que la mejor herencia que les podíamos dejar a nuestros hijos es el tener un mundo lleno de naturaleza y por eso hay que cuidarle y ayudarle a cuidarlos y a sembrar mas árboles y flores ya que son muy hermosas y nos dan vida”. Doña Joaquina esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar tierra fértil, macetas, esqueje (planta madre), fertilizantes, abonos, ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que viven con ella de nombres Alfonso y Leonor ambos trabajan y ayudan a doña Joaquina con los gastos del hogar. Joaquina es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable ya que también se dedica a hacer servilletas artesanales tejidas. La meta que tiene la señora es poner un  puesto de tacos en su localidad para tener otra entrada de dinero más.
texts.en: Señora Joaquina is 39 years old.  She is a native of the town of La Mesa, which is in the state of Michoacán.  Very near to her town is the Monarch Butterfly Sanctuary.  Tourists come from all over the world for this unique spectacle.  The butterflies come only in the months of December and January.   Doña Joaquina makes her living growing flowers, such as poinsettias, geraniums and rose bushes.  She sells her flowers in the wholesale food market in the town of Zitacuaro.  She has had her business for 6 years and says that it was her parents who taught her to care for nature.  She says, "my parents would tell me that the best legacy we can leave our children is a world full of nature, and that is why we must take care of nature and help it and plant more trees and flowers, for they are beautiful and give us life."  Doña Joaquina is requesting a loan from the finance company in order to purchase fertile land, flower pots, cuttings (from mature plants), fertilizers and manure.  She is a single mother and has two children who live with her.  Their names are Alfonso and Leonor, and they both work and help doña Joaquina with the household expenses.  Joaquina is a very hard-working and responsible woman, and she also earns a living making hand-woven napkins.  Her goal is to open a taco stand in her neighborhood in order to have another source of income.

loans.use: to grow flowers.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: La señora Maty como es conocida en su localidad tiene 45 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Laurentino el cual es albañil ellos tienen 11 hijos pero nada mas 7 viven con ellos de nombres Juan Carlos, Laura ambos estudiantes de secundaria, Jorge, Salvador, Roberto, Marco Antonio estudiantes de primaria y el pequeño Laurentino de 5 meses de edad. Doña Matilde se dedica al cultivo de aguacate, ella tiene un huerta de aproximadamente 200 árboles y tiene con ella 10 años dice que empezaron este proyecto porque su esposo empezó comprándole las plantas de tres cada quincena y ella las cultivaba y así poco a poco se hicieron de su huerta, en tiempo de cosecha sale a vender sus aguacates a la central de abastos de Zitacuaro por cubetas y abecés le rentan los árboles a los clientes que ya tienen. Ella esta pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de fertilizantes y de manguera para el riego de estas ya que les queda un poco retirado la toma de agua y para que todas alcancen a regarse y no se le seque en esta temporada de calor ira a comprar la manguera ya que ahorita tienen un poco de fruto pequeño y las esta cuidando mucho para que no se le sequen. La meta que tiene la señora Matilde con su huerta es seguir sembrando mas árboles de este fruto ya que si le dejan buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Maty, as she is known in her town, is 45 years old. She is married to Laurentino, who is a mason. They have 11 children, but only 7 live with them: by name, Juan Carlos, Laura (both secondary school students), Jorge, Salvador, Roberto, Marco Antonio (elementary school students) and little Laurentino, who is 5 months old. Matilde works growing avocados. She has a farm that has approximately  200 trees, and she has worked it for 10 years. She says that she began this project because her husband started to buy the plants by threes every two weeks, and she cultivated them. Thus, little by little they established their farm. During harvest time, she goes out to sell her avocados by the bucketful at the central warehouse of Zitacuaro, and sometimes they rent trees that already have fruit to customers. She is requesting a loan from the financial institution to buy fertilizers and hoses for irrigation, since the water source is a little bit far away, and this will help her reach all the trees to water them, so they don't dry out during this hot season. She will go to buy the hose because she will soon have some small fruit on the trees, and she is taking good care of them so that they don't dry out. Matilde's goal with her farm is to keep planting more avocado trees since they are giving her good earnings.

loans.use: buy supplies for her avocado farm.

loans.name: Leopoldina Ambrocia

texts.es: Leopoldina tiene 50 años, es una mujer luchadora y alegre, y a pesar de los constantes problemas que afronta, siempre busca la forma de salir adelante. Desde muy temprano se temprano ella se dedica a la venta de dulces, tiene más de 17 años en su negocio. Como todo negocio lo inicio con fondos propios y no fue fácil, ya que después tenía que salir a vender sus productos de manera ambulante. Por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsas, azúcar, leche, leña, tasas, cucharas entre otros. Sueña con hacer más grande su establecimiento y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leopoldina, age 50, is a determined and cheerful woman. Despite the constant problems she has had to face, she is always looking for ways to move forward. She begins her job selling sweets early in the morning. Leopoldina has been in this business for more than 17 years. Like all other entrepreneurs, she started her business using her own funds. Things did not begin easily since she had to sell her products as a traveling vendor.

Leopoldina is requesting a loan to buy bags, sugar, milk, firewood, cups, spoons, and other supplies. Her dreams include expanding her establishment and making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase bags, sugar, milk, firewood, cups, spoons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, reside en Alegría departamento de Usulután, vive en casa propia con su hijo de 6 años de edad y su madre de 48 años de edad; Ana se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal de Berlín, el horario de venta es de 6:00am a 6:00pm, tiene 5 años de experiencia. 
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de ropa en general como blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas de vestir y deportivas, esta inversión ayudara a que Ana crezca en su comercio de prendas de vestir, mejorando la atención a los clientes y aumentando las posibilidades de tener ganancias que le permitan ofrecer a su familia una condición más estable.
Sus aspiraciones es crecer en el comercio, tener un negocio muy fuerte, en lo personal pues que su familia cuente con lo necesario y sobretodo que su hijo crezca sano.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Alegría, in Usulután department.  She lives in her own home together with her 6 year-old son and her 48 year-old mother.  Ana sells clothes and her business is located in Berlín town market.  She sells her products there from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  She has five years experience.

Ana needs a loan to buy clothes such as blouses, skirts, pants, dress shirts and casual shirts.  This investment will help her to grow her clothes business, improve her customer service and increase her possibilities of making enough profits to be able to offer her family more stable living conditions.

Ana's aspirations are to grow in her business and to strengthen her business.  On a personal level, she would like her family to have everything they need and, above all, for her son to grow up healthy.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, dress shirts and casual shirts

loans.name: Zoryana

texts.en:
Zoryana is a market entrepreneur from Novomoskovsk. She sells household supplies and fishing items in the central marketplace of her home town. She is an entrepreneur of determination and focus. She has been working in this sphere of trade for over ten years. Currently, she makes over $1010 of net profit each month. 

Zoryana is seeking a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase additional merchandise and to re-stock her inventory for the summer season. She likes working with this type of merchandise even though many think it is strange that she sells men’s fishing supplies along with other items like knives, axes and blades. Zoryana is hoping to continue growing her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise and to re-stock her inventory for the summer season.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y es empleado al mismo tiempo, vive con su familia, su madre y un hijo; el negocio de ropa lo administra su madre y lo hace desde hace un año.
El actualmente desea invertir en el negocio, comprando más ropa y variar los estilos y colores, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones del comercio y poder ofrecer a los clientes opciones diferentes en prendas de vestir.
Para Carlos su proyección es aumentar el volumen de mercadería, ofrecer una amplia gama de ropa para niños y adultos, así mismo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. He makes a living selling new clothing and is also employed at the same time. He lives with his family, his mother and his daughter. The clothing business, which he has had for a year, is administrated by his mother.

He wishes to invest in the business, buying more clothing to vary the styles and colors. This purchase will help him to better his business and to be able to offer clients different clothing garment options.

Carlos plans on increasing the volume of merchandise to offer a wide range of clothing for children and adults, while increasing the quality of life for his family and also growing as a shopkeeper.

loans.use: To buy clothing of various fashionable styles and colors.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda: es casada y tiene 40 años la socia tiene 3 hijos de 13, 9, 8 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo en los cuales produce maíz, la socia luego de recoger el choclo y venderlo, toma el restante del maíz y lo seca, para venderlo en dos meses más cuando este producto eleve su precio, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y trabaja junto a su esposo y a su parientes, ellos también venden al por mayor a los comerciantes mayoristas y es bien conocida el producto del valle sagrado de los inkas por lo que tiene mayor acogida y sus productos son comprados por extranjeros y llevados fuera del país. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y remover la tierra para una nueva epoca de cultivo.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Natividad” which is located in Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and has three children (ages 13, 9, and 8). Yolanda divides her time between her daily activities and her small business. She has land on which she grows corn. After most of her harvest is collected and sold, Yolanda takes any remaining corn and dries it. She sells the corn two months later once the price has increased.

Yolanda is a hardworking woman who partners with her husband and his relatives. She also sells in bulk to the wholesale merchants and her products have been recognized within the Sacred Valley of the Incas. Her products are even purchased by foreigners and carried outside of the country. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizers, as well as pay to have her land plowed for the new crop season.

Yolanda is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers, as well as pay to have her land plowed for the new crop season.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino tiene 45 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Este hombre recorre muchos lugares todos los días, a pesar de ser un trabajo ya que solamente descansa para tomar agua. El es un hombre trabajador y futuro empresario pues siempre está pensando en un sin número de medios para mejorar sus ingresos por lo que es una persona muy ejemplar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de de repuesto de su vehículo, focos, caja de cambios y realizarle un chequeo a su taxi y así ofrecer un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Marcelino is 45 years old.  His business is offering a taxi service.  He drives many places every day.  He only rests to drink water.

Marcelino is a hard-working man and future entrepreneur as he is always thinking of lots of ways to improve his income.  He is an exemplary person.

Marcelino is requesting this loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle (headlamps and a gear box), and to have his taxi serviced so that he can offer a good service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts (headlamps and gear box), and to have his taxi serviced

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Mariée à un footballeur / revendeur, Akou est une jeune dame de 38ans dynamique qui revend des pagnes.  Elle revend au marché d’Akodesséwa après avoir acheter  au grand marché de Lomé. Elle est dans cette activité depuis 1990 et elle s’y plait. Elle veut cet argent pour acheter  des pagnes  pour vendre à toutes personnes pour avoir de bénéfices  afin de mieux s’occuper  de sa famille, avoir sa propre boutique  et après sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Akou is a young, 38-year-old, dynamic woman who sells pagnes (colorful print cloth). She is married to a footballer and reseller. She buys her merchandise at the grand market of Lomé, and conducts her sales at the Akodesséwa market. 

She started this business in 1990 and really enjoys it. She is seeking a loan to buy pagnes, which she will sell to anyone. She hopes to make profits that will help her to better care for her family, have her own shop, and then her own house.

loans.use: to buy pagnes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria: es casada y tiene 54 años la socia tiene 6 hijos  de los cuales 5 de ellos son independientes y uno tiene 18 años es el menor de la familia y la socia aún le sigue apoyando en los estudios y en todo lo referente a la economía y lo moral, la socia  tiene su negocio de verduras ella cultiva también en su terrenos verduras, la socia también a su vez tiene animales menores, tiene gallinas, cuyes, y estos los vende en la feria, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de cuyes para la venta. La socia compra animales menores, los cría, engorda y reproducen, la socia cuando alcanzan los animales la madures los vende. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD” community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Maria is 54 years old, married, and has six children.  Five of her children live independently but she still supports her youngest, who is 18, with his studies, and also financially and morally.  Maria has a vegetable business.  She grows vegetables on her own land.  She also raises young animals.  She keeps hens and guinea pigs which she sells at market.  Maria would like to invest her loan in buying guinea pigs to sell.  She buys young animals, raises them, fattens them and breeds them.  When they are grown, she sells them.  She is requesting her loan to buy young animals.

Maria is very grateful for her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy young animals

loans.name: Magdai

texts.es:
La señora Magdai Sánchez M., es madre soltera  quien afortunadamente  ya todos sus hijos están casados, tiene  a su responsabilidad a dos nietos y son: Axel de siete  años  de edad y Roxana de nueve años quienes son su razón de seguir adelante.

       Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes que lleva por nombre abarrotes kendra y solcito el préstamo el crédito para  invertirlo comprando mercancía de mejor precio y la que sus clientes desean comprar, en su negocio lleva   seis años  lo que nos comenta que le va bien.

       Se inspiro en ello para  tener de donde pagar los  gastos generados en su familia  ya que su esposo el abandono con sus hijos  pequeño y  tenía que buscar la manera  de trabajar, comenzó vendiendo frutas hasta  que sus hijos crecieron la apoyaron aponer su negocio de abarrotes  que es con lo  que está trabajando hasta ahora.

      Su sueño es seguir trabajando para apoyar a sus nietos a seguir adelante con sus estudios y lograr termine una carrera de la que les pueda ser útil más adelante.
texts.en:
Magdai Sánchez M. is a single mother.  Fortunately, all her children are now married.  She has two grandchildren in her care: 7 year-old Axel and 9 year-old Roxana.  They are her reason for carrying on.

Magdai has a grocery store called 'Abarrotes Kendra' (Kendra Groceries).  She requested this loan to invest in buying merchandise that her customers would like to buy for a better price.  She has been running her store for six years and she tells us that it is doing well.

Magdai set up her business so that she would have enough money to cover her family's expenses since her husband left her alone with her young children and she had to find a way to work.  She started out selling fruit and then when her children grew up they supported her in setting up her grocery store which is where she now works.

Magdai's dream is to continue working so that she can support her grandchildren in getting ahead in their studies, so that they can go on to complete a university degree which will be useful to them in the future.

loans.use: to invest in buying merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Akoko Abla

texts.fr: Résidant à Bé-Kpota (un quartier pas très loin de la ville), Abla est mère d’un(01) enfant.  Elle  vend des pagnes  depuis 1987 en achetant au Grand Marché de Lomé et en revendant au marché d’Akodesséwa. Elle est une femme active qui  sait se battre pour assurer  un avenir meilleur  à son enfant, avoir son propre terrain pour construire sa maison et voir son activité prospérer c’est dans ce sens qu’elle désire ce premier prêt pour acheter des pagnes afin de revendre pour avoir de bénéfices.
texts.en: A resident of Bé-Kpota (a district not far from the city), Abla is a mother of one child. She has been selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) since 1987 by buying at the Grand Market of Lomé and selling at the market of Akodesséwa. Abla is a very active woman who knows how to struggle to ensure her child will have a better future, to have her own plot of land for building a house, and to see her business prosper. For these aims, she would like to obtain this initial loan in order to buy pagne cloth for resale, so as to make a profit.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Lidia  Hernández Sánchez, vive en la localidad de Ángel albino corzo, es madre soltera con una hija de nombre Kendra Yojari  de diez años que cursa el  cuarto de primaria.

         El préstamo solicitado lo invirtió en la compra de mercancía como  son: azúcar, galletas, aceite, frijol, entre otros,  en esta actividad lleva   tres años y ocho meses lo que nos comenta que le va  bien a pesar de las temporadas.

         Se inspiro por su hija ya que fue madre soltera  y para sacarla adelante tenía que tener algo de lo que pudiera trabajar y lograr solventar sus gastos  generados en su hogar.

         Su deseo es que con el tiempo logre ahorrar para trabajar y así tener como comprar su material  de lo que utilizara para comenzar a construir su estética, para seguir trabajando y ganar su propio dinero para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the locality of Angel Albino Corzo, and is a single mother with a daughter named Kendra Yojari, 10 years old, who is in her 4th year of primary school.

The loan Rosa requests will be used to purchase merchandise such as sugar, cookies, cooking oil, and beans, among other things. She has been engaged in this activity for 3 years and 8 months, and she says it's going well, though a bit on and off.

Rosa, as a single mother, is motivated by her daughter.  To advance Kindra, Rosa had to have something she could work at to cover the costs generated by the household.

Rosa's desire is that over time, she will be able to save from her earnings and thereby, be able to buy the material she would need to begin to build a beauty salon, so that she can work there and earn her own money to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 4 Group

texts.en:
Antonia lives in Hato Mayor, one of the country’s more rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture. Antonia and her group of five members are taking loans for their businesses. Most of them sell clothes and miscellaneous products. This group is named Fuerza Divina 4 (Divine strength).

This is Antonia´s 11th loan with Esperanza International after she successfully repaid her previous loans, each of which gave her one more step toward improving her business and her life. She said that she has been able to start building her house, which was one of her most difficult challenges. Now her home is in the building process, thanks to these loans, her savings and profits from her business.

Antonia runs a miscellaneous products sales business. She will invest this loan to buy accessories and underwear to sell. She has had her business for over five years, starting when she received her first Esperanza loan. 

She says that her favorite thing is to work on her business and she wants to see her children become professionals. Antonia and her group are thankful for your support!

loans.use: to buy underwear and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Yareni

texts.es:
La señora Yareny   T. S., vive en la localidad  de  Ángel Alvino Corzo, Municipio de Copainala Estado de Chiapas, México.

     El préstamo solicitado lo invirtió en la compra de cosméticos de la marca jafra, como son: labiales, perfumes, maquillajes, entre otros,  y comenta que le va bien a pesar de qué tiene que trabajar fuera de su hogar.

     Ella inicio esta actividad para  tener de donde solventar sus gastos  que se generan en su hogar, aun  que es  una mujer sola desea  lo mejor para su bien estar. 
Su deseo más grande es lograr crecer con su negocio que es  con lo que depende para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yareny T. S. lives in the town of  Ángel Alvino Corzo, in the Copainala Municipality in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  

The loan she is seeking is to buy Jafra-brand cosmetics, including lipsticks, perfumes, foundation, etc.  She says things are going well, even though she has to work outside her home.  

Yareny started her business so she could pay off her household expenses, and, though she is a single woman, she wants to be as comfortable as possible.  

Her greatest wish is to succeed in growing her business, which is what she depends on to get ahead.

loans.use: to catalog-purchase Jafra-brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional hardware inventory.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Aminata.  She is married, and has two school-going children. She has one additional dependent, whom she adopted.  In the year 1992, she started her Africana dress and sandals business. She has been able to manage the business and has a very good loan repayment history. She opens her business 6 days a week and 9 hours a day. 

Aminata has received and successfully repaid one loan and now needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. She needs a loan in order to buy African dresses, sandals and accessories for her business. In the future Aminata hopes to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sandals, necklaces, bracelets and Bamako clothing to sell.

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Angelina  García Gutiérrez, vive en la localidad de Emiliano Zapata, Municipio de Tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México. Ella es casada  con el señor Elías Sánchez Chavarría y con quien procreo siete hijos quienes ya están casados.
El préstamo que solicito en fundación realidad es para invertirlo en la compra  de trastes de peltre como son: ollas, sartenes, visones, entre otros, nos comenta que con esta actividad lleva ocho años y cinco lo que formalizo apenas solicito un préstamo en compartamos y le fue muy, es así como ha estado trabajando todo este tiempo.
Para iniciar esta actividad lo animo una compra ya que ella le entregaba la mercancía para que la vendiera en su localidad le grado la idea y es como lo sigue practicando pero ahora ya es de ella, de lo que se siente contenta porque con ello se apoya para sus ingresos de su hogar.
Lo que Más desea es que Dios le siga prestando vida  para seguir  trabajando y así progresar con su pequeña actividad.
Las personas que integran en el grupo son cuatro señoras más y cada una se dedica a diferente actividad:
Silveria C. Guzmán: ella se dedica a la panadería
Blanca Leticia Espinosa H.: se dedica a criar pollos de rancho para posteriormente venderlo.
Manuela Gómez Hernández: engorda pollo con alimento para después venderlo.
Sofía García Sánchez: ella se dedica a la venta de tamales, de bola y hoja de guineo.
texts.en:
Angelina García Gutiérrez lives in the town of Emiliano Zapata, in the municipality of Tecpatan, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Elías Sánchez Chavarría. Together they have seven children who are already married.
The loan that the reality foundation is asking for will be used to purchase pewter dishes such as: pots, pans, and other things. She tells us that she has eight years of experience with this activity. For five years she has been asking for shared loans. It has taken her far, and in this way she has been working all this time.
To start this activity, she made a purchase. Since she had been turning in the goods to be sold in her community, the idea was supported. It is in this way that she continues practicing. But now it is hers. She feels happy because with it she is supported with the income for her home.
What she wants the most is that God will continue to give her life to continue working and therefore progress with her small activity.
The people that make up the rest of the group are four women. Each one does a different activity:
Silveria C. Guzmán: She works in a bakery.
Blanca Leticia Espinosa H.: She raises ranch chickens to sell later on.
Manuela Gómez Hernández: She fattens chickens with food to sell later.    
Sofía García Sánchez: She sells tamales, in a ball and banana leaves.

loans.use: To buy pewter dishes to later sell in the same area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest immediately in a lbigger quantity of footwear, including sandals and slipper, in both women's and men's styles

loans.name: Brahunda Group

texts.es:
A 40 minutos de veraC. se encuentra una comunidad llamada barahunda esta cominudad se caracteriza porque cerca de ahi se encuentran varios posos petroleros de PEMEX. En esta comunidad existe un grupo llamado “Barahunda” al cual llamaron asi porque es el nombre de su comunidad y por el significado de la palabra que es: “fiesta, bullicio o ruido ” ya que este grupo se caracteriza por ser muy alegre y unido.
Doña Elia Moran es uno de los  integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 60 años y tuvo 6 hijos los cuales ya estan casados actualmente vive con dos de sus nietos. Ella nos platica que hace mas de 7 años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar y con el apoyo de sus hijos abrio una muebleria en su comunidad a la cual llamo "Muebleria Diana"  en honor a la mas pequeña de sus nietas, ella tambien se dedica a la cria de puercos tiene un pequeño corral en la parte de atras de su casa en el cual tiene a sus puercos. Doña Elia necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de alimento para sus cerdos y algunos muebles(cajoneras, licuadoras, batidoras y planchas) para resurtir su negocio. Ella espera que con este credito o su negocio progrese y las vantas aumenten ya que desea obtener buenas ganancias para poder pintar su negocio y seguir invirtiendo en el.
Doña Elia nos dijo: "voy a provechar para agradecer a la fundacion por el prestamo y la confianza que me ha otorgado".
Los otros  integrantes del grupo son:
Maria de Lourdes G. C.- venta de catálogo cosmeticos
Josefa C.- venta de pollos y dulces 
Alicia Sánchez C.-venta de productos naturistas 
Rosa Ramírez R.-venta por cata lago de cosméticos
Maricela T.- venta de ropa y visuteria
Iraís E. Hernández-venta de zapatos para dama
Mayra M. - Venta de carne de cerdo
Elizabeth M.-comercio de ganado
texts.en:
Forty minutes from VeraC. is a community called Barahunda.  This community is noted for the fact that there are several PEMEX oil wells located there.  In this community there is a group called 'Barahunda'.  The group chose this name because it is the name of their community and also because the word means 'fiesta', 'bustle' or 'noise" which describes this very cheerful and united group.

Elia Moran is one of the group's members.  She is 60 years old and has six children who are all married.  She currently lives with two of her grandchildren.  She tells us that more than 7 years ago she wanted to work and, with the support of her children, she opened a furniture store in her community called "Muebleria Diana" (Diana's Furniture Store) in honor of her youngest granddaughter.  Elia also raises pigs.  She has a small farmyard behind her home where she keeps her pigs.  Elia needs this loan to invest in buying feed for her pigs and some household products (chests of drawers, blenders, mixers and irons) to re-stock her business.

Elia hopes that this loan will help her to make progress in her business and that her sales will increase since she would like to make good profits so that she can paint her business and continue investing in it.  Elia tells us "I am going to take this opportunity to thank Fundación Realidad for the loan and the trust that they have placed in me". 

The other members of this group are:
Maria de Lourdes G.-C., who sells cosmetics through a catalog
Josefa C., who sells chickens and sweet treats
Alicia Sánchez C., who sells natural products
Rosa Ramírez R., who sells cosmetics through a catalog
Maricela T., who sells clothes and costume jewelry
Iraís E. Hernández, who sells ladies' shoes
Mayra M., who sells pork
Elizabeth M., who sells livestock

loans.use: to buy furniture, blenders, irons, beds, pig feed, catalogs, men's and women's clothes, and supplies for making Mexican snacks

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna is 35 years old. She is married to a school teacher and has a 10-year-old child. In 1996, she established her imported food stuff business. She began her business when she realized that she needed to contribute financially to provide livelihood for their family. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day. 

Memuna has a good loan repayment history. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy more imported stuff to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of imported stuff for her business.

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
José, administra un Car Wash, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposa y su familia, aun no tienen hijos, él inicio el car Wash hace un año, dedicándose a tiempo completo, con este trabajo logra mantener los gastos de la familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina para lavar vehículos, su objetivo es tener en mejores condiciones el negocio y espera que con la compra logre parte de su objetivo.
José cuenta con un sueño y es administrar dos negocios en diferentes puntos de Jiquilisco, que le permita mejorar las condiciones actuales de su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in the town of  Jiquilisco of the department of Usulután with his wife and his family; they do not have children yet. A year ago, he started a car wash business -- a job that he does full-time and that allows him to cover his family's expenses.

José is looking for a loan in order to purchase machinery for his car wash business. His goal is to improve the level of his service, and he hopes that this purchase would allow him to do that. José's dream is to administer two car wash locations in Jiquilisco -- something that would allow him to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase machinery for a car wash business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy thermoses for coffee and supplies

loans.name: Wulamatu

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Wulamatu S., a single woman with one dependent, her elder sister’s son. Wulamatu, who is very determined to conscientiously improve her business, has been selling bags for the past two years, working seven days a week for ten hours each day. She is now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy a large quantity of various bags for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bags for her business

loans.name: Veronica Cecilia

texts.es: Verónica Cecilia P. es una mujer muy conocida en el barrio san José de la ciudad de Barranquilla, pues allí tiene un gimnasio donde ofrece para la venta productos energéticos que regulan el organismo después de las actividades lúdico-deportivas, que allí se practican y que sirven para para rehidratar y recuperar carbohidratos  y electrolitos. Verónica comenzó haciendo ejercicios en la sala de su casa con familiares,  a los que se fueron agregando vecinos y gradualmente amigos de los asistentes y referidos,  los que hoy conforman su más consentida clientela, por eso Verónica en términos de que sus clientes estuvieran mejor atendidos, ha ido gradualmente agregando productos a una pequeña vitrina que compró y que debe permanecer surtida, pues sus clientes consumen estos productos en grandes cantidades y como la clientela  ha aumentado   terminan rápidamente con la oferta que ella hace de agua, gatorade, café, jugos naturales de naranja etc. Este es su primer financiamiento al que está aplicando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará Agua, gatorade, naranjas y productos energéticos en general, de contado y en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Verónica Cecilia P. is a very well-known woman in the San José neighborhood in Barranquilla.  That is where she has a gymnasium where she sells energy products.  These products regulate the body after recreational sporting activities at the gym.  These products rehydrate and replenish carbohydrates and electrolytes.

Verónica started doing exercises with family members in the living room of her house.  Neighbors started joining them, and gradually friends of the assistants and people who were referred did as well.  Now they are her most favorite customers.  That is why Verónica has gradually been adding products in a small display case that she purchased so that her customers can be better served.

She needs to always be well-stocked because her customers consume these products in great quantities.  As her number of customers has increased, she quickly runs out of water, Gatorade, coffee, and orange juice, etc.

This is the first loan that she has applied for with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy water, Gatorade, oranges, and energizing products on installments and in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy energizing products and soft drinks

loans.name: Octavio De Jesús

texts.es:
Octavio M. trabaja como vendedor ambulante hace 18 años. Comenzó con este oficio en las calles de la ciudad de Medellín y hace 10 años aproximadamente decidió especializarse en la venta y reparación de sombrillas. Usualmente trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:30a.m. a 7:00p.m, pero como es independiente tiene la posibilidad de escoger sus horarios según sus facilidades. Octavio es padre de 5 hijos por lo tanto su mayor sueño es generar más ingresos que le permitan darle a su familia comodidad económica y mejorar su calidad de vida.
 
Octavio debe surtir su negocio cada determinado tiempo pero a veces sus ingresos no le alcanzan para comprar la mercancía necesaria y así obtener mejores ganancias. Es por esto que solicita el crédito porque es conciente que comprando los insumos al por mayor podrá tener mayores beneficios y un incremento en las ventas.
texts.en:
Octavio M. has worked as an itinerant salesman for 18 years.  He started in this line of work on the streets of the city of Medellín.  Approximately ten years ago he decided to specialize in selling and repairing umbrellas.

He usually works Mondays through Saturdays from 6:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Because he works independently he can choose his schedule according to what works best for him.

Octavio has five children, and his greatest dream is to generate more income.  This would allow him to make his family financially comfortable and improve their quality of live.

Octavio needs to stock his business every so often.  Sometimes his income is not enough to buy the needed merchandise to get improved income.  That is why he is requesting the loan.  He knows that by purchasing the supplies wholesales he will be able to have greater benefits and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of fertilizers.

loans.name: Antoliano

texts.es:
El sr Antoliano, tiene 72 años, está casado con la sra. Waldina Iriarte, con quien tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, de los cuales 2 viven con ellos, una de 30 años que es profesora y otra de 22 años  que es licenciada.
El titular es taxista desde que tenia 23 años,  o sea en el  año 1962 ya obtuvo para su Parada de taxi en el mismo lugar que actualmente utiliza.
Nació en la ciudad de Yaguarón, pero está radicado desde chico en la ciudad de Asunción, manifiesta que haciendo un resumen de los años de trabajo que lleva recorriendo todas las calles del Gran Asunción, dice que “es un trabajo que tiene su riesgo, muchas veces se trabaja en turnos de la noche, o se lleva pasajeros que muchas veces no conocemos y tienen apariencia peligrosa, pero también esta profesión genera buenos ingresos como hay otras veces en que no pasa nada,” apuntó.
Su señora es de profesión modista, posee su propia clientela y con los aportes de sus hijos el sr. P. tiene una vida digna que es lo que le da satisfacción.
El solicita el crédito para poder arreglar su vehículo, realizarle un mantenimiento y seguir generando ganancias a la canasta familiar.
texts.en:
Antoliano is 72 years old and married to Waldina Iriarte.  They have four grown-up children, two of whom still live with them.  One is 30 years old and a teacher, the other is 22 years old and a college graduate.

Antoliano has been working as a taxi driver for 23 years.  He obtained his place on a taxi stand in 1962 and he still works from the same spot.  He was born in the city of Yaguarón but has lived in the city of Asunción since he was a young boy.  He gives us a summary of the years he has worked the streets of Gran Asunción.  He says "It is a job that has its risks.  Often you work night shifts or carry passengers who you do not know, who might look dangerous.  However, the job also makes good money as there are other times when nothing bad happens".

Antoliano's wife is a dressmaker.  She has her own customer base and, together with the money his children make, Mr P. has a decent life which makes him pleased.  He is requesting this loan so that he can repair his vehicle, have some maintenance work done on it, and continue making profits for his family.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu M. is a 29-year-old business woman. She is married and has one girl child aged 9. She has three additional dependents who live with her because they are her relatives and she opted to assist with their schooling. 

In 2004, Kadiatu established a local food business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant and empowered to assist her husband in providing livelihood for their family. 

She opens her business six days a week and eight hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Kadiatu requires this loan in order to purchase local food for her business. "This loan will help boost my savings for my children's education," said Kadiatu. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy local food for her business

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Susana, reside en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y su hija de 6 meses de nacida, ella tiene el negocio desde hace 10 años, ofrece a los clientes arroz, frijoles, azúcar, boquitas, aceite y detergentes.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de más mercadería como arroz, aceite, pastas, condimentos y detergentes, esta compra le ayudara a tener más productos a disponibilidad de los clientes.
Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y así mismo la vivienda para tener una casa digna junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Susana lives with her husband and her six-month-old daughter in the town of San Carlos of the Morazán department. She makes her living selling basic necessity products -- a business that she has been running for ten years, offering her clients items such as rice, beans, sugar, snacks, cooking oil, and detergent.

Susana is currently seeking a loan to purchase additional inventory of rice, cooking oil, pasta, seasonings, and detergent. This purchase will allow her to ensure product availability for her clients. Susana's objective is to improve her business which in turn would allow her to improve her living conditions and have a decent home for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory: rice, cooking oil, seasonings, detergent, etc

loans.name: Maria Basilia

texts.es:
María, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, María vende tortillas de lunes a domingo, en su casa y prepara la venta de tamales una vez por semana.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra maíz y leña, estos materiales son muy necesarios para mejorar su producción y tener disponibilidad de materiales.
Su aspiración es ayudar a sus hijos ya que estudian y que estos puedan superarse y tener mejores oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
María lives in San Carlos in Morazán department with her husband and their four children.  She sells tortillas and tamales (cornmeal and meat or beans wrapped in corn husks or banana leaves) daily in her house.  She makes the tamales once a week for sale.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn and firewood which she needs to increase her production with the materials on hand.
Her wish is to help her children now that they are in school so that they can do well and have better opportunities to develop.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Jose Irrael

texts.es:
José reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y una hija en casa de sus suegros, su trabajo es engordar a los cerdos para comercializarlos, también en temporada cultiva maíz y frijol.
El solicita un préstamo que necesita para comprar productos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, también comprar cerdos, esto le ayudara para mejorar su negocio y contar con esta fuente de ingreso por un largo tiempo.
Su sueño es comprar un lote donde pueda construir su propia casa y vivir con sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Jose lives in  San Carlos in the department of Morazán.  He raises pigs and cultivates corn and beans.  He lives with his wife and daughter in his in-law's house.  He works to fatten the pigs so that he can sell them, and at the same time he cultivates corn and beans according to the season.

He is requesting a loan because he needs to buy farming supplies such as organic and chemical fertilizers.  He also wants to buy pigs, because that would help him to improve his business and have a source of income for a longer time.

His dream is to buy a plot of land where he could build his own home and live with his children and his wife.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Abdulai C.. He is married and has one child, aged 1 year. 

Abdulai has been selling motor spare parts and lubricants. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 400,000 every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Abdulai requires this loan in order to buy engine oil for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 150,000. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drums of engine oil for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo, reside en Quelepa, departamento de San Miguel, trabaja en Fibras de El Salvador (elaboración de muebles), vive solo, es viudo y sus hijos tienen sus propios hogares, desde joven inicio como ayudante de un taller y hace 10 años instalo su propio taller donde perfecciona el oficio de trabajar con fibra de vidrio.
El necesita un préstamo para la compra de resina (barril), hierro, tubos cilíndricos, cuadrados, tornillos y otros materiales; Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar una buena compra y a un precio más bajo de lo normal.
Sus aspiraciones es crecer como microempresario, tener una buena solvencia económica para el pago de las cuotas de este préstamo y para cubrir sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in Quelepa in the department of San Miguel.  He has a workshop called "Fibras de El Salvador" where he makes furniture made of fiberglass.  He is a widower who lives alone; his children have their own homes.  From the time that he was very young he worked as an assistant in a workshop.  Ten years ago he set up his own workshop where he perfects the craft of working with fiberglass.

He needs a loan to buy resin (a barrel), iron, cylindrical tubes, drafting squares, screws and other supplies.  This loan will help him to make a good buy at a price that is lower than usual.

He aspires to grow as a businessman and to have good earnings so that he can make the payments on this loan and also cover his personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy resin (a barrel), iron, cylindrical tubes, drafting squares and screws

loans.name: Yonis

texts.es:
Yonis, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 4 años, él tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta labor, aprendió de sus padres y lo realiza todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, dependiendo de la temporada.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para el suelo, con esto espera realizar una buena siembra de maíz y frijol, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para cubrir el gasto y preparase para la temporada.
Su objetivo es trabajar por mucho tiempo, ya que de su trabajo depende su familia, por lo que su aspiración es el desarrollo económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Yonis lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans.  He lives with his wife and his 4 year-old son.  He has been doing this work for 8 years.  He learned how to farm from his parents, and he works every day from 6 am until 3pm, depending on the season.

He is requesting a loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and treatments for his soil; with these supplies he hopes to have a good harvest of corn and beans.  This loan will be a great help to him, allowing him to cover his expenses and prepare for the upcoming season.

His goal is to work for a long time, since his family depends on his work.  His goal is to create economic progress for his family.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, and other soil treatments

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Hawa T.. She is married and has five children aged 19, 17,11, 9 and 2 years. 

In the year 2009, Hawa established her provision, imported food and drinks business. She began her business with the hope of generating enough income to help her husband support their family. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 SLL every month. 

Hawa needs a loan in order to buy additional provisions, imported food and drinks for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 100,000. 

In the future, Hawa plans to get a house for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, imported food and provisions such as milk, sugar and margarine.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Don Mario, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, se dedica al cultivo agrícola desde hace 30 años, el trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, él vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 11, 15 y 19 años de edad, ellos dependen económicamente.
Actualmente don Mario iniciara los procesos sobre el cultivo de maíz y frijol, para lo que solicita un préstamo y poder comprar abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas,  esta inversión le ayudara a contar con todo lo necesario y echar andar el cultivo de este año.
Su objetivo es continuar cosechando la tierra, trabajando fuerte por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  He has been farming for 30 years, a trade that he learned from his parents.  He works every day from 6am until 3pm.  He lives with his family, and has 3 children aged 11, 15 and 19 years, who are financially dependent upon him.  Now, Mario is ready to start planting corn and beans, and so he is requesting a loan to purchase manure, fertilizer and pesticide.  This investment will help him to have everything he needs to put his crops in this year.

His goal is to continue harvesting the land, working hard to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra Milena C. S. de 33 años vive en el barrio Santuario de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ella es casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 6 años; Sandra Milena tiene su propio negocio donde comercializa productos de aseo personal y doméstico, como talcos, desodorantes, cremas dentales, desinfectantes, papel higiénico, medicamentos de venta libre y artículos de la canasta familiar, mediante el sistema de crédito y también de contado;  este negocio se deriva de la actividad que su esposo desempeñó como impulsador de estos productos en una empresa y cuando dejó de trabajar en ella,   utilizó su liquidación en el montaje de un negoció  independiente y ya conocido por él, enseñando también a Sandra a realizarlo para que lo apoyara y generaran ingresos juntos. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará jabones, desodorantes, talcos, cremas dental. Su sueño es más adelante tener un vehículo propio que le facilite la distribución de mercancías para la conservación de los productos que comercializa y lograr aumentar su capital de trabajo para fortalecer su negocio y con ello poder brindar a sus hijos una educación de calidad que canalice su éxito. Mientras tanto Sandra continúa trabajando con su esposo manejando una rentabilidad no menor del 22% la cual tiene como meta incrementarla, aplicando los créditos a su negocio y consiguiendo mejores oportunidades de compras que beneficien a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena C. S., 33, lives in the Santuario neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla.  She's married and the mother of 3 children between the ages of 1 and 6.  She has her own business selling personal hygiene and home products like powders, deodorants, tooth paste, disinfectants, toilet paper, over-the-counter drugs, and groceries.  She takes cash and credit.  

The business grew out of her husband's job. He promoted similar products for a company, and when he stopped working there, he used his severance pay to start his own independent business, since he already knew the field.  He taught Sandra, too, so she could help out and they could make money together.  

This will be Sandra's first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll buy soaps, deodorants, powders, ant tooth paste.  Her dream is to later on have her own car to make it easier to store and distribute merchandise, and to grow working capital to strengthen the business. That way she can give her children a quality education so they can be successful.

In the meantime, Sandra keeps on working with her husband, bringing in a profit of no less than 22%, which it's her goal to increase.  She's using her loans for her business and to gain better opportunities to buy products which will benefit her customers.

loans.use: to buy soaps, deodorants, powders, and tooth paste to sell.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Abdul K.. He is a widower and has one child, aged 9 years. 

In the year 2009, Abdul established his used-clothing business. He began this business because he believed he ccould get enough income to support his family.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 400,000 every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Abdul requires this loan in order to buy bails of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. 

In the future, Abdul plans to buy a larger quantity of clothes to supply to other traders, to hire sales persons, and to open another stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bails of used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Diana Alexandra

texts.es:
Diana de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un taller de costura y confección. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con el haciendo costuras y confección.

Su taller lo tiene ubicado en una parte de su casa ya que aun no tiene capital suficiente para poder incursionar en un local. Ella hace ropa por pedido y las vende o espera que las retiren los dueños.  Aunque su negocio lo comenzó cuando tenía poco capital ella ha vendió incrementando sus taller. Quiere continuar con su taller por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar telas y tener más oportunidades de trabajar.
texts.en:
Diana is 35 years old. She is a hardworking woman that has a sewing and tailoring workshop. She has high aspirations for her business. That is why she wants to continue sewing and tailoring.
Her workshop is located in a part of her house since she doesn't have enough money to be able to set up in a different location. She makes clothes by request and sells them or hopes that the owners take it away. Although she started her business when she had little money, she has been increasing her amount of work. She wants to continue her business. That is why she asks for the loan to buy fabric and to have more working opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es:
Flor, es comerciante D. frutas y verduras, resiD. en San Jorge departamento D. San Miguel, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 6, 8 y 11 años D. edad, posee el negocio desD. hace 7 años y fue fundado por iniciativa propia junto a su esposo, trabaja todos los días D. la semana D. 6:00am a 6:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades con el negocio.
Ella quiere invertir en la compra D. tomates, papas, uvas, bananos y otras más, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra con el gasto y le ayuD. a fortalecer el negocio, tratando D. tener para los clientes la mejor mercadería.
Para ella su objetivo es tener una fuente D. ingreso estable, para cubrir los gastos D. sus hijos y velar por todas las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Flor is a fruit and vegetable merchant. She resides in San Jorge in the Department of San Miguel. Flor is married and lives with her husband and three children (ages 6, 8, and 11). She has managed her business for seven years and started it through her own initiative and that of her husband. Flor works every day of the week from 6am to 6pm. As of this date, she has not had any difficulties with her business.

Flor wants to invest in the purchase of tomatoes, potatoes, grapes, bananas, and other types of produce. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to cover the expense and strengthen her business by attracting more customers with the best merchandise.

Her goal is to have a stable source of income to cover her children’s expenses and proviD. for all of the household needs.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, potatoes, grapes, bananas, and other types of produce.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta forma parte del banco comunal “Creciendo con Fe” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de productos de repostería, además tiene un bazar ubicado en su casa. Los productos de repostería los realiza en su casa y posteriormente los entrega a sus clientes, ya que la mayoría son productos a pedido. Marta trabaja de lunes a sábado, vendiendo postres por las mañanas y por las tardes se dedica a la producción de repostería, también realiza chocolates de diferentes sabores. Además de atender su bazar con artículos varios. Durante el mes de diciembre Marta participa de una feria, en la cual ofrece y vende sus productos. 
La mercadería para su bazar la compra en la ciudad de Santiago y los insumos para sus productos de amasandería los compra en distribuidoras y chocolaterías.
Con el préstamo comprará artículos para su bazar específicamente poleras, frazadas de polar, camisetas. Toda esta inversión para el día de la madre que es durante la quincena de mayo. 
Además tiene proyectado comenzar con el negocio de la producción y venta de huevos de chocolate para la pascua, que es durante el mes de abril.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido para vender sus productos y sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarle una mejor calidad educacional a sus hijos y una vida más confortable. 
Marta vive junto a sus hijos de 19 y 11 años de edad, además de su nieta de 2 años y su madre. Ella es quien le ayuda en su negocio.
Marta se siente a gusto con lo que hace, realizada y útil con su negocio.
Además, está muy agradecida del crédito y apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, respecto a las reuniones Marta participa activamente, ya que también es la tesorera de su grupo. Con los talleres ha aprendido contabilidad, conocimientos que ha ido aplicando a su negocio. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Marta belongs to the communal bank "Creciento con Fe," in the city of Viña del Mar.  She has a business making and selling pastries.  She also has a store that is located in her house. She makes her pastry products in her house, and later she delivers them to her customers, since she makes most of her products to order.  Marta works from Mondays to Saturdays, selling pastries in the mornings and making pastries in the afternoons. She also makes different varieties of chocolates, and attends to her store where she sells a variety of items.  During the month of December Marta participates in a market where she sells her products. She buys the merchandise for her store from Santiago, and the supplies for her bakery from wholesalers and wholesale chocolate merchants.

With the loan she will buy items for her store, specifically: T-shirts, fleece blankets and shirts.  All of this investment is for Mother's Day, which falls on the 15th of May.  In addition, she has plans to start making and selling chocolate Easter eggs, as Easter comes in the month of April.  

Marta's goal is to have a place to sell her products. At the personal level, she dreams of  providing her children with a quality education and a more comfortable life.

Marta lives with her children, who are 19 and 11, her 2 year-old  granddaughter and her mother, who helps her with the business.  

Marta feels good about what she does, and her business gives her a sense of accomplishment and usefulness.  She is also very grateful for the loan and the support provided by the Fondo Esperanza.  Marta participates actively in the meetings there, since she is also the treasurer for her group.  Through the workshops she has learned accounting, knowledge that she has also applied to her business.

Viña del Mar is a city and community that is located on the central coast of Chile.  It is known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios that are found in some of the older homes in the city.  In addition, it is considered to be the tourism capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, fleece blankets and shirts

loans.name: Jose Geronimo

texts.es:
José, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, él está dedicado a la compra y venta de ganado, también cultivo de maíz.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vaca y pagar el alquiler del terreno donde cultivara este año, esta ayuda será muy importante para José, ya que tanto como su familia dependen del trabajo que realiza.
Su objetivo es tener una fuente de ingreso para dar a su familia y darle lo necesario.
texts.en:
José lives in San Carlos, in the department of Morazán, and his business is farming and ranching. He lives with his wife and children. He works buying and selling cattle, and he also grows corn.

He is requesting a loan to buy a cow and also to pay the rent for the land he will farm this year. This help will be very important for José, since both he and his family depend on the work he does. 

His goal is to have a source of income to give himself and his family what they need.

loans.use: to buy a cow and pay the rent for the land where he will grow corn.

loans.name: Zoila De Jesus

texts.es:
Zoila, resiD. en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y ropa, es casada y tiene un hijo D. 24 años D. edad, ella desarrolla el negocio desD. hace 10 años, dicha actividad la realiza D. 7:00am a 4:00pm, hasta la fecha no presenta problemas para realizar este negocio.
Ella quiere invertir en mercadería comprando lociones, cosméticos y ropa, para ello solicita un préstamo que cubra esta compra, ayudando así a fortalecer el negocio y generar más ingresos, estos le servirán para pagar los gastos familiares.
Para Zoila mantenerse con el negocio y su principal objetivo, pues D. él depenD. su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila resides in San Miguel. She sells cosmetics and clothing. Zoila is married and has a son who is 24 years old. She has been developing her business for the past ten years. Zoila works from 7am to 4pm. As of this date, she has not experienced any problems with her business.

Zoila wants to invest in merchandise such as lotions, cosmetics, and clothing. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to cover the purchase and help strengthen her business. This will enable her to generate more income that she will use to pay the family expenses.

Maintaining her business is her primary objective since her family depends on it.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, lotions, and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Elmer Alirio

texts.es:
Elmer, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de llaves y alarmas para  vehículo y venta de CDs. Vive con su esposa y su hija de un año de edad.
Él tiene 3 años de dedicarse al negocio, y actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como alarmas y CD variados, esta inversión contribuirá para el desarrollo con su negocio y ampliarse más para los clientes.
Su aspiración es ser un gran comerciante, poseer lo mejor en artículos para vehículo y así mismo velar por las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer resides in San Francisco Gotera in the Department of Morazán. He sells keys, vehicle alarms, and CDs. Elmer lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter. He has worked in his business for three years and currently needs a loan to buy merchandise such as alarms and various CDs. This investment will contribute to the development of his business and expand it for his customers.

His aspiration is to be a successful merchant by providing the best vehicle merchandise so that he can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle alarms and various music discs.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es:
María, reside en San Miguel, tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas, ella está viviendo con su esposo y un hijo de 11 años de edad, su trabajo es elaborar tortillas, tiene una persona que le ayuda a prepararlas, trabaja de 10:00am a 2:00pm, también vende pupusas estas las prepara de 5:00pm a 8:00pm.
Por el momento necesita comprar maíz en cantidad abundante, pues debido al alto costo que tiene en el mercado, ella quiere comprar y almacenarlo en su vivienda, por esta situación solicita un préstamo que cubra este gasto y que le ayude a tener en su casa una buena cantidad de maíz.
Su aspiración es administrar dos negocios de pupusas, dar trabajo a más mujeres, que como ella, se esfuerzan cada día por llevar el sustento diario a sus hogares.
texts.en:
Maria resides in San Miguel, is 35 years old, and sells 'pupusas' (a popular Salvadoran snack) and tortillas. She lives with her husband and a son, aged 11. Her work is to make tortillas. She has a person who helps her to prepare them. Maria labors from  10:00 am until 2:00 pm making tortillas, then from 5:00 until 8:00 pm, she sells 'pupusas'.

At present, she needs to buy corn in an abundant quantity. Due to the current high market price, she wants to buy corn and store it in her home. Due to the current situation, Maria is requesting a loan to cover the cost of purchasing a good quantity of corn for storage.

Her ambition is to administer 2 businesses selling 'pupusas', providing work for 2 women, who like her, struggle every day to provide daily sustenance in their homes.

loans.use: to buy corn for making tortillas and 'pupusas'.

loans.name: Glenda Yamileth

texts.es:
Glenda, tiene 24 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, vive con sus dos hijos D. 3 y 5 años D. edad, está casada y se dedica a la venta D. ropa, específicamente en la zona D. las playas, todos los días se dispone a  vender D. 7:00am a 4:00pm.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. ropa para la temporada D. verano, esta compra le ayudara a ofrecer a los clientes que visitan las playas, la ropa adecuada para bañar, con la que espera tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
El sueño D. ella es obtener un día su propia casa, D. su trabajo continuo espera ahorrar lo necesario y realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
Glenda, age 24, lives in the town of San Miguel; she is married and has two children aged three and five. Glenda makes her living selling clothing, especially in beach areas. She works everyday from 7am to 4pm.

Glenda is currently seeking a loan to purchase an inventory of clothing for the summer season which would allow her to offer her clients items necessary to go swimming and hopefully will help her to increase the income she earns for her family. Glenda's dream is to one day own her own house; she hopes that her continued efforts will enable her to save up the necessary funds to realize this dream.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia, reside en  El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive con su hija de 3 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio surgió hace 10 años, lo atiende todos los días de la semana preparando diferentes platillos para los clientes.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes y condimentos, estos ingredientes le ayudaran a mantener una buena disponibilidad para preparar los menús diarios.
Su aspiración es trabajar por su hija, darle lo necesario e ir mejorando las instalaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in the El Transito section of San Miguel.  She lives with her 3-year old daughter and dedicates herself to selling food.  She started her business 10 years ago, and tends to it every day of the week making different dishes for her customers.

Currently, she needs a loan to buy vegetables, meats and condiments.  These ingredients will help her maintain her ability to prepare her daily menus.  Her desire is to work for her daughter, providing what she needs and making improvements to their home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats and condiments.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, él vive con su esposa y su hija pequeña de 4 años de edad, él se dedica a los cultivos de hortalizas desde hace 20 años, aprendió el proceso de las hortalizas por al proyecto ejecutado por CRV-MAG, en el cual daban asistencia técnica a los agricultores sobre dicha producción.
El cultivara tomates en dos manzanas de terreno y para eso solicita un préstamo, para adquirir semillas, fertilizantes y abonos, estos insumos le ayudaran a mantener un buen cuido de la siembra y estar al pendiente de cualquier riesgo de plagas.
Su objetivo es trabajar siempre en las hortalizas ya que es un trabajo que le agrada realizar y que su buena cosecha depende del cuido y dedicación que se le brinde, espera que también su familia pueda progresar económicamente a través de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Cristino lives in the Corinto section of Morazán.  He dedicates himself to planting crops, and lives with his wife and small 4-year old daughter.  He has been in farming for 20 years, having learned the process through a project managed by CRV-MAG that gave technical agricultural assistance to farmers.  

He will grow tomatoes on two blocks of land, which is why he is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  These supplies will help him provide good care for the crops and watch for any risk of plague.  His goal is to always work in farming as is this a job he enjoys doing, and because yielding good production from the crops requires care and dedication.  He hopes also that his family will be able to progress financially through his work.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, resiD. en San Carlos departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. forma ambulante, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos Walter D. 18 años y Glenda D. 16 años D. edad, Ana venD. en San Francisco Gotera y otros municipios cercanos, también asiste a las redes solidarias.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. ropa, blusas, manteles, ropa interior y otros, estas prendas le ayudaran a tener más mercadería para ofrecer  a los clientes y satisfacer sus gustos.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio estable, fijo, que sus hijos tengan lo necesario y puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the San Carlos department of Morazán.  She travels around selling clothing.  She lives with her husband and her two children, Walter, 18 years old, and Glenda, 16 years old.  Ana sells in San Francisco Gotera and other nearby cities.  She also attends the Red Solidaria (Red Solidaria is an anti-poverty program in El Salvador).  She is asking for a loan for the purchase of clothing, blouses, tablecloths, underwear, and other items.  These items will help her to have more merchandise to offer her customers and satisfy their wants.

Her goal is to have a stable, fixed business, so that her children will have what they need and can study.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, blouses, tablecloths, underwear, and other items.

loans.name: Baax Yaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité BAAX YAYE est créé le 27 août 2009. Il est composer de 08 femmes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce en général/ Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3.

Fatou M. (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo avec de cheveux en friche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant.

Elle fait un petit commerce de vêtements. Et parallèlement elle fais de la coiffure. Elle pratique cette activité depuis environ 05 ans.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en marchandise ci-dessus énumérée et d'acheter aussi des produits pour la coiffure. 

Objectif est de soutenir sa maman dans la prise en charge de la famille tout en subsistant à ses besoins personnels
texts.en: The solidarity group Baax Yaye was created on August 27, 2009.  It is made up of 8 women from the same neighborhood.  Their primary business is, in general, small shops.  The group is a member of the Montagne Nord 3 Banc Villageois.  Fatou M. (standing at the far right of the photo with the wild hair) is the leader of the group.  She is 28 years old.  She is single with no children.  She runs a small clothing shop.  At the same time, she styles hair.  She has run this business for 5 years.  Her new loan will allow her to stock up on the merchandise enumerated above and to also buy hairstyling products.  Her objective is support her mother in taking care of the family, while still supporting her personal needs.

loans.use: to purchase clothes intended for sale

loans.name: Yolenny Nebel

texts.es:
Yolenny de 46 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó su actividad hace 12 años atrás, decidió entrar en la venta de comida y esto lo realiza en si domicilio. Está casada y tienen 5 hijos adultos. 

Ella trabaja sola desde las 6H00 am hasta las 14H00 pm. Realizar desayunos y almuerzos. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Con el préstamo desea invertir en pescados arroz mesas y sillas. En un futuro desea construir segundo piso en  su casa y poner más bonito su negocio.
texts.en:
Yolenny, age 46, is married and has five grown children. She is a hardworking woman that started her food preparation business twelve years ago; she runs the business from her home. 

Yolenny works alone from 6am until 2pm preparing breakfast and lunch. Her husband is a construction worker. She plans to use this loan to purchase fish, rice, tables, and chairs. In the future, she hopes to add a second floor to her house and to better outfit her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Bëgg Diam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BËGG DIAM est composé de 12 femmes toutes issues du même quartier. Cette cohabitation favorise la bonne entente et la cohésion entre les membres. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3

Madame AWA G. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo, de blanc vêtue) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi le charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle fait de l'embouche caprine. Elle va dans les marchés acheter des chèvres qu'elle embouche pendant au moins 05 mois avant de las revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires ou dans la ville. Et comme activité parallèle elle fait la cuisson et vente de beignets dans son quartier

Son crédit lui permettra d'acheter au moins trois chèvres

Son objectif est de soutenir mes enfants dans leurs études tout en augmentant mon niveau d'épargne
texts.en: The solidarity group BËGG DIAM is made up of 12 women all from the same neighborhood.  This cohabitation favors the good relationship and cohesion between the members.  The group is a member of the Montage Nord3 Banc Villageois.  Mrs. Awa G. (standing completely to the right of the photo, in white clothing) is the leader of the group.  She is 47 years old.  She is married and the mother of 5 children.  She also cares for two children who were entrusted to her by loved ones.  She raises goats.  She goes to the markets to buy the goats which she raises for five months before reslling them in the weekly markets or in town.  At the same time, she runs a business cooking and selling doughnuts in her neighborhood.  Her loan will allow her to buy at least three goats.  Her objective is to support her children in their studies, while augmenting her savings level.

loans.use: To purchase goats to raise

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel  se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años, vende ropa, zapatos. Con el fin de apoyar a su familia y lograr la construcción de su casa, el cual la está haciendo toda de concreto, lo que es de gran satisfacción poder lograr el objetivo.
Esta construcción la ha logrado gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado durante cinco ciclos, y que ha venido poco a poco construyendo, teniendo la mano de obra sin costo, ya que su esposo  es de profesión maestro de obra.
Con esta nueva solicitud, comprara materiales de construcción, para seguir levantando paredes para lograr la terminación de su vivienda. Un techo digno y un techo mas seguro.
texts.en:
For several years, Isabel has been working in retail commerce -- she sells clothing and footwear in order to support her family and to finish building her house. It is very satisfying to Isabel to be able to achieve this goal and she's been able to advance this construction thanks to the financing from Afodenic that she has received over five loan cycles.

Little by little Isabel and her husband have been building the house; she does not need to pay for the labor since her husband is a construction foreman by profession. Isabel will use the new loan to purchase construction materials so that she could continue building the walls and finish her new house that would give her family a safe and decent home.

loans.use: to purchase the construction materials necessary to finish building her house

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz forma parte del banco comunal “Creciendo con Fe” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. 
Ella tiene un puesto donde vende confites, bebidas y helados. Este es un carro kiosco, que puede trasladar a diferentes lugares con su mercadería. Luz se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 10 años. 
Su mercadería la compra en confiterías y distribuidoras, donde los precios sean más convenientes para invertir.
