Justina; ella tiene 78 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio  de venta de leña, piedras, ella tiene un cantera que es un lugar donde venden piedras, también la socia se dedica a vender chicha, gallinas y cuyes, el negocio de venta de animales lo realiza en forma ambulatoria y por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar en sus diferentes negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to Las Triunfadoras communal bank which is located in the Andahuaylillas district of  Quispicanchis province in Cusco department.

She is Justina, 78, widowed, and she has 5 children.  Justina mixes her daily activities with her business of selling firewood and stones. She has a quarry where she sells the stones.   Justina also sells chicha (Peruvian alcoholic drink), chickens, and guinea pigs.   The animal sales are done as a street vendor and with these small businesses, she helps her children get ahead.  She would like to improve her various businesses and she is requesting a loan to buy animal feed.

This member is happy for the financing and promises to make the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liliana de 28 años, es una mujer  trabajadora que desde pequeña le gustaba jugar a ser estilista. Y se decido a estudiar para ser maestra de belleza. Es soltera u tiene un hijo que está en escuela

En la actualidad trabaja en el día en un salón de belleza y por la noche abre su propio negocio de peluquería. Con el préstamo quieres comprar materiales para su salón de belleza  para así trabajar en cuenta propia y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Liliana is a hard-working 28-year-old who, as a child, enjoyed pretending she was a hair stylist.  So she decided to get training to be a beauty professional.  She is single and has a school-aged son.

During the day she works in a beauty salon and at night runs her own hair salon.  She plans to use the loan to buy beauty shop supplies so she establish her own business and provide the best she can for her son.

loans.use: To buy furniture, haircolour and supplies for her business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella tiene una tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo vende en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en forma independiente, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos, cuyes y gallinas y lo vende en el mercado de Andahuaylillas, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar sus negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento para los animales.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "LAS TRIUNFADORAS", which is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, in the province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.

Mrs. Luisa is 40 years old and lives with her partner and seven children.  She alternates her daily activity with her business of selling corn.  She owns cropland where she grows the corn that she later sells on an independent basis in the district of Andahuaylillas.  She also raises animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and hens which she sells in the Andahuaylillas market.  

She wants to improve and expand her business and plans to use the loan to buy animal feed.

She is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es:
Laura es una pequeña comerciante, que inicio hace varios años con la venta de cosmético y bisutería, logrando aumentar sus productos en ventas con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado con plazos a costos bajo de interés.
Su esposo también vende cosmético aunque siendo discapacitados apoya a su  familia. Su vivienda es de condición muy sencilla, que espera a futuro poder mejorar.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara productos Avon, para seguir en aumento de sus venta ya que tiene que cubrir todos sus gastos y compromiso de pago, comprara: perfume, estuche de pinturas, crema de cutis, crema de cuerpo, pinturas de uña, vanidad, productos para niñas en cosméticos.
texts.en:
Laura is a small businesswoman who began selling cosmetics and costume jewelry several years ago.  With loans through Afodenic, which were low interest, she was able to increase her line of products.

Her husband also works selling cosmetics to help support the family, although he is handicapped.  Their home is very modest and they hope to improve it in the future.

With this new loan Laura will buy Avon products so she can increase sales to cover expenses and pay back the loan.  She plans to buy perfume, make-up, face and body cream, nail polish and children's products.

loans.use: To buy Avon cosmetic products such as perfume, make-up, face and body creams and children's products

loans.name: Awa Yeko Yor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AWA YEKO YOR est créé le 27 août 2009. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens d'amitié et de voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

Madame MAREME F. debout (à droite de la photo, de jaune vêtue) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. 

Elle fait devant sa maison un petit commerce de beignets et de cacahouètes. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des arachides qu'elle transformera en cacahouètes. Elle achètera aussi de la farine et des ingrédients pour la préparation des beignets

Son objectif est de renforcer son son activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et augmenter son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The AWA YEKO YOR cooperative group was created on August 27, 2009.  It is made up of 11 women from the same neighborhood who came together as friends and neighbors.  Their primary activity is small-scale business.

Mrs. MAREME F. (standing in yellow at right in the photo) is the group leader.  She is 42 years old and married with eight children.  She runs a small business selling fried pastries and peanuts in front of her house.  With her loan she will buy peanuts to process for sale.  She will also buy flour and other ingredients for the preparation of beignets.  Her goal is to strengthen her business in order to make a larger profit and increase her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and ingredients to make beignets

loans.name: Margarita Amparo

texts.es:
Margarita  tiene  40 años de edad, es casada  y reside junto a su familia en el sector 9 de Octubre, una zona urbana marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Se dedica desde hace 10 años  a la venta de artículos de cuero y badana como correas de cuero, billeteras, accesorios para el cabello y otros similares en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su en el mercado Modelo de la Cuidad de Chiclayo. El negocio tiene mucha acogida en la zona ya que ella es una de las pocas personas que ofrecen estos productos a precios accesibles y de buena calidad. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos universitarios de su hijo y ayudar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de los gastos económicos de su familia.

Margarita desea adquirir más productos de cuero, con diseños nuevos y juveniles que le permita tener más clientes y poder ampliar su negocio. Por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Margarita is 40 years old, married and lives with her family in the "9 de Octubre" sector, in a marginal urban area of the city of Chiclayo, a commercial area in northern Peru.

For ten years she has been selling leather articles such as belts, billfolds, men's accessories and other items in a small establishment in the Modelo Market in the city of Chiclayo.  The business is very popular in the area since she is one of the few people who offer this type of product at reasonable prices for good quality.  She uses the income from her work to pay for her son's college expenses and help her husband with the household expenses.

Margarita wants to buy more leather products with new and youthful designs so she can attract even more customers and expand her business.  This is her first loan request through Edpyme Alternative and she has requested 1,000 PEN, which she plans to use to help meet her goal.

loans.use: To buy products to expand her business

loans.name: Cristo Del Consuelo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cristo del Consuelo está formado por 8 mujeres muy alegres, carismáticas y sobre todo emprendedoras que luchan a diario en sus diferentes trabajos para mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, cuenta con una variada  gastronomía, tiene varios lugares turísticos para visitar y su gente es muy amable y carismática.

La Señora Zoila Fernández vive por el sector de Cristo Rey en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 42 años, es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 20, 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segunda hija es casada e independiente, su tercera hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo trabaja  solo para sus gastos personales. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Zoila se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palito), esta labor la realiza hace 17 años de domingo a domingo desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche.

Este es el onceavo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de producto para la elaboración de chuzos como: carne, pimientos, cebolla, papas, salchichas, etc.

Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Cristo del Consuelo, is comprised of eight cheerful, charismatic women who are entrepreneurs and struggle daily in their respective businesses to improve their household economies.  They live in the city of Cuenca which is the third most important one in the country.  It has a varied gastronomy, many tourist sites and kind, charismatic people.

Mrs. Zoila Fernández lives in the Cristo Rey area of the city of Cuenca.  She is 42 years old, divorced and has four children, ages 22, 20, 18 and 16.  Her eldest daughter works and helps cover household expenses.  Her second daughter is married and independent.  Her third daughter is in school in the city and her youngest son works to cover his own expenses.  They live in rental property.

For seventeen years, Doña Zoila has been selling  "chuzos" (meat on a stick), from Sunday to Sunday, from 4:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.

This is her 11th loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy ingredients for the chuzos: meat, peppers, onions, potatoes, sausages, etc.

Her dream is to have her own home one day.

loans.use: To buy meat, peppers, onions, potatoes, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz de 57 años, es una mujer trabajadora que un día con la ayuda de su esposo puso su negocio de papelería en su domicilio ya que por su sector no había y así reunió dinero y compro materiales escolares  para complementar en su papelería.

Ella atiende su negocio desde las 7H00 am a 8H00 pm vendiendo útiles escolares y de oficina a estudiante y a clientes de su sector en compañía de su esposo. Un de su dificultades en el trabajo fue que un día por quedarse hasta tarde le quisieron robar por tal motivo el bazar esta abierto hasta las 8h00pm. con el préstamo desea comprar útiles escolares, papelería en general para así mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro ella quiere expandir su negocio de papelería y ayudar a su esposo con la tercena que tiene para construí de arriba de su casa hacerla de 2 piso.
texts.en:
Cruz, 57 years old, is a hardworking woman. One day, with the help of her husband, she opened a stationary store in her home since there wasn't one in her area. She got some money together and bought some school supplies to supplement the stationary. 

She works from 7:00am until 8:00pm selling school and office supplies to students and customers from her area, with help from her husband. One of the most difficult parts of the job was that one day when she was open late, she was robbed; for that reason, the store is open until 8pm. With the loan she wants to buy school supplies and general paper products to improve her income. In the future she wants to expand her paper goods business and help her husband with his butcher shop, so that they can build a second story onto their home.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and stationary

loans.name: Los Comerciantes De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS COMERCIANTES DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Higidia; ella es separada y tiene 44 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de comida y también se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y chanchos, el negocio de venta de comida lo realiza en el mercado de Andahuaylillas,ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios de venta de comida y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar y alimentos para los animales.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de leche, tienda de abarrotes, venta de chicha, técnico electricista, mecánico y venta de pasto.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the village bank "Los Comerciantes de Andahuaylillas". This bank is located in the district of Andahuaylillas, which is in the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco.

One member, Mrs. Higidia, is 44 years old, separated and has 5 children. She sells food and also raises animals like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs. She sells food in the market of Andahuaylillas, working from 7:00am until 2:00pm. With these small businesses, she helps her children to get ahead. She wants to increase and improve her food sales and animal husbandry businesses. She asks for the loan to buy cooking products and animal feed. 

The other members sell milk, run grocery stores, sell chicha [a local beverage], work as electricians and mechanics and sell pasture.

She thanks those who are part of her dream by this means, and promises to comply with the payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy cooking products and animal feed

loans.name: Ana Regina

texts.es:
Ana Regina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Victor echave”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos (2 independientes). Cuenta con estudios de educación secundaria.
La señora se dedica a la venta de artículos artesanales  y a la venta de comidas, trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de artesanías.
Ana solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/1300.00 nuevo soles, con éste dinero comprará 4 kilos de lana para la fabricación de chompas y chalecos.
Trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es abrir una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda ofrecer muchos productos de primera necesidad.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad
texts.en: Ana Regina is a member of the "Victor Echave" Communal Bank, located in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 56 years old and married by common-law with four children, two of whom are living on their own. She has a high school education. She works selling handicrafts as well as food. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year. Her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in her handicrafts business. Ana is applying for a new loan for 1,300 nuevo soles with which she plans to buy four kilos of yarn in order to make sweaters and vests. She is the only one who works for her business. Her husband works in mining. Her dream is to open a grocery store where she can sell basic necessities. What Ana likes about the communal bank are the meetings, the punctuality, and the responsibility involved.

loans.use: to by 4 kilos of yarn for making sweaters and vests.

loans.name: Favian

texts.es: Favian de 41 Años de edad, está casado con Marcelina de 35 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 04 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicados en la comunidad de Villa el Salvador Anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. La labor que realiza Favian es labrar la tierra, donde viene cultivando plantas de  café y plátano, en total cuenta con 03 hectáreas de terreno. Aprendió el trabajo del campo en las tierras de sus padres quienes le enseñaron a remover la tierra y creció con los anhelos de poseer su propia parcela. Ahora con sus ahorros acumulados pudo concretar sus ansias de contar con su propio terreno, es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 22 años y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo, porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano disfruta de la calidad de los frutos de su sembrío las cuales son muy cotizadas en los puntos de venta. Menciona además que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas, por lo cual Favian solicita el crédito para la  compra de insecticidas para combatir las plagas que asechan sus cultivos; en lo futuro comprara más tierras para aumentar su producción. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insecticidas para fumigar la plaga que asechan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Favian, 41 years old, is married to Marcelina, 35, and together they have 4 children. They live together in their own home located in the community of Villa el Salvador Anexo in the district of Kimbiri. 

Favian works the land where they grow coffee and plantains on a total of 3 hectares. He learned how to work in the field on his parents' land, who taught him how to remove the dirt. His desire to own his own parcel of land grew. Now with his accumulated savings he was able to fulfill this desire for his own land. He is familiar with hard work in the fields. He has been doing it for 22 years, and during harvest time he has help from his children and seasonal workers. He feels very committed to his work, since thanks to his daily efforts he is able to enjoy quality fruits from his plantings which are sought-after in the food stalls. 

He also mentions that the hardest part is guarding his crops from insects, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy insecticides to combat the plagues that stalk his crops. In the future he will buy more land to increase his production. This is his second loan with MFP. He has been very punctual with his payments and expects to continue to be so. With the 1000 nuevos soles that he has requested, he will buy insecticides to fumigate the insects that threaten his crops.

loans.use: to buy insecticides

loans.name: Priscila Iluminada

texts.es:
Priscila de 53 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que empezó su actividad cocinando en un restaurant. Poco a poco reunió un capital y abrió su propio local de comida.

En la actualidad trabaja diariamente con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos. Le dificulta en su trabajo la competencia y la delincuencia. Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, aceite, legumbre para su negocio de comida para así tener un mayor rendimiento en su comedor. En un futuro quiere abrir otro local de comida y comprarse su vehículo.
texts.en:
Priscila is 53 years old. She is a hard-working woman who began her work cooking in a restaurant. Gradually, she got together money and opened her own restaurant.

Currently, she works daily with the help of her husband and children. The difficulty in her work is competition and crime. With this loan, she is going to buy rice, oil, vegetables for her restaurant business in order to have greater yield with her diner. In the future, she wishes to open another location and buy herself a car.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and vegetables.

loans.name: Asunta Sofia

texts.es:
Asunta es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes).  Asunta tiene educación secundaria.
Viene  trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta al por menor de productos lácteos-leche.
La señora solicitará  un  nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar quesos y leche para luego venderlos a sus clientes, también cuenta que trabaja en la agricultura.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener más ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the "Las Retamas" community bank, located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has six children (two of whom are adults). Asunta has a high school education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her first loan was for 300 new "soles", money that she used in her business selling dairy and milk products at retail.

She will request a new loan in the sum of 400 new "soles" which will be used to buy cheeses and milk to then sell to her customers that work in farming. Her dream is to improve her business and obtain more income. What she likes about her community bank are the training and lectures.

loans.use: to purchase cheeses and milk.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose “Joe” G. and his wife, Sylvia, own a sports bar called “Joe’s Hide Out.”  They offer cold beer and snacks, as well as a friendly atmosphere where anybody can get to know everybody.  Open Tuesday through Sunday from 11 in the morning to 12 at night, it is closed Monday so that Jose and Sylvia can spend time with Jose’s elderly mother.   As Sylvia says, “Our customers are our friends and family.”  Their loyal clientele includes locals as well as “Winter Texans” who come from as far away as Canada to spend winters in the small town of Donna in the Rio Grande Valley.

In 2003, Joe acquired the bar from an elderly man wanting to retire.  In order to work the bar, Joe took a temporary leave of absence from H-E-B, a Texas grocery store where he had worked for eighteen years.  At the end of three months, Joe realized that he loved owning the bar and resigned from H-E-B.
Joe and Sylvia live in a house across the street from the bar.  They work hard to make “Joe’s Hide Out” a fun place to be. 

Every day, Joe and his wife serve free "botana" (snacks) like squash and chicken, beef and potatoes, and hot dogs.  Recognizing their generosity, customers sometimes pitch in to help cover the cost.  Even when that doesn’t happen, Joe and Sylvia believe it is worth it, because it is fun and attracts business.

Another tradition at “Joe’s Hide Out” is the rule is that whoever rings the bell must buy a round for everyone in the bar.  Sometimes Joe rings the bell, which gets the customers excited and typically leads to their buying rounds for each other.  On the weekends, Jose, Sylvia, and their friends and customers barbecue on their outside grill.  They have musicians come and play music while customers eat, drink, and dance on the patio.

This is Joe and Sylvia’s second loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  With their first loan, they expanded the bar, added pool tables, and bought a television.  With this loan, they will fix the bar’s air conditioner and repair their parking lot.

loans.use: to fix the air conditioning and pave the parking lot.

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cosme; ella es conviviente y tiene 41 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artefactos y ropa, ella tiene una tienda donde vende artefactos y ropa de segunda mano, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y artefactos de segunda mano. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y artefactos.

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes y venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Moyopata-San Sebastian community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Cosme. She lives with her partner, is 41 years old and has five children. She works at her business selling artifacts and clothing. She has a store where she sells second-hand artifacts and clothing. She works from 9AM until 6PM and through this business, she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand her business selling second-hand clothing and artifacts. She is requesting the loan to buy clothing and artifacts.

The other members are dedicated to selling food, vegetables, a grocery store and selling clothing.

The member is thankful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and promises to make the repayments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy clothes and artifacts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián, natural de la ciudad de Huanta, tiene 47 Años de edad, está casado con Emiliana de 45 años y fruto de esa relación tienen hoy 05 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa situado en la comunidad de Sampantuari Alta Anexo del distrito de Kimbiri. Julián es el sustento de toda su familia y se esmera cada día por dar el mejor bienestar a sus seres queridos, Julián desde  muy niño labraba la tierra de sus padres y creció con esos dotes. Cuando conoció a su esposa decidió comprar sus propias tierras y desde ese entonces sus sembríos son plantas de cacao, frutas cítricas, piñas y hojas de coca donde viene trabajando 25 años de manera independiente. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y  jornaleros quienes se encargan de cosechar y trasladar los frutos  hasta sus caseríos  para luego mercantilizar a los compradores. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta que la  estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque son meses donde abundan mayor precipitaciones de lluvias intermitentes propias de la naturaleza dañando sus cultivos y perdiendo en mayor cantidad los frutos de sus cultivos. Julián solicita el crédito para comprar sus  herramientas de trabajo como machetes, tijeras de poda  y entre otros,  Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras y diseminar más plantas de café. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad; agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará herramientas para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Julián, native of the city of Huanta, is 47 years old and is married to Emiliana, who is 45, and, fruit of this relationship, they have today five children and together they live in their own house located in the community of Sampantuari Alta Anexo in the district of Kimbiri. Julián is the support of the whole family and he works everyday to improve the wellbeing of his dear family. Julián, since he was young, worked the land of his parents and grew up with those skills.

When he met his wife, he decided to buy his own land and since then his crops have been cocoa plants, citrus fruits, pineapple and coca leaves. He's been working for 25 years independently.  At harvest time, he counts on the support of his children and laborers who are in charge of harvesting and transporting the fruit to their villages to then sell to the buyers. He feels very committed to his work. Thanks to his daily efforts, today, he enjoys seeing these crops and good earnings. He says that winter is not welcome because they are months where large rainfall is abundant damaging his crops and losing a great quantity of fruit crops. Julián is requesting the loan to buy tools like machetes, pruning scissors, among others. But now, what takes priority is buying new land and planting more coffee plants. This is his first loan with MFP. He knows that if he pays on time, he will be able to access another loan with greater ease. He is thankful to the institution to grant this loan. With the 3,000 new "soles" requested, he will buy tools for his work.

loans.use: to buy tools for his farming job.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la comunidad de Santa Catalina en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes y una amplia gastronomía, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas amables y de un corazón muy calido.

Doña Rosa tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 16 y 10 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en un colegio de la ciudad y la segunda en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo volquetas, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad y es el fruto del esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
 
La Señora. Rosa tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 3 años, labora de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.  Trabaja también en sus viveros en donde siembra una gran variedad de plantas para la venta y cría animales como pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su propio sector.

Es  el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de  arroz, azúcar, detergentes, aceites, embutidos y más productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
 
Su meta es crecer mucho más en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa C. is a member of the communal bank Siempre Amigas.  She lives in the Santa Catalina community in the parish of Valle.  This parish has beautiful landscapes and a wide variety of cuisines.  The people are here work in business, agriculture and the raising of animals.  The people are friendly and warm-hearted.  

Doña Rosa is 38 years old, married and has 2 daughters, ages 16 and 10.  Both girls attend school in the city.  Her husband makes a living as a dump truck driver.  They own their own house which is the fruit of their marital working efforts. 
 
Señora Rosa has had a grocery store for 3 years.  She works 7 days a week from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.  She also works in her nursery where she grows a wide variety of plants that she sells as well as raising animals like chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her area.  

This is her third loan with the communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of rice, sugar, detergents, oils, meats and other basic necessity products with which to stock her store.  
 
Her goal is to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, oils, meats and other basic necessity products.

loans.name: Ruperto Lirio

texts.es:
Ruperto de 59 años, es un hombre trabajador  que inicio su negocio con poca mercadería el escogió es actividad por que le gustaba estar en la tienda.

En la actualidad trabaja todos los días de 7H00am a 10H00pm. Está casado y ella es  ama de casa tienen tres hijos ya mayores de edad uno de ellos le ayuda en la tienda. Con el préstamo va a comprar arroz, confites, bebidas gaseosas. Lo que anhela es seguir en el negocio para tener prosperidad para su familia
texts.en:
Ruperto is 59 years old. He is a hardworking man who started his business with a little merchandise. He chose this business because he liked being in the store.   

At present, he works every day from 7:00 am to 10:00 p.m. He is married and she is a housewife. They have three grown children and one of them helps at the store. With the loan, he is going to buy rice, candies and soft drinks. What he longs for is for his business to prosper for his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, candies, and soft drinks.

loans.name: J. Refugio

texts.en:
J. Refugio G. is an independent truck driver who started RGE Transport in January, 2011.  Having been in the trucking industry for many years, Refugio finally decided to go into business for himself.  He contracts with a transportation company that specializes in moving fruits and vegetables.  Originally from Guanajuato, Refugio moved to Edinburg in 1993.

Refugio used this loan to help buy his truck.  He was referred to ACCION Texas-Louisiana by the truck dealer who sold him his trailer.  Without this loan, Refugio doesn’t know when he would have been able to buy his truck and launch his business. 

Within a few years, Refugio would like to buy more trailers to expand his business.  “Echanle ganas!”  His advice to fellow entrepreneurs is, “Go for it, and open your business!  With dedication, everything is possible.”

loans.use: to buy a truck for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es: Rayda, de 25 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su  pareja Raúl de 37 años y sus 02 queridos hijos,  lo que más desea es brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, para lo cual está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Con mucho esfuerzo Rayda ha logrado abrir  su tienda  de bebidas como: gaseosas, cervezas, y helados, por lo cual se esmera por brindar una buena comodidad a sus clientes, es así que los fines de semana es muy concurrido su local por los pobladores de su zona quienes después de realizar sus deportes favoritos se ponen a degustar las bebidas heladas. Lleva 02 años en este negocio y le va muy bien. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio y comprar más congeladoras y así mantener sus bebidas refrigeradas. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente si desea acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará una maquina fotocopiadora y prestar servicio de fotocopias a los alumnos de diferentes centros educativos ya que tiene espacio suficiente para montar este negocio.
texts.en:
Rayda, age 25, is a very friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her life partner, 37 year old Raúl, and their two beloved children.  What she wants most of all is to give her children a good education.  In order to do this she is prepared to work very hard.

With great effort Rayda has managed to open a store with drinks like soft drinks, beer, and frozen drinks.  She does her best to make her customers very comfortable.  That is why her place is very busy on the week-ends.   The villagers in the area come to enjoy frozen drinks after they play their favorite sport.  She has had this business for two years, and it is going very well for her.

In the future she wishes to expand her business.  She wants to buy more freezers in order to keep the drinks refrigerated.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She knows that she has to make her payments on time if she wishes to get another loan later on.  She is grateful to the institution for granting the loan.  She will use the requested loan to buy a photocopy machine.  She will provide photocopy services to the students in different educational centers because she has enough space to start up this business.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad.  Está casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Carmen cuenta con educación secundaria completa.  Su esposo es empleado público.
Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de todo tipo por catálogo,  hace seis años trabaja  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio.
En la actualidad solicitará  un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar productos de belleza marca Esika y Avon, comprará perfumes, desodorantes, aretes, etc.  
Su sueño es poder vivir bien, crecer como empresaria y tener éxitos en la familia.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la confraternidad entre las socias.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) Communal Bank.  It is located in the Puno district, in the Puno province and district.  She is 56 years old, married, and has two children.  Carmen has a high school education.  Her husband is a public employee.

She sells all types of beauty products by catalog.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it in her business.

She will currently request a loan for 1,000 soles to buy Esika and Avon brands of beauty products.  She will buy perfume, deodorant, and earrings, etc.

Her dream is to be able to live well, to grow as a businesswoman, and for her family to be successful.  What she likes about her communal bank is the camaraderie among the members.

loans.use: to  buy perfume, deodorant, and earrings, etc.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Yucay,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; es soltera, la socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos 2 independientes, tiene otros 2 de (16, 10), la socia se dedica principalmente a la artesanía, la socia elabora todo tipo de artesanía en la puerta del hotel sonesta posada en Yucay, la socia vende guantes, coreas de lana con aplicaciones, chalinas, mantillas, mantas, gorros y todo hecho en lana de oveja, alpaca y lana sintética, la socia e esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales para la confección de los diferentes tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas y otros para elaborar sus trabajos.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Virgen Natividad Community Bank.  This bank is located in the Yucay village in the Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Lorenza is 44 years old, single, and has four children.  Two of her children are independent, and the other two are 16 and 10 years old.

She devotes herself primarily to making handicrafts.  She makes all types of handicrafts in the doorway of the Sonesta Posada Hotel in Yucay.  She sells gloves, wool belts with appliques, scarves, lace scarves, blankets, and hats.  Everything is made from wool from sheep and alpacas and synthetic wool.

She is now requesting a loan to be able to buy materials for making her different knitted products.  She is requesting the loan to buy wool and other things to make her pieces of work.

She is very grateful for the loan, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to buy wool and other supplies to make her products

loans.name: Justo Martin

texts.es:
Justo  de 41 años, es un hombre  emprendedor que decidió escoger esa actividad de vender fruta como lo hacía su padre. Tiene 20 años de experiencia recorriendo la ciudad vendiendo frutas.

Labora de lunes a sábados de 6H00 am a 6H00 pm. su esposa trabaja vendiendo bisutería en un local de la bahía. Con el préstamo desea comprar más mercadería para su negocio como naranjas sandia zapote, etc. e incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro  comprarse una camioneta para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Justo, age 41, is an enterprising man who decided to go into the business of selling fruit, as his father did. He has 20 years of experience as a mobile vendor selling fruit in the town. 

He works from Monday through Saturday, 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. His wife works selling costume jewelry in a shop at the waterfront market. With the loan, he would like to buy more merchandise for his business, such as oranges, watermelons, sapotes, etc., so he can increase his earnings. in the future, he wants to buy a small truck so that he can have a better life with his family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, watermelons and sapotes to sell.

loans.name: Christian Eduardo

texts.es:
Christian de 31 años, es un hombre trabajador  gracias a la ayuda de su mama pudo comprarse un vehículo con el cual trabaja como taxista, escogió esta actividad debido a que no encontraba trabajo.

En la actualidad trabaja solo desde las 6H00am hasta las 21H00pm. le afecta mucho la delincuencia  ya que la ciudad se ha vuelto peligrosa. Con el préstamo va a darle mantenimiento al vehículo para así no tener problemas con el tiempo y así seguir incrementando sus ganancias. Ya que en un futuro quiere obtener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Christian, age 31, is a hard-working man. Thanks to help from his mother, he was able to buy a vehicle which he uses to work as a taxi driver. He chose this business because he did not find a job. 

Currently, he works alone from 6:00 a.m. until 9 p.m. He is strongly affected by crime, because the city has become dangerous. With the loan, he will carry out maintenance on his vehicle, so that he will not have problems over time. This will help him continue to increase his earnings, since in the future he wants to obtain a house of his own.

loans.use: to pay for tires and maintenance.

loans.name: Clemencia Beneranda

texts.es:
La Señora. Clemencia P. es socia del banco comunal Siempre Amigas, vive por la comunidad de La Gloria en la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia tiene hermosos paisajes y una amplia gastronomía, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, son personas amables y de un corazón muy calido.

La Señora. Clemencia tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17, 15 y 12 años de edad y todos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en su taller de carpintería, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Clemencia tiene una sastrería en su casa, no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja de domingo a domingo. Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia y ahora realiza todo tipo de costuras.

Está en el banco comunal hace 2 años y tiene una gran amistada con todas las socias, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir una parte para la compra de tela y también para la realización de la tesis de grado de su hijo.

Su meta es tener un taller mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Clemencia P. is a member of the "Siempre Amigas" ["Forever Friends"] communal bank. She lives in the community of La Gloria, in Del Valle parish. This parish has beautiful scenery and a varied cuisine. Its people are dedicated to trade, raising animals, and agriculture. They are friendly people with very warm hearts. 

Clemencia is 45 years old and married, with 3 children aged 17, 15 and 12, all of whom are studying at a school in the city. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop. With the work of both spouses, they have been able to build their own home. 

Clemencia has a tailoring shop in her home. She does not have fixed working hours, and she works every day from Sunday to Sunday. She learned how to cut and tailor clothing at an academy, and now she makes all types of garments.. 

She has been in the communal bank for 2 years, and she has a great friendship with all of the members. The funds from her loan will be invested in part in buying fabric, and also for the expenses related to her son's graduation thesis. 

Her goal is to have a much larger tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric and pay expenses for her son's graduation thesis.

loans.name: Paula Cecilia

texts.es:
Paula de 32 años,  es una mujer emprendedora  que inicio su actividad hace 10 años en vista que tuvo que ayudar a su familia debido a que su padre falleció. Su negocio le a servido para suplir en algo las necesidades básicas de su casa.

El negocio lo tiene en su domicilio normalmente lo atiende todo el día, los fines de semana vende comida en  la esquina de su casa su mama le ayuda en el trabajo. Lo que más le afecta es la movilización ya que se quiere comprar un vehículo para facilitarle en la comprar de mercadería. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos, herramientas de costura para aumentar sus ganancias. En un futuro poder tener una vivienda propia ya que donde vive le pertenece a su mama y la divide en varios familiares.
texts.en:
Paula, 32, is an enterprising woman that started her activity ten years ago, knowing that she had to help her family because her father passed away.  Her business has helped her provide some of her home’s basic needs.  Paula's business is based in her home and she usually tends to it all day.  On the weekends she sells food on the corner of her home, with her mother's help.

What affects Paula most is mobility, so she wants to buy a vehicle to help her purchase her merchandise.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise which will allow her to increase her income. In the future she wants proper housing, since she lives with her mother and shares the home with several family members.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and sewing tools

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Yucay,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Luis; es soltero, la socia tiene 20 años de edad, el socio se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, el socio siembra maíz, verduras el socio según la época siembra todo tipo de verduras entre las que encontramos repollo, zanahorias, zapallo, y otras; el socio desea comprar fertilizantes, semillas y abono, el socio tiene su terreno y ahora en esta nueva etapa el socio desea invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sembrar nuevamente maíz. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y abono.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”. This bank is located in the settlement of Yucay, the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Jose Luis. He is single and 20 years old. The member primarily works in agriculture planting corn and vegetables. Depending on the season, the member plants all types of vegetables including cabbage, carrots, squash and others. The member wants to buy fertilizers, seeds and manure. The member has his land and in this new season the member wants to invest in buying fertilizers and manure to plant corn again. The member is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and manure.

The member is very thankful for the loan and promises to complete his payments on the loan in a disciplined manor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 60 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio su negocio de papelería con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.

Labora sola en horacios de 07H30am a 18H00pm. Su esposo trabaja de cerrajero. La dificultad en su negocio es la delincuencia que es muy frecuente por el lugar. 
Con el préstamo va a comprar articulo par su papelería  así aumentar sus negocios. En un futuro quiere tener un negocio y estable.
texts.en: Maria, age 60, is a hardworking woman who started her own stationary store business in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She works alone from 7:30am till 8pm. Her husband is a locksmith. The main difficulty for her business is the high crime rate in her neighborhood. Maria will use the loan to purchase inventory for her stationary store in order to expand her business. In the future, she is hoping to have an established and profitable store.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a stationary store

loans.name: Maria Orfelinda

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años de edad, es casada  y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío Punto cuatro, Sialupe , un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. Ella cría animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general. Adicionalmente María ella tiene un pequeño establecimiento desde hace 4 años en su domicilio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea adquirir algunos animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar sus ventas, asi también comprar algunos productos para su bodega. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria, age 31, is married and lives with her husband and her two children in the Punto cuatro settlement in the Sialupe district -- a district populated by humble and hardworking people who make their living through agriculture. Sialupe is part of the Lambayeque province; it is located about forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria grows barnyard fowl and small farm animals; she has been in this line of work for over ten years. She grows her animals in the backyard of her home and when they reach a good level of development, she sells them to the local merchants as well as to the general public. In addition, for about four years, Maria has had a small convenience store in her home where she sells groceries and basic necessity products. This business allows her to cover her personal expenses and helps with the financial needs of her household.

Maria would like to purchase some additional animals and balanced animal feed in order to increase her sales; she would also like to purchase some inventory for her convenience store. For this reason, she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Haydee; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de empanadas, ella prepara las empanadas de carne y pollo y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de empanadas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, pollo, carne y manteca para preparar las empanadas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee, age 25, lives with her partner and has one son. She is a member of the communal bank QORILAZO; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province which is located in the department of Cusco.

Haydee divides her time between her daily activities and her empanada business (empanada is a South American stuffed bread/pastry). She prepares meat and chicken empanadas and then sells them around the neigborhood from 8am to 1pm. This business provides the income Maria needs to raise her children. 

Maria would like to expand her empanada business and she is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour, chicken, meat, and butter that are necessary for the preparation of empanadas. She is very happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients (such as flour, chicken, meat, and butter) necessary for the preparation of empanadas

loans.name: Dorian Danilo

texts.es:
El señor Dorian es un cliente de 26 años, es empleado en una empresa de perforación de pozo profundo para riego, habita en calidad de inquilino en la zona oeste de la ciudad de la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.
El señor Dorian presta sus servicios en calidad de ayudante perforista en la empresa San Rafael Hidro, quienes se dedican a la perforación de pozos de agua para riego en las aéreas rurales del departamento de Cochabamba.
Su actual vivienda cuenta con los servicios básicos completos.

El crédito que solicita el señor Dorian es para la construcción de una habitación sobre un lote de terreno que tienen en calidad de herencia, de esta manera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ya que no tendrán que pagar alquileres
texts.en:
Dorian is a borrower who is 26 years old. He is an employee of a company that drilles deep wells for irrigation. He lives as a tenant in the western zone of the city in Cercado province, in the department of Cochabamba.

Dorian provides his services as a drilling assistant for the San Rafael Hidro company, which drills water wells for irrigation in the rural areas of the department of Cochabamba.

His current housing has all of the basic utility services. 

The loan Dorian is requesting is to build a dwelling on a plot of land which he has inherited. In this way, he will be able to improve his living conditions, since he will not have to pay rent.

loans.use: to build a dwelling to live in.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; es casada, la socia tiene 34 años de edad, la socia tiene 4 hijos de 13, 11, 9, 5 años de edad, la socia se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo y siendo esta zona conocida como tierra sagrada por tener los granos de maíz grandes y dulces, ellos producen el mejor maíz de  Perú para exportación, la socia siembra y cosecha maíz,  y vende en jora para elaborar la famosa bebida inka, la chicha de jora. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la nueva siembra de maíz.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA” community bank which is located in the village of Rumichaca, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Vilma is 34 years old, married, and has four children aged 13, 11, 9 and 5.  Vilma's main business activity is farming and she owns her own farmland.  This area is known as sacred land because they grow the biggest and sweetest corn kernels.  They produce the best corn in Peru for export.  Vilma sows and harvests corn and sells jora corn which is used to make the famous Incan drink 'chicha de jora'.

Vilma is requesting this loan to invest in buying seeds for her new corn crop.  She is very grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying seeds for her new corn crop

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar es padre de familia de 2 pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Hace tiempo el señor adquirió una vivienda de interés social que por lo regular son muy pequeñas y la fachada que tienen son muy sencillas, este crédito será el tercero que tramita en esta institución donde ha demostrado una buen historial de crediticio y agradece el apoyo brindado por que con estos créditos ha podido realizar sus proyectos. 
Omar ahora en este préstamo desea remodelar la parte de enfrente de su casa y para esto necesita comprar material de construcción y pintura para darle hacerle una bonita fachada y diferente al que su hogar
texts.en:
Omar is the father of two young children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Some time ago, Omar acquired a house through a government-subsidized housing program.  These houses are generally very small and the exteriors are very simple.  This loan will be the third that Omar has had from this institution.  He has a good credit history and he is grateful for the support that he has been given through these loans which have enabled him to carry out his projects.

Omar would like to use this loan to remodel the front of his house.  He needs to buy building supplies and paint so that he can make the front of his home look nice.

loans.use: to remodel the front of his home

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas está formado por 1 socio y 8 socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares.  Viven por diferentes parroquias y sectores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene hermosos paisajes naturales para visitar, es la tercera ciudad de mas importante del país y fue nombrada en 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, toda su gente es muy amable y cordial.

La Señorita. Diana C. se encuentra en el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa del banco.

Nuestra socia tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus abuelitos a quienes les ayuda económicamente.
 
La Señorita. Diana estudio 2 años en una academia de costura y está ejerciendo su profesión hace un año, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde en una fábrica que confeccionan jeans.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar.
 
Su meta es tener un taller de confección  para producir sus propios productos.
texts.en:
The Nuevas Amigas (New Friends) community bank has nine members (one man and eight women).  They all work in different businesses which allow them to contribute financially to their households.  They live in different parishes and sectors of the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city which has beautiful natural landscapes to visit.  It is the third most important city in the country and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  Its people are all very kind and friendly.

Diana C. is receiving her first loan through the community bank.  She was invited to join by a friend who is an active member of the bank.

Diana is 19 years old and single.  She lives in her grandparents' home and helps them out financially.  She studied for two years in a sewing academy and she has been carrying out her profession for one year.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 8.00am to 6.00pm, in a factory where they make jeans.

Diana will use her loan to buy food for her household.  Her goal is to own a dressmaking workshop so that she can make her own products.

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como gallinas, ella los hace crecer y engordar y luego lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Huancaro, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de gallinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gallinas y alimentos para las gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Delia, age 30, lives with her partner and her two children. She is a member of the communal bank “QORILAZO”; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Delia divides her time between her daily activities and her poultry business. She grows chickens and later sells them in the Huancaro market. Delia would like to expand her chicken business and is seeking a loan to purchase chickens and chicken feed. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro y su esposa desde hace tiempo compraron un terreno, que con ahorros propios fueron construyendo lo que ahora es su casa. Ramiro es un hombre muy trabajador al igual que su esposa; esto lo hacen con el fin de ofrecer a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y un patrimonio para el futuro. 
En este momento se le esta presentado una oportunidad para arreglar las escrituras de su terreno, que por circunstancias económicas no realizaron hace años, una oficina de localidad esta ofreciendo arreglar estos documentos a un bajo precio para que esta familia tenga todo en regla. El señor Ramiro no cuenta con el suficiente capital para aprovechar esta oferta recurre a esta institución para pedir un apoyo y así arreglar sus documentos para que no afecten en un futuro.
texts.en:
Ramiro and his wife bought a plot of land some time ago.  They have been using their own savings to build what is now their home.  Ramiro and his wife are very hard-working people.  They did all this so that they could offer their two children a better quality of life and assets for the future.

Right now, there is an opportunity for Ramiro to sort out the deeds to his land.  He did not do this years ago due to his economic circumstances.  An office in town is offering to sort out these documents for him, at a low price, so that he can have everything in order.  Ramiro doesn't have enough capital to take advantage of this offer.  For this reason, he is requesting the support of this institution so that he can sort out the documents to ensure that he doesn't experience difficulties in the future.

loans.use: to pay to sort out the deeds to his land

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María es madre y esposa, lo cual para toda mujer es un reto sobre todo mezclarlo con el trabajo, ya que es muy difícil estar al tanto de la familia cuando se labora en una maquiladora o en alguna institución. Por lo que Ana María sustituyo trabajar para una empresa, para iniciar su propio negocio donde ella pueda tomar sus propias decisiones. Desde hace 4 años instalo una papelería y novedades llamada “Doña Ana” en su propio hogar donde le permitiera estar al tanto de los quehaceres del hogar y no descuidar a sus 3 pequeños que necesitan la protección. 
Ana en este momento desea comprar más mercancía para el negocio como lo es papelería y mercería para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a su clientela y de esta manera seguir obteniendo un ingreso para apoyar a su marido con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana María is a mother and a wife which is a challenge for any woman, especially when they also work, as it is very difficult to look after your family whilst working in a maquiladora (cross-border assembly plant) or some institution.  For this reason, Ana María decided to stop working for a company in order to set up her own business where she could make her own decisions.  Four years ago, she set up a stationery and novelties store in her own home called “Doña Ana”.  This allowed her to stay on top of her housework and not neglect her three young children who need her protection.

Right now, Ana would like to buy more merchandise for her business, such as stationery supplies and sewing supplies, so that she has a wider variety of products to offer her customers.  In this way, she will be able to continue making an income to support her husband with their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORILAZO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina; ella tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papa, la socia vende papa en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar deudas personales como educación de sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vicentina is a member of the communal bank “QORILAZO”; the bank is located in the district of Cusco in the province and department of Cusco. 

Vicentina is 25-years-old. She lives with her partner and two children. She juggles her daily activities with her potato selling business. She sells potatoes in the streets and works from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. With this business she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand the potato selling business and she's requesting this loan to pay off personal debts, such as her children's education.

Vicentina is happy about the loan and she promises to make the payments.

loans.use: pay off personal debts, such as her her children's education.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: La señora Sara es madre de 3 pequeños por lo cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace unos años adquirió su vivienda de interés social y que le toco la fortuna que el gobierno le regalara su vivienda por lo que ahora solo le toca realizarle varias mejoras. El proyecto que desea realizar es poner techo al frente de su casa para que este mejor protegida del sol ya que en esta ciudad los temperaturas son muy altas. Sara necesita comprar material de construcción y pagar mano de obra para que su proyecto quede realizado.
texts.en: Sara is a mother of 3 small children to whom she wants to offer the best quality of life. Years ago, she acquired her home via public housing. She was lucky and the goverment gave it to her, so now she only has to make several improvements. The project she wants to do is to put a roof on the front of her house for better protection against the sun, since this city has very high temperatures. Sara needs to buy construction materials and pay for labor costs for her project to be done.

loans.use: to put a roof on the front of her house.

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
Hercilia tiene 41años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos menores hijos  en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos y a apoyar a su esposo en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de animales (ganado ovino y caprino)

Hercilia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de belleza para exhibirlos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Hercilia, age 41, is married and lives together with her husband and two young children in the Olmos district -- an agricultural area with a lively commerce which is located in the Lambayeque province, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Hercilia makes her living selling beauty products through a catalog. She commercializes them among friends and neighbors and every day makes a great effort to attract more clients since her income depends on the volume of orders she can place for the company that provides her with the inventory. This business allows her to cover her expenses and to help her husband with the financial needs of their household. In addition, she also sells livestock (sheep and goats)

Hercilia would like to expand her business with the purchase of more inventory of beauty products that she could showcase in her home -- this way her clients will be able to get the products immediately rather than have to wait till the end of the month for the delivery of the order. To achieve this goal, Hercilia has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca C., 62, a resident of Phase 5-A, Bulihan, Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Pedro C., a carpenter, and is the mother of six children. Three of them are already settled with their own families and the other three are working.

Francisca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her variety store, she is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Francisca prays that her children will grow deeper in their relationship with the Lord. She also dreams that her business will become bigger and eventually turn into a convenience store. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: José Jesus

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus seis hijos en el distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

José se dedica desde hace 4 años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino, los cuales cría en un ambiente dentro de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

José desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Jose, age 31, is married and lives with his wife and their six children in the Olmos district of the Lambayeque province, located about two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For four years, Jose has been making a living by raising and commercializing sheep and goat livestock. He raises his animals at home, and when they reach a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the general public as well as to the merchants who visit the area. With the income from this activity, Jose is able to provide for his family.

Jose would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals and balanced animal feed, thereby increasing his sales. For this reason, he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 soles.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and animal feed

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el caserío Paredones que se ubica a 10 minutos del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Lucrecia se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente pavos, gallinas, patos en un corral situado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos como maíz, polvillo y purina, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside y en la ciudad de Chiclayo también negocia sus animales a los comerciantes. 

Lucrecia desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucrecia is a 33 year old wife and mother. She is married and lives with her family in the community of Paredones, located 10 minutes from the district of Mórrope. This an agricultural district that is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Lucrecia raises and sells small animals, especially turkeys, chickens, and ducks in a pen located in back of er house. She feed them with grains such as corn, meal and purina. when they have reached a good size, she sells them to the merchants who visit the area where she lives. She also sells her animals to merchants in the city of Chiclayo.  

Lucrecia wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed to grow her business and make more income. For this, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Milton Roger

texts.es:
Milton es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad, es casado y  reside junto a su familia, ene le sector Las Delicias, en una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por su esposa. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente Milton ofrece servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Estas actividades le ayudan con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que la bodega de Milton ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, y agregar otros productos como útiles escolares que le permitan incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Milton is a 50-year-old father. He's married and lives with his family in the Las Delicias area, a marginal urban zone of the city of Chiclayo, a metropolitan area in the north of Perú.

He owns a small general store in his home that's run by his wife. They sell a diverse array of essential products and groceries to their neighbors and customers. The business is well-appreciated. Milton also offers a taxi service in Chiclayo. These activities help him economically sustain his family.

The recent great demand for the bodega's products has made him consider expanding it by adding more products, such as school supplies, that will help him increase his sales. This is why he's requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles ($375 USD) from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: buy products for his general store

loans.name: Unur

texts.en:
Unur, who is 38 years old, resides with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a small house in the outer ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) districts. Unur supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, while her husband supports the family by planting cucumbers in his yard.

When Unur started her business in 2000, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian (MNT) in working capital. Today, her business has grown so that she now has 2,000,000 MNT in working capital. For the past 11 years, Unur has been selling jean trousers from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and the profits have helped sustain the family and improve their living conditions. For example, she and her husband were able to buy their own yard upon which they built their small house with their business earnings in 2010. Unur is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more jean trousers.

Unur wants to expand her stall with this loan and then be able to build their own small pickled cucumber enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase more jean trousers.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida F. is 52 years old, married, and has two working children and one child who attends high school. She is a resident of Phase 5-A, Bulihan, Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. 

At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her youngest child to college, a dream for most Filipino parents like Adelaida, as she herself is a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Adelaida has had a tricycle operation (a motorcycle with a passenger cab) for six years now. She hires a driver and remits to her 150 PHP for a day. 

She also manages her own tailoring business while overseeing operations of her ready-to-wear clothing business and a variety store. She mainly sells curtains, bedsheets, blankets, and other items for the home. She also provides clothing such as uniforms and does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 every week from her tailoring business and variety store.

To help her continue operations of her businesses, she is requesting a loan for PHP 23,000. She will be using the loan to pay for the repair of her tricycle and to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She also plans to use the loan to buy additional grocery items as replenishment for her variety store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her businesses.
