She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repair of her tricycle and additional items for her tailoring business and store.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi F. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 59 years old and married. She has six adult children.

Laxmi owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In the photo, Laxmi is shown with her husband, who operates the motorcycle.

In 2006, Laxmi joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional stocks and products for her store.

Laxmi is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase accessories for motorcycle repair and painting. This will be her 12th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for motorcycle repair and painting.

loans.name: Lanier De Jesús

texts.es:
Lanier, tiene 28 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad La Pita, ubicada en el municipio Miraflor, Estelí, de oficio agricultor, esta casado tiene dos hijos, lleva 6 años dedicándose a la siembra de hortaliza de forma independiente. Empezó con ayuda de su papa a la edad de 10 años, su padre le enseñaba a preparar la tierra, pero difícil situación económica le impidieron seguir con sus estudios, se tuvo que dedicar tiempo completo a trabajar para poder subsistir y ayudar a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra de siembra de tomate. Le ayudara a aumentar su producción, sacar mejor rendimiento de su cosecha de tomate. 
Tiene como planes futuros ampliar su siembra de tomate, sembrar chiltoma y cebolla, le gustaría poder venderlos fuera de Estelí en los departamentos de León y Managua. Su próxima meta es sembrar 3 manzanas de maíz y ¼ de manzana de frijol.
texts.en:
Lanier, aged 28, lives in La Pita, a neighborhood located in the municipality of Miraflor in Estelí. He is a farmer, married and the father of two children. He has been an independent vegetable farmer for six years. He began working with his father when he was 10 years old and learnt how to prepare the field. However, financial hardship prevented him from finishing his studies and he had to work full-time to survive and provide for his family.

Lanier applies for this loan to maintain his tools, buy supplies and pay laborers to grow tomatoes. It will help him increase production and get a better return on his tomato crop.

His future plan is to expand his tomato crop, and to grow sweet peppers and onions. He would like to sell them outside of Estelí, namely in the departments of León and Managua. His next goal is to plant 2 hectares of corn and 17 ares of beans (5 and 0.4 acres, respectively).

loans.use: to maintain his tools, buy supplies and pay laborers to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Éctor

texts.es:
Don Ector, es originario de la comarca Santa Teresa, ubicada en el municipio de Condega- Estelí, esta casado, es padre de familia de 4 hijos, de oficio productor de granos básicos , lleva 37 años dedicándose a esta actividad. Inicio a temprana edad tenia diez años de edad, ayudaba a su papa a sembrar, solo llego hasta quinto grado de primaria, por su situación de pobreza se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para poder llevar alimentos a su hogar, no pudo seguir estudiando. Su papa le dejo de herencia 2 metros de tierra la cuales ha venido cultivando y ha sido sustento de su familia hoy en día. También dentro de su propia el  tiene una pulpería donde vende granos básicos que el mismo siembra su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio. 
Solicito el crédito para siembra de maíz y frijoles. Con este crédito espera poder sacar una buena producción, con granos de calidad, obtener buenas ganancias que le ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos. Le gustaría poder comprar una moto para trabajo, tiene como planes futuros aumentar sus terrenos de siembra, pues desea ampliar su venta y poder convertirlo es una distribuidora de granos básicos para abastecer de sus productos a su comunidad, y asegurarles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Don Éctor lives in Santa Teresa, located in the municipality of Condega-Estelí. He is married and the father of four children. He has been a farmer for 37 years and grows basic grains. He began this activity at the young age of 10, helping his father with planting. He studied only until fifth grade in elementary school. Poverty forced him to work and get food on the table, and he could not continue studying. He inherited two plots of land from his father, which he has cultivated since that time to support his family. In addition, he owns a store where he sells home-grown basic grains. His wife helps him attend the store.

Éctor applies for a loan to grow corn and beans. With this loan, he hopes to harvest a great amount of high-quality grains and get a good profit, enabling him to increase his income. He would like to buy a motorcycle for his work. For the future, he plans to expand his farm land and increase his sales, becoming a distributor of basic grains to his community. He wants to ensure a good future to his children.

loans.use: to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
A skilled person in manicure and pedicure is our featured entrepreneur in this story. She is Mrs. Evangeline D., 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. She and her husband are blessed with four children who are all school aged. 

To help her husband, Evangeline decided to engage in a manicure and pedicure business. At this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than PHP 3,000 a month from her services rendered to her loyal customers and friends. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC 2 years ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a fourth cycle loaner, she has requested PHP 5,000 to be used in purchasing additional manicure and pedicure kits for her business. 

The future income from this business will be used for daily basic needs, savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that some day, all of her children will become successful in their education.

loans.use: to buy additional manicure kits for her manicure and pedicure services.

location.town: Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercy E. is 41 years of age, married, and a resident of Migpangi, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. She and her husband have six children, of whom four are already married and the rest are still single and at their adolescent stage. 

The couple has been engaged in fishing as owners and operators of a fishing boat locally known as “Sakayan.” For over 30 years, they’ve been in this kind of business to support the family. At this time they are earning an average net income of not less than PHP 4,000. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC 1 year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services. As a second cycle loaner with a good credit record, she has requested PHP 7,000 to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing supplies. 

The future income from this loan will be used to meet their daily needs, to repay the loan and to save for the future. She is hoping that this project will yield a good catch with God’s help.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 42-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 5, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends kindergarten. Altantsetseg supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She is a professional expert on merchandise. She worked as expert on merchandise from 1993 to 1996. 

When she first began her business, she had 1,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 3,000,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers from Ereen, a border city of China. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to increase her jeans and trousers variety.

Her goal is to expand her business and then to be able to improve her daughter’s education.

loans.use: to increase her product variety.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes B. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Lourdes is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes provides motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services with her husband as the driver for local community members. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2011, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for maintenance.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta L. is from Mercy Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old. Loreta is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Loreta owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing & shoes from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Loreta has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Loreta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loreta is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional T-shirts & blouses. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Loreta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional T-shirts & blouses.

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa is 36 years old and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family does not own their apartment yet, but they have a mortgage loan from another bank in order to eventually own it. She has been on schedule with her mortgage loan payments to date. It is her family’s goal to one day own their apartment.

Nyamdavaa’s husband is working in Korea while her daughter attends a local public school. Nyamdavaa supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

When she first began her business in 2002, she had 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Today she has 3,000,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers in her stall. With this loan of 1,000,000 MNT, Nyamdavaa will purchase stylish jeans to increase her product variety. 

Her family’s goal is to be secure in their own apartment.

loans.use: to purchase stylish jeans.

loans.name: Bernaliza

texts.en:
Bernaliza L. is 23 years old and married to Bryan, a contractual worker. She is a college graduate and decided to run a micro-enterprise. She is a resident of Bancal, Carmona, Cavite City, Philippines. 

Bernaliza has operated their own internet cafe for two years now.  She rents out computer units at a low charge per hour to all surfers, social networkers and even to students who would like to do their research on the Internet.  She also offers printing job, encoding, scanning and photo printing. With this business, Bernaliza earns an estimated net income of around 350 PHP a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for the cost of upgrading hardware and computer programs to compete with other neighboring Internet cafes. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for upgrading computer programs and hardware.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M. is from the village of Lacas, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Estrella is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, candies, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Estrella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen L., 39, resident of San Isidro Labarador 1, Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Macario L., a vendor, and is the mother of four children, two of whom are already working, while the others are still in school. By the grace of God, Helen has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send the rest of her children all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Helen, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Helen operates a fish stall. Fish is bought fresh from nearby ports and piers, packed in ice and then brought to the local markets. Helen and her husband clean, gut and chop fish per customer orders. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 350 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fish for their everyday inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Helen dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes that her family can migrate and work in other countries in the near future. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish fresh from ports and piers.
